This city is visited because of its natural beauty and its architecture. It has a gastronomic variety that captivates the palate of its own citizens and of visitors.

Doña Gloria is 31 years old. She is married and has four children, ages 14, 12, 10, and 8. Her two oldest daughters study at a secondary school, and the two younger children go to a little school in the city. Her husband is an electrician. They don't have their own home, so they are renting.

Señora Gloria has been working for a cleaning company for two months. She works from 4 in the afternoon until 11 at night. In the morning, she knits purses which she sells to her acquaintances.

This is her second loan from the communal bank. She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of materials to make her purses, such as fasteners, threads, buttons, and wool.

Her dream is for them to have their own house.

loans.use: to buy thread, fasteners, buttons, and wool.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 52 years old, married, and has 6 adult children. Lilian is engaged managing a general (sat-sari) store. She offers different products such as canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, detergent soap and condiments. With these activities, Lilian usually earns 3000 PHP a month.

Lilian joined ASKI to gain financial assistance to improve her business. She already paid back a previous loan amounting to 5000 PHP and now is requesting a new loan of the same amount. She will use the loan to buy inventory of products like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and soap. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy stock of products like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 36-year-old lady. To support her family financially, she operates a business sewing clothes. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month due to her good quality work. In addition to her clothes sewing business, she also manages her household work very well.  
She is married with four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband operates a grocery store in the community market. At his store, he offers daily use items like sugar, cooking oil, spices etc to his clients at cheap rates. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will put more groceries in his store, which will allow him to fulfill the demands of his clients and earn extra profits. Shamshad is hopeful that an investment will grow her husband’s business and allow her family to enjoy better living facilities. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shamshad.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 53-year-old married man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He makes "bahalina" (coconut wine) for a living. Victor sells his product to the people in his community.

Victor has requested a loan to purchase materials for his bahalina business like containers. He hopes for his business to grow and for his family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase containers for his bahalina (coconut wine) business

loans.name: Gbla Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Agnes was born in northern Sierra Leone, and she is 45 years of age. Agnes is married and has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Agnes sells cooked rice and has been doing this business for 12 years now.

Anges and her colleagues in the group have applied for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leone leones for each member in the group from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to further expand their respective businesses. With the help of this loan, they will buy more inventories to add to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and increase profitability and, consequently, improve their living standards. 

The leader of the group, Agnes, is going to use her share of the loan to buy cooking ingredients — rice, palm-oil, fish, etc. — in bulk in order to produce a larger quantity of cooked rice for sale.

(Attached on the right of the group photo is the photo of a borrower who was not able to be present for a group photo).

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients — rice, palm oil, fish, etc. — in bulk in order to produce a larger quantity of cooked rice for sale

loans.name: Malian

texts.en:
Malian is 30 years old. She has one ten-year-old child who is in school and is married to man who sells second-hand clothes. Malian sells second-hand clothes too and she has been selling these clothes for the past seven years. She works with her husband. They built their own house from this business. 

Malian is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
Wennie is from the village of Cabungaan, three kilometers away from the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 43 years old, married, and a mother of nine school-age children.

Wennie is a farmer. She plants and harvests corn to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for over 20 years. Quarterly, she earns PHP 21,000 from farming. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to pay the labor costs for harvesting and milling.

Wennie has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Wennie hopes to purchase a hectare of land for corn plantation and gain more profit.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for harvesting and milling.

loans.name: Yahosca

texts.es: La señora Yahoska es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Masaya ciudad de las flores. Ella se dedica a la venta de  perecederos desde hace 13 años principalmente plátanos y papayas en los cuales invertirá el crédito con la compra de una camionada de plátanos y papayas.
texts.en: Yahoska is a hardworking, enterprising woman from Masaya, the city of flowers.  She has been selling perishable items for the past 13 years, mainly bananas and papayas.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a truckload of bananas and papayas.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of fruit.

loans.name: Sabari Kadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Fatimata représente le groupe SABARI KADI. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Il a 04ans Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes depuis 10ans. Mme s’approvisionne au grand marché et au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 11 complets pagnes.

Mme épargne ses économies pour agrandir sa boutique. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto et voyager pour amener ses pagnes puis d’autres articles.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatimata is the leader of the group SABARI KADI. She is married and has one child. He is four years old and doesn't yet attend school. She is responsible for one person.

She has been selling fabric skirts for ten years. She buys her inventory at the Grand Marche and at the market in sector 10. Her clients are both men and women.

She wants to purchase 11 complete fabric skirts.

She plans to save money to grow her shop. She would like to purchase a motorbike and to travel to sell her fabric skirts and other articles.

loans.use: to purchase 11 complete fabric skirts

loans.name: Jorge Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 49 años de edad, tiene hijos ya adultos, independientes económicamente, y vive en su propia casa, situada en la ciudad de Encarnación. El señor Jorge es mecánico, posee un taller de chapería y pintura desde hace varios años en su domicilio, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace tiempo, ya que es su vocación. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela, ya que muchos de sus vecinos van a reparar sus vehículos en su taller.
El se considera un hombre muy luchador y emprendedor, ya que pese a los contratiempos que tuvo pudo salir adelante con su negocio. Comenta que todo lo que realiza es por darle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar su taller con lo cual podrá agarrar a más clientes.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para el taller, para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con alguno de los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Jorge is 49 years old.  He has children who are already grown and financially independent, and he lives in his own home, located in the city of Encarnación. 

Señor Jorge is a mechanic.  He has had a workshop in his home for the last several years, where he does bodywork and painting.  He has been working in this field for a while, as it is his vocation.  He says that he has a good customer base, and that many of his neighbors come to repair their vehicles in his workshop.

He considers himself to be a very hard-working and enterprising man, who in spite of setbacks, has been able to move ahead in life with his business.  He comments that everything that he has done is to give his family a better style of life.

One of his dreams is to be able to expand his workshop, so that he can take on more customers.  

He is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his workshop, as in this way he will be able to deliver on any of his customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his mechanic's workshop.

loans.name: Tsedenjargal

texts.en:
Tsedenjargal is a 46-year-old married business man who has a daughter and a son, and lives in the capital city of Ulaanbaatar in Mongolia. His family lives in a ger (a Mongolian felt yurt) on his sister’s land.  Both of his children attend local universities and his spouse helps him operate the small family business.  

He has been operating a clothing business since 1995, in Mongolia's largest outdoor market. Currently, he rents one small stall where he sells men’s suits, women’s coats and jackets. His working capital is approximately three million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks).  
  
Tsedenjargal is requesting a 1,000,000 Tugriks loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the autumn season and to increase sales. With his business profits, he was able to buy a new car; now his aim is to have his family's own plot of land and build a new house.  This will allow his family to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell for the autumn season.

loans.name: Tamba R.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are among the first borrowers that SMT/Kiva lenders are disbursing to in the city. Like their counterparts in other regions of the country, these borrowers are going to use this loan for different purposes. Some will use it to pay school fees for their children, others will buy house-building materials, pieces of furniture, etc. And at the end of each month, they will repay their loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s burser is directly responsible for making the deductions and repaying SMT/Kiva on their behalf.

Tamba is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kono about 54 years ago, Tamba is a husband and father of nine children – four in primary school, three in secondary school, one in college and one grown-up. Tamba has been a professional teacher for 37 years now. He has requested this laon in order to educate his children and complete the construction of his house.

loans.use: to pays his children's school fees and buy cements, etc. for the construction of his house

loans.name: Sherry

texts.en:
Sherry is a woman with one child aged 6 years old, whom she hopes to give good education to the university level. She describes herself to be jovial and welcoming. 

She operates a beauty salon business where she does ladies hair. Besides this business she also operates a poultry keeping business. She has been involved in this salon business for 6 years. Her business is located within a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenges to be the low purchasing power by the target customers. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase a hairweaves and other hair additions. 

She plans to grow her salon and poultry keeping businesses and in future become a renowned business lady in Mombasa.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and other hair additions

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo tiene ya más de tres años con su negocio de abarrotes el cual es la fuente de ingreso.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar de mercancía que es (verduras, fruta, productos de lácteos, quesos, leche, y también reparaciones del cableado de la luz  en el local) ya que para el es muy importante que su negocio este en buen estado y que tenga suficiente mercancía para vender. 
Don Guillermo planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermo has now had his grocery business for over three years.  It is his source of income.

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as vegetables, fruit, dairy products, cheese, and milk. The loan is also to repair the wiring to the lighting in his place.  It is very important to him that his business be in a good state and that he has sufficient merchandise to sell.

Guillermo plans to pay for the loan with the income he gets from the sales in his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to repair the lighting in his place.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y tiene una hija D. 6 años, administra una tienda donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, este negocio surgió con la colaboración D. su esposo, decidieron juntos empezar para generar ingresos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. gaseosas, boquitas, galletas y dulces, con este préstamo realizara la compra que requiere para mejorar el negocio, con esta inversión espera mejorar el negocio, y poder proveer a su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and six-year-old daughter. She manages a store where she offers basic necessities. María and her husband worked together to establish this business because they decided to start generating income.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy sodas, snack food, cookies, and candy. This loan will enable her to purchase what she needs to improve her business. With this investment, María hopes to improve her business and proviD. her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snack food, cookies, and candy.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married. She is 45 years old with 5 children and she lives in Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur.

Lolita manages her own business venture, selling fish to make a living for her family. She has handled this business for more than 11 years. Each month she earns 6,000 PHP doing this kind of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy more materials for fishing and to purchase more fish to sell.

Lolita has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She will keep the returns for her family's daily needs and for the educational plan of her kids. She's hoping that her business will be blessed by the Lord until all her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy more materials for fishing and to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more products such as cooking oil, body lotion, books, and juice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make wooden furniture.

loans.name: José Libardo

texts.es:
A sus 68 años de edad, Libardo quien se dedica a la musica en el municipio de Sonsón al norte de Antioquia de donde es oriundo, este emprendedor espera montar una tienda de productos propios de la canasta familiar en un local ubicado en su propa casa, lo que le permitirá genrar mayores ingresos para su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Libardo, necesita de un préstamo para adecuar el espacio donde montará su tienda, así como para pagar la mano de obra que realizará dichos arreglos.
texts.en:
At age 68, Mr. Libardo is a musician in the city of Sonsón, north of Antioquia where he was born.  This entrepreneur wants to open a store that sells his own family products that he will set up and run from his home.  This will allow him to increase his income to improve his family’s quality of life.

Mr. Libardo needs a loan to be able to set up the space for the store and pay for labor to do so.
.

loans.use: to set up his store.

loans.name: Yieza

texts.en:
Yieza is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Yieza is married and has three adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Yieza owns and operates a business venture providing construction supplies (such as hallow blocks) to local community members. Yieza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Yieza is requesting a loan of 17,521 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. In 2007, Yieza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 54 years old and married. She has five children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family.

Oliva has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells items like soft drinks, coffee, sugar, vinegar and spices. Oliva works hard to improve her earning. 

She requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as eggs, cooking oil and canned goods. Oliva hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as eggs, cooking oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Johanna Yomayra

texts.es:
La Señorita. Johanna es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno,  su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres.
 
La Señorita. Johanna tiene 25 años de edad, es soletera y está embarazada de 7 meses, vive en casa con sus padres, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella trabaja medio tiempo en un mini mercado de la ciudad, actividad que la realiza hace 2 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, negocio en el que se encuentra hace 5 años.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para aumentar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es  tener un negocio más grande de venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Johanna is a member of the Renacer Uncovia communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca, one of the most important cities of the country, a mix of colonial and modern.  There its people follow the traditions and culture of their forefathers.

Johanna is 25, single,and seven months pregnant.  She lives in her parents’ rented house since they don’t have their own home.

She has worked part-time in a mini market and for the past 5 years in her free time she has been selling Yanbal cosmetics.

The communal bank is in its second loan cycle and she will use the money to increase her merchandise.

Her goal is to have a bigger cosmetics sales business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, rice and maize flour for preparing food

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has nine children. 

Crisanta has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy bananas and coconuts for sale.

Crisanta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts for sale.

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Ha sido comerciante de diversos artículos desde hace mucho tiempo y ha ido variando su oferta de acuerdo a lo que le pidan sus clientes.  Trabaja sola todo el día, recorriendo diversos sectores de la ciudad.  Es soltera y no tiene hijos, aspira a futuro poder crecer mucho más con su negocio e incrementar sus ventas de manera sustancial.  Por ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de blusas, pantalones y ropa interior para su venta.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 37 years old and he is a businessman. He runs a retail shop in his neighborhood. He is married and has two children under his care. 

The way he got into the business is that he was a driver and the income that he got from the job is what he saved to start the business. 

He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy stock of flour, cooking oil, and rice for sale in the shop. He has a vision of running a successful wholesale business in the next five years. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, cooking oil, and rice

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, eggs, rice and other items. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are daily. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, eggs and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, eggs and other items

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr:
Joceline a 43 ans. Elle habite dans une zone rurale et est mariée à un gardien. Le couple a 2 enfants. Dont l’ainé est le seul à étudier. 
Elle est dans la culture de tomate depuis juin 2014, Elle cultivait sur une petite surface de champs de 1 are. Le manque d’argent lui a été un blocage car elle en avait besoin pour pouvoir s’acheter de l’engrais et payer les laboureurs. Donc, le prêt servira à acheter des semences de tomate, de l’engrais de zébu, de l’engrais de volailles, de l’engrais faites à base d’urée, de l’engrais faite d’azote-potatium-(NPK), et aussi pour rémunérer les travailleurs pour leur main-d’œuvre.
Son objectif est de pouvoir cultiver sur des champs un peu plus vaste c'est à dire environ 3 ares, c'est à dire étendre et développer l'activité.

loans.use: acheter des sémences de tomates, des engrais bio et chimiques, et payer les salaires des laboureurs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 30 years old.Both of her parents has passed away.She is not married ,but she takes care for her two brothes and a sister.She runs a  hairdressing business in a small premise in Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam.She has employed one assistant in her business. She usually faced with shortages related to materials for her business.Also the current premise she rented is very small that it cannot accommodate six customers at a go.She is in a plan to look somewhere where she can get a bigger premise at a reasonable price.She experienced most difficulties relating to this small premise during x-mass.This condition made her lose so many customers.She want to improve this condition by renting another premise with enough space and adding sufficient amount of hairdressing materials,sitting chairs,a fan and a television set to entertain customer while in a waiting queue.To effectively implement her plan  she need an additional working capital of USD 550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia has 2 years of experience in this business. She used to work as a seamstress, and with the help of her children she has succeeded in starting a business selling school and office supplies. She works every day of the week from 7 AM until 9 PM. Her son helps her with the business and the sales.

Virginia wants this loan in order to be able to invest in school supplies, because the school term is starting here and there is a high demand.

Virginia is a single mother. She has 4 children, of whom only one still lives with her. The others have moved out, but they help her out when she needs it. Virginia has been separated for 10 years. She still has a good relationship with her children's father, and he helps support the youngest child. She hopes with this investment and the income it generates to be able to remodel a place in her home to display her merchandise.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To invest in school supplies

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguard my capital to ensure continuity in business. All these are words of Mrs. Stella E., married with eight (8) children. She is requesting $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
After her husband died three years ago from cancer, Marciana O. D. G. started her despensa, convenience store, at her house. She moved into one of the children's room and converted her own room into a small convenience store. She was a housewife before her husband passed away, but soon after had to learn to start her own business and was able to recuperate with the help of her friends, neighbors, and family. Marciana is 60 years old and a mother of three children ages 31, 21, and 15. Her 21-year old and 15-year old child are both students studying at a technology school and are still dependents and living with her. Marciana does not travel to the city to buy her merchandise. She only sells the products that other vendors bring to her and usually repays them every week for the merchandise.

Marciana only makes enough to live every day and support her children. She does not have any extra savings but has to save money to pay her electric, light, water, and telephone bills. She has a truck that belonged to her husband that she wants to sell but cannot sell it because she has no one to sell it to.

Marciana is a member and president of a group called Mujeres Emprendedores. There are 20 women in her group, where members proviD. collateral through a group repayment pledge and the incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members will be responsible for making up the payment amount. In addition, their group also has a separate savings box where each member contributes about $.20 each week. Together their group also fundraises, for example it provided food for the festival for San Juan.

Marciana is very grateful for being able to be part of a group that is respectful and honest. She is looking for a loan to be able to purchase the drinks and bread that she receives every day from the vendors that come to her house to sell.

loans.use: Purchase bread and drinks.

loans.name: Ni Komang Ayu Sumber

texts.id:
Even though a house wife, Komang Ayu Sumber Astuti has a hobby of rearing pigs. With a capital of Rp.500.000, Komang Ayu bought 2 piglets for fattening. Her profit is Rp.75.000 per month. With the financial assistance from Dinari, Komang Ayu bought additional 3 piglets and increased her monthly income to Rp. 225.000. With this income Komang Ayu helps her husband Made Sugita to raise her 3 children who are still schooling. They lived in their own made house.

Translated from bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga Komang Ayu Sumber Astuti mempunyai kegemaran memelihara babi.Dengan modal Rp.500.000 Komang Ayu memelihara 2 ekor babi untuk penggemukan . Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.75.000 perbulan . Biaya per hari yang diperlukan untuk pakan adalah Rp.20.000.Dengan pinjaman di Dinari, Komang Ayu membeli bibit babi sebanyak 3 ekor, sehingga kini babi yang dipelihara sebanyak 5 ekor. Komang Ayu mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 225.000.- perbulan. Dengan keuntungan yang diperoleh tersebut, Komang Ayu bisa membantu suaminya I Made Sugita untuk menghidupi 3 anaknya yang masih sekolah. Mereka tinggal bersama dirumah yang mereka bangun sendiri, walaupun sangat sederhana.

loans.use: Membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukkan - Buying piglets.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Mr. Lucio C. lives with his wife and three children in the Pasankeri zone on the western side of La Paz. Lucio is employed by a small construction company and his wife sells clothing in a traveling shop. With previous loans the family has completed two rooms on the ground floor of their home and a concrete slab. This will be the 15th time that the family has requested a loan. A socioeconomic analysis shows them to have good credit and approves the loan. All of the previous loans have been fully repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Lucio C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Lucio es empleado en una microempresa de construcción y su esposa vende ropa en un puesto de venta ambulante en nuestra ciudad. Con créditos realizados anteriormente, realizaron la construcción de dos habitaciones en planta baja y una loza de cemento.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones en planta alta, en la losa de hormigón que tienen ya construido.

Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Construction of two rooms.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.en:
Akoua K. is a 34-year-old single mother. She has one child and lives in Sassandra, a rural city on the south-west Atlantic coast of Cote d'Ivoire. She has a little restaurant in Sassandra market where she sells various local foods especially "Attieke and fish," that is, cassava couscous and grilled fish. Her main customers are factory workers and tradesmen and tradeswomen operating stands in the market.

Akoua's foods are much appreciated. She uses the income from her little restaurant to support herself and her daughter. Akoua wants this loan to purchase various ingredients and fish for her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase fish and other ingredients for the cooked food she sells

loans.name: Luis Raúl

texts.es:
Luis Raul is a young man that wants to progress in life. Currently he is studying during the weekend, and in the weekdays he sells used clothing items. His parents do not have enough money to pay for his school and he did not want to be an additional burden for them, so that is why in 2005 he started working with a woman that sells used clothing and slowly he was able to be independent and get his own business. “My dream is to finish my professional studies and then start my own company, and that is why I started this small business that will allow me to continue with my studies”, he says.

Currently Luis does not have enough merchandise to offer to his clients, and that is why he is asking for a $750 loan which he will repay in 6 months. With that money, Luis will be able to buy merchandise that he will be able to offer to his clients. With your help Luis will be able to continue his college studies.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis Raúl es un joven que tiene todo el deseo de salir adelante actualmente está estudiando los fines de semana y entre semana se dedica a vender ropa de segunda. Todo comenzó en el 2005 que con el afán de no ser una carga más para sus papás quienes no tienen dinero para pagarle sus gastos en la escuela, que Luis comenzó a trabajar con una señora que vende ropa usada y poco a poco se fue independizando hasta formar su propio negocio. “Ya que mi sueño es terminar una carrera profesional y después iniciar mi propia empresa, fue por eso que me decidí a poner este pequeño negocio que me permitirá salir adelante con mis estudios” comentó.

Actualmente Luis no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes es por es oque está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Luis podrá comprar nueva mercancía para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Luis podrá estudiar su carrera universitaria.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke A., 57-years-old, has six children. Her family lives in the Oshodin area of Lagos State, Nigeria. Since 1992 she has been selling building materials. Mrs. A. is requesting a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional inventory for resale.

loans.use: To purchase building materials inventory for resale

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Don Emilio is a person devoted to his family and his work. He works side by side with his wife, she as his helper, to minimize their expenses and in this way be able to offer a better education to their children. He is starting his fifth loan, having kept an impeccable loan history.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Don Emilio persona entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, trabaja lado a lado con su esposa, ella como su ayudante, esto para minimizar sus gastos y asi poder ofrecer una mejor educacion a sus hijos. Esta ingresando a su quinta secuencia de prestamo, teniendo un historial impecable.

loans.use: Buying tires, batteries, and fixing the upholstery (Compra de llantas , bateria y  realizar algunos arreglos en el tapizado de los asientos.)

loans.name: Sukati

texts.id:
Sukati with her family live in a Rp 160,000/month rented room at Jl. Mertasari, Gang Laksamana Suwung Kangin. In front of the room, she built a booth to sell ice, "gado-gado" (vegetable salad) and other daily needs. Her customers are those who live around her rented room. The income earned from the sales is used for financing her children tuition fee, which are now in junior high school.

Sukati proposed to use the loan to add the capital so that she could increase the variation of the goods sold in her booth. In running the business, Sukati is assisted by her husband. They use their motorcycle to go to the nearest market to purchase the goods to be sold.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Sukati saat ini tinggal di Jl.Mertasari, Gang Laksamana Suwung Kangin, dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan Rp.160.000/bulan. Dia tinggal bersama keluarganya dan sekarang keadaan mereka sehat. Didepan terasnya dibuat sebuah warung kecil unutk berjualan es, gadoogado dan kebutuhan sembako lainnya. Para pelanggannya adalah mereka yang tinggal disekitar tempat kostnya. Dari hasil usahanya klien yang dibantu juga oleh suaminya bisa menyekolahkan anaknya sampai SMP. Dari pinjaman kali ini klien berharap bisa dijadikan sebagai tambahan modal usaha untuk memperbanyak jenis jualan diwarungnya sehingga warung sembako miliknya menjadi lebih lengkap. Ibu Sukati memiliki sepeda motor yang biasanya dipergunakan sebagai alat transportasi untuk belanja kebutuhan sembako dipasar terdekat.

loans.use: To increase sales value

loans.name: María Trinidad

texts.es:
Maria is married and has two children who are 23 and 25 years of age and who are independent economically since they both work. She began her business five years ago. She and her husband suffered a strong economic crisis after their eldest child was in an accident and died. He had his own business, a mechanic shop, and left some debts which Maria and her husband had to cover. Thankfully, his business has continued and has become a fountain of income and an escape that has allowed them to overcome the loss of their son. Maria started her business five years ago . She opened a beauty shop asa result of her eldest son having an accident and passing away.

She is requesting a loan of US $675, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to invest in materials for her business. In this manner, she will be able to provide better service to her customers. With your contribution, Maria will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

María es casada y tiene dos hijos de 23 y 25 años, que son independientes económicamente ya que los dos trabajan. Inició el negocio desde hace 5 años, su esposo y ella tuvieron un crisis económica muy fuerte a raíz de que el mayor de sus hijos tuvo un accidente y murió, El tenia su propio negocio era mecánico y dejo algunas deudas, que tuvieron que cubrir su esposo y ella, y gracias a dios su negocio ha progresado, y hoy para ella su negocio a sido una fuente de ingresos y un escape para poder superar la perdidas de su hijo. Comenzó su negocio hace 5 años empezó su estética a raíz de que su hijo mayor tuvo un accidente y falleció.

Solicita un préstamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir material para su negocio y de esta forma para poder ofrécele un mejor servicio a su clientela. Con tu contribución María saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla T. lives in Popeal Khaer Village in Kandal Province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Mrs. Phalla T. is a widow with four children, two of whom are working in factory while the others are enrolling in school. Although the members in the family have different business activities, they are also in a poor condition. Additionally, they live in an old house. In order to make Mrs. Phalla T.’s family member's lives more improved, Mrs. Phalla T. decided to ask for a loan to fix her old house. Previously, Mrs. Phalla T. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to cure a family member of a disease.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to fix her old house.

loans.name: Thi Vinh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Vinh, 45 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2000. She lives with her husband and her 2 grown up children. Her family's income comes mainly from farming and breeding pigs. Her first loan of 2,000,000VND was used to invest in breeding pigs. After that, she was more confident to borrow and expand this model of rearing pigs. Currently, she is also raising chickens and ducks. Besides raising livestocks, her husband also carries out transportation service so their family's income is stable. Her 2 grown-up children also have stable jobs. This time round, she would like to borrow 10,000,000VND (600USD) to purchase more animal feeds to raise livestocks. She will also purchase more pigs. Her family's monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 258USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Vinh năm nay 45 tuổi. Chị là thành viên Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Hiện tại chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành. Thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị vay vốn vòng đầu là 2.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi lợn.Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi. Hiện nay N.ài chăn nuôi lợn gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm gà, vịt. N.ài thời gian giúp vợ chăn nuôi tại gia đình, chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề chở hàng thuê vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị luôn ổn định. Hai con của chị đã trưởng thành và đã có việc làm ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để mua thức ăn dự trữ phục vụ cho việc chăn nuôi của gia đình. Chị cũng sẽ sử dụng vốn để mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Breeding pigs

loans.name: Elizabeti

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Elizabeti is thirty-six years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She has an additional dependent, Benjamin, whom she takes care of because his parents are unable to provide for him. She owns a beauty salon in Dar es Salaam that she runs along with one employee and with the assistance of her children. Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. Elizabeti earns about 300 USD per month from the salon as a result of working long hours every day of the week. She is requesting a loan of 275 USD to purchase cosmetics, wigs, and other hair products for her salon. In the future, with increased profits gained by serving additional clients, Elizabeti hopes to expand her business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.g

loans.use: To buy additional supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Là một người phụ nữ sống ở vùng nông thôn đã lâu năm nên cô K. đã có rất nhiều kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000 với số vốn vay ban đầu là 700.000 đ cô K. đã sử dụng để đầu tư mua lợn về nuôi. Tận dụng nguồn thức ăn sẵn có của gia đình và những kinh nghiệm đã tích luỹ được trước đó nên dự án đã đem lại cho gia đình  nguồn thu nhập ổn định. Từ dự án chăn nuôi nhỏ đó đến nay qua 8 năm vay vốn và sử dụng vốn hiệu quả,  cô chú đã tích luỹ được số vốn đáng kể để đầu tư xây dựng khu chăn nuôi khá quy mô. 
Để có thêm vốn đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi vòng vốn tới gia đình cô K. mong muốn được vay 18.000.000đ
Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
texts.en:
As a young women living in the rural area for quite some time, Ms. K. has a lot of experiencing raising farm animals. She has been a part of this organization since the year 2000 with an initial loan of 700.000d. Ms. K. had used the money she received to buy hogs to raise. With her past experience in raising farm animals, she is able to conserve and prepared the right amount of food sources to each animals; therefore, stabilizing her family’s income. From a small ranch and 8 years later from borrowing capital, she has seen a success. She and her husband are able to save up, expanding and upgrading their ranch. Ms. K. is hoping to borrow 18.000.000d to buy more hogs. Her monthly income is 4.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Lorena está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 8vo crédito, con este préstamo pretende repellar la  casa, trabaja como docente de la escuela el Triunfo  desde hace 8 años, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 10 años, estudia su quinto grado de educación primaria y la niña menor de 8 años,  a pesar que no tiene la ayuda del padre de sus hijos ha salido adelante con ellos, pues es una mujer que trabaja duro, con dos plazas de docente, ella se caracteriza por ser honesta y muy trabajadora, actualmente está estudiando su tercer año en la Universidad URACCAN, vive en la zona # 8 de Nueva Guinea, recibe la ayuda de su mamá quien le ayuda a cuidar los niños, su sueño es seguir estudiando, tener salud, y que sus hijos estudien   y  no le falte nada y contar con estabilidad laboral
texts.en:
Ms. Martha Lorena is requesting to refinance her loan with the intent to repair her home. For the last 8 years, she has been working as a teacher at the Triunfo School. She has two children with the oldest now 10-years old studying in the 5th grade and the younger son, now 8-years old. Although she has no help from the father of her children as he has left them, she is a hard working woman with two teaching positions. She is characterized to be honest and diligent, and is currently in her third year at the University of URACCAN. She lives in Nueva Guinea’s zone 8, and receives help from her mother who also helps to take care of the children. Ms. Lorenas’ dreams are to continue studying, have good health and that her children get an education, without missing out on anything and that they get stable jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the walls of her house

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two grown children. She sells womenu's clothing, bags and purses in the central marketplace in Pavlograd. She has two vending facilities and has been running them successfully for about 12 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about 30,000 Grivnas and her income is about 8,000 Grivnas a month. 

Irina can be characterized as a reliable and stable client. She treats her customers with all due respect and politeness. This business has been the only source of income for her family. Irina has contributed much effort, energy and commitment to success of her venture. She is ready to move on and achieve even higher goals. 

She is seeking a 1500 Grivna loan ($275 USD) to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosks.  

NOTE: This is a short-term, seasonal loan that will be repaid in one month.

loans.use: To purchase bags and purses

loans.name: Ama Ametowoyona

texts.fr:
Madame N. Ama Ametowoyona est née en 1960 à Adangbe, une des villes de Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, et son mari est un magasinier.  Elle a pour activité la revente des produits génériques dans le quartier d’Agoè, une activité qu’elle a commence depuis 2000. 
Elle n’a jamais bénéficié du crédit au près de WAGES.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 50 boites d’Iron Tonic, 40 boites de Feromin, et 18 boites de Vitaglobin. Avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ms. Ama Ametowoyona N. was born in 1960 in Adangbe, a city in Togo. She is married and the mother of four, and her husband is in the warehouse business. Her work, which she began in 2000, involves selling generic pharmaceutical products in the Agoè district. She has never been a recipient of a loan from WAGES. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 50 containers of Iron Tonic, 40 of Feromin, and 18 of Vitaglobin. With this new inventory, she will do better in her sales and realize a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en:
Barikisu A. is 32 years old, married, with three children. Barikisu lives with her family in a town called Goaso. Goaso is a farming community in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. The inhabitants produce food crops like maize, yam, millet, beans, etc. Her first two children are currently in elementary school while the youngest has not started school yet.

For nine years, Barikisu has been selling products like beans, soya beans, groundnut, rice, vegetable oil and other food items in the neighborhood market. Barikisu buys her goods from farmers in her town and surrounding villages. She says that food vendors buy in large quantities from her. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy bulk goods and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes the loan will help her save money to support her children's education. 

Barikisu is a member of the community group called “Do Good” Trust Bank group. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support and assistance to one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk goods

loans.name: Tavakal

texts.ru:
Косимов Тавакал 1971 года рождения. Он женат, имеет 2 детей. Тавакал занимается торговлей угля, дров, и сельхоз – продуктами. В связи с тяжелым финансовым положением он при помощи знакомых решил начать свой бизнес. На свои сбережения он арендовал маленькое место на базаре в городе Вахдат. Получаемый доход стал основным источником в его семейном бюджете. Закупает он товар в оптовом рынке. Тавакал имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Опыт у него в этой сфере 6 лет.   
Для увеличения товарооборота, то есть покупка угля хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tavakal K. was born in 1971. He is married and has 2 children. He sells coal, firewood and agricultural products. Due to the current difficult financial situation, Tavakal started his business with the help of his friends. He used his savings to rent a small retail space at a market in Vahdat. Now the resulting profit solely provides for his family. Tavakal buys his goods at a wholesale market. He also has consistent customers and a six-year experience in the business. To increase the goods turnover and to buy coal, Tavakal wants to obtain this 10-month $875 loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coal

loans.name: Rhodalyn

texts.en:
Rhodalyn G. is a vegetable vendor in Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. Their place is a big community with seven “puroks” (districts) and is part of the Agriculture Reformed Community (ARC) in the municipality of Tumauini. Her husband is a fisherman since they are living near the Cagayan River. They have four children: Jessica – 15 years old, an elementary graduate; Joseph – 11 years old, currently entering grade four; Felix Jr. – 10 years old, in grade three and Jonalyn – 9 years old, in grade two.

Having limited sources of income, Rhodalyn and her husband are striving to work hard to support the needs of their family and send their children to school. For the improvement of her business, Rhodalyn is asking to borrow PHP4,000 to finance her vegetable vending business. She hopes that through her business, she can uplift their living condition and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora A. is a widow and the mother with five children. One of her children is in the training college, while the rest are in the senior and junior high school. She lives with her family at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. She is 52 years old. She has sold children's wears, like shirts, straight dress, napkins and skirts, underwear, slippers, and dressing bags for over nine years.

She is, however, constrained by funds in running the business. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business in order to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced. She would be able to purchase a large quantity of high quality goods, upgrading her inventory. She would also be able to cater for the children in school.

Dora says she would be grateful for that assistance. She belongs to a village bank called "Me Hwe Awuarde" which means "Am looking up to God." She also hope to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase underwear, dressing bags, slippers, and other inventory to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Angeles inició el negocio porque ya que aprendio este oficio de su madre y cuando tuvo complicaciones financieras lo vio como una posibilidad para salir adelante, entonces  empezó a ofrecer sus servicios de costurera,  hace aproximadamente 5 años

Inicio solo con una maquina sobrehiladora que le heredo su mama haciendo trabajos  sencillos pero al paso del tiempo tomo cursos sobre patrones de costura lo cual le dio la experiencia para elaborar uniformes escolares y disfraces para toda ocasión

Actualmente le va muy bien, ya que cerca de su casa se encuentra una escuela con la que ya tiene tiempo de hacer sus uniformes también le dan trabajo algunas empresas de la localidad para que les maquile sus uniformes industriales, ademas puso un puesto de venta de perfumes en un mercado que se instala sobre la calle donde ella vive, lo que le da otros ingresos adicionales.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas ya que tiene planeado comprar material de trabajo como: telas, botones, hilos, zipper, etc... para hacer los disfraces de la primavera ya que en los colegios de la localidad  ya tiene algunos pedidos.
texts.en:
Maria de los Angeles began the business because she had learned this trade from her mother and at a time when she was facing financial complications she saw it as a possibility to get ahead in life. She began to offer her services as a seamstress approximately 5 years ago. She began with only one sowing machine that she inherited from her mother by doing simple jobs, and as time passed she took classes on sowing patterns that gave her the experience to assemble school uniforms and costumes for all occasions. Currently things are going very well for her, given that a school is located near her house for which she has made uniforms for some time. She also gets work from various local companies assembling their industrial uniforms; in addition, she installed a perfume sales stand in the market located on the street where she lives, which gives her an additional form of income. She needs a loan of 4,000 MXN that she will pay in 10 installments, given that she is planning on purchasing work materials such as: fabric, buttons, thread, zippers, etc., to assemble the spring costumes that have already been requested by local schools.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase work materials such as: fabrics, buttons, threads, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Catherine K. from Mwanza. She is single with two children, between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. Catherine has been running a grains business since 2002. Catherine sells grains to different customers. She works at the business for 12 hours a day, 6 days per week. Catherine currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more grains and then sell them to customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Catherine thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more grains and then sell them to customers.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria luz es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Maria Luz es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, vive en el distrito de Acocro, Maria Luz tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras. Además Maria compra cereales, productos que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maria Luz necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, cereales y papa.
Maria Luz sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Luz is a member of the Retoño community bank. Maria Luz, 30, is married and has 3 children. She lives in the Acocro district. Maria Luz has a store in her house where she sells general groceries and vegetables. Maria also buys cereals that she later sells in Ayacucho city. Maria Luz needs a loan of 3,000 PEN to buy rice, cereals, and potatoes. Maria Luz dreams of building her house in Ayacucho city and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, cereals, and potatoes.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Gifty works as a seamstress at Shama Junction near Cape Coast. Her husband is a trader. Gifty uses her income to assist her husband with the upkeep of their family.

Gifty will use the loan to purchase materials for sewing. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gifty plans to build a house, so she is saving for it.

loans.use: Gifty will use the loan to purchase sewing materials for sewing.

loans.name: Nheng

texts.en:
S. was born in 1979; she is a married woman and blessed with three children. All three of them are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Im, 30, and he works as a security guard for a customs service.

S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for S. and her family, S. has requested a loan of US$ 500 in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children. Two are in school while the last one is still being breastfed. She is a very hardworking young mother who works all day. She operates a hairdressing salon in front of her house. She has been in business for 18 years now. She always tries new styles for her clients and, because of that, many people comes to her to have their hair done. She requests a loan to buy a hair dryer, weavings, etc. to service her clients. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Blessing’.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer, mesh, weavings, etc.

loans.name: Hushnuchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Хушнучон Сангинов занимается животноводческой деятельностью около 5 лет. В этом ему помогают брат и мать. Жена Хушнучона домохозяйка. Она выполняет все обязанности по дому и воспитанием  детей. Хушнучон начал откармливать скот, количество которых  состояло из 2 овец. Шаг за шагом,  на часть от полученной прибыли, он покупал еще  дополнительно овец. На сегодняшний день количество овец  в его стаде составляет 6 голов и 1 корова.
Дополнительный доход Хушнучон получает от  выращивания лука и плотнического ремесла. 
Он подал заявку на КИВА, для того чтобы КИВА совместно с нашей организацией поддержали его, так как он планирует дополнительно купить скот в свое стадо.
texts.en:
Hushnuchon S. has been involved in animal husbandry close to 5 years. His brother and mother help him with this business. Hushnuchon’s wife is a homemaker. She takes care of all home obligations and raises the children. Hushnuchon started feeding livestock, which consisted of 2 sheep. Step by step, using part of his profits, he purchased additional sheep. Today, his herd consists of 6 heads of sheep and 1 cow. Hushnuchon receives supplemental income from growing onions and carpenter services. He put in a request with Kiva in order for Kiva, together with our organization, to support him because he plans to buy additional livestock for his herd.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of additional livestock

loans.name: Mr. Choum Chev Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people living in Ta Nu village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mr. Choum C. is the 37-year-old village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Toek Lat, is employed in a garment factory.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn not enough income to improve the family's living conditions. In order to improve the living conditions, Mr. Choum C. is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise. He is the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study.

Note: Mrs. Srou C. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina B. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. She is 59 years old. Agripina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Agripina operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cows for sale. Agripina is just starting this business.

In 2007, Agripina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agripina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Agripina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Agripina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur lives in Baku. This man has his own greenhouse. 10 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving his greenhouse

loans.name: Aurea Monica

texts.es:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Aurea es casada, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Aurea junto a su hermano tienen una panadería en donde elaboran queques, tortas, productos que venden en la misma panadería. También tiene una polleria en un local alquilado. Además Aurea tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de su mama.
Aurea necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Aurea son tener sucursales, ampliar sus negocios y que sus hermanos menores culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de harina.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Since Hasan R. was very young, he has dedicated himself to raising livestock. He is married and the father of three children. Hasan hopes to purchase calves. He will raise animals and sell their offspring to small farm operators. To acquire the animals, Hasan came to IMON International for credit and this will help him maintain his dear home.

----------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase calves.

loans.name: Vencita

texts.en:
Vencita F. is from the village of Southern Looc. She is 60 years old. Vencita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Vencita owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Vencita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Vencita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vencita successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Vencita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Vencita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Can Wange Pe Acayo Christine Group

texts.en: A. Christine is the group representative. She is a fifty-year-old businesswoman, married with six children. Four of her six children are in schooling. She has a fish selling business and she has been operating this business for over ten years. She is requesting this loan to purchase fish for sale. She wants to add stock to her business. She is a promising, hard working busy woman whose dream is to obtain livestock (cows) for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Asa

texts.en:
Asa P. is a 33-year-old woman who lives in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Asa grows and sells fruits and vegetables. Asa has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 320 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Asa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. She used her previous loan to buy farm supplies and equipment. Asa is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST to buy farm supplies and equipment. This will be Asa's second loan from SPBD. Asa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve her family's living conditions.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad M.'s main source of income comes from providing photocopying services in her community. She is 47 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Alicia, Isabela. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Felicidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Felicidad is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide photocopying services

loans.name: Abbako Tech/voc Makeni Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers are teachers and staff members of a technical vocational institute in Makeni town. The institute was established in 1985 to create “education for self reliance” for the children of Makeni and its environs. Today, the school has a total of twenty-three staff and 145 pupils. The institute is made up of a Junior Secondary School and a Tech Voc, where pupils are trained in various technical and vocational skills like weaving, tailoring, carpentry; “gara” tying and dyeing; secretariat and business study courses, and a lot more.

Teachers from this institution, like many other teachers within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf. Muctarr S. (back row, third from left) is the head of this group of teachers. The 47-year-old is a Head of Department at the institute. He has served at this institution for twenty-four years now.

Muctarr is married to a secretary and they have four children who are in secondary and primary schools respectively. With his share of this loan, Muctarr will buy house-building materials like cement and corrugated iron.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials like cement and corrugated iron

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza E. de 46 años de edad, vive en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino. Es una mujer muy trabajadora durante cinco años se ha dedicado a administrar su negocio la alquiler de cuarto, alquiler de teléfono y venta de helados para mejorar los ingresos y poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos básicos de agua, luz y otros, y a
 Sus hijos los cuales cursan la secundaria, su esposo se desempeña en servicios de seguridad y su salario es bajo. Con el préstamo anterior logro construir un muro en la parte de enfrente para mejor seguridad de su familia todo gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic ha apoyado. Con este préstamo seguirá haciendo mejoras para el futuro de su familia, construirá otro cuarto en la parte de atrás del solar para poder alquilarlo también. Para esto comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc y otros para comenzar la obra. Muy contenta ya que gracias al financiamiento ha logrado las expectativas en las mejoras de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza E. is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Memorial Sandino. She is a hardworking woman and has been managing her businesses for the past five years. These include renting out rooms, renting out telephones, and selling ice cream so that she can improve her income and help her husband with basic expenses such as water, electricity, and other necessities.

Her children attend high school. Esperanza’s husband works as a security guard, but his salary is low. With her previous loan, she was able to build a wall in front of her house to provide better security for her family. She thanks AFODENIC for providing financing and assistance. With this new loan, she will continue making improvements for her family’s future. She will build another room on the back of her property that she can also rent out as well. In order to do this, she will purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and other materials to begin work. Esperanza is very happy because the financing has met her expectations in helping improve her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and other materials

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is fifty-three years old. Lourdes is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling sweets and confectioneries, such as cookies and cakes in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 120,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Lourdes's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a freezer and Sodabi, a local drink

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita P. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang Cagayan De Oro City. She is 47 years old. Sherlita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Sherlita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a variety store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products. She also offers variety of dried fishes in the local community. Sherlita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sherlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sherlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Ewoi

texts.en:
