Ewoi is 48 years old, married to Pauline Atabo, and they have four children. He has been selling charcoal in small quantities in Naivasha town for the last four years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy 2 more sacks of charcoal, which he will divide and sell in small quantities to his neighbors.

He plans to start selling cereals on the side in the near future to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 3 Group

texts.en:
Glenia is the coordinator of her group, Unidas Para Triunfar (United to Triumph), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Santiago, an urban area known for its tobacco industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and four children.

Glenia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and believes that Esperanza helps people most in need like her. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, making bed coverings and sheets, by purchasing fabric. She will use the profits to invest in school supplies for her children and accruing savings. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Fabric for the production of bed covers and curtains

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 24498 	No. de Foto: 214

Francisco P. S. tiene 57 años, es casado, y  tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 
Francisco trabaja en la agricultura y la albañeria para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, fréjol en menos proporción, algo de papas y también a la cría de chanchos.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves y en su casa.
En los tiempos libres se va de paseo con su familia, además le gusta las fiestas del carnaval celebrar con la familia y los vecinos.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos y la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Francisco P. S. is 57 years old, is married and has 6 children. He lives near San Miguel in the Bolívar province.

The member is a part of La Palmera communal bank it is in a rural area, and it is an hour and a half from Cantón San Miguel. There are 16 members in total, it is an agricultural community and a few are cattle-dealers.

Francisco works in agriculture and as a mason to improve his family’s finances. The crops that stand out in his production are corn and beans in a lower rate, some potatoes and he also raises pigs. He sells his products in the San Miguel market in Thursday’s fair and in his home.

In his free time, he enjoys outings with his family; he also enjoys carnival parties to celebrate with family and neighbors.

The member needs the loan to buy goods for his field work and above all for fertilizers and manure. Francisco’s goal is to have a good economic activity for the family and to buy a car for work. The challenges that he faces are due to climate, the diseases that hurt his crops and the lack of money to buy goods for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds for production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: 44-year-old Lolita D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has five school-aged children. Lolita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also plants vegetables on her land and also grows hogs. She has been doing this for more than two years already. Lolita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and additional piglets and feeds. This loan will be her fifth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Carlos Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. M. M. Carlos Jesus vive en Lujaraja perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene su esposa y un hijo a su cargo. El Sr. M. trabaja como operario de producción en la fábrica IQF del Perú desde hace 6 meses. Vive en casa de sus padres quienes le han cedido una parte de la vivienda para que viva. El Sr. M. solicita el financiamiento para la construcción de un cuarto a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. El Sr. M. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesus Carlos M. M. lives in Lujaraja which is in the Santiago district. He supports his wife and one son. Mr. M. works as a production worker in the IQF factory of Peru where he has been for the past six months. His parents have granted him a part of their home as living quarters. Mr. M. is applying for financing for the building of a room so he may offer a better quality of life to his son. Mr. M. appreciates the support we are able to offer him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvement

loans.name: Fuelina

texts.es:
Fuelina es viuda y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Fuelina tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Clara en donD. venD. mercería como jabones, cuchillos y algunos artículos D. ferretería, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos, además Fuelina venD. sus productos en la feria D. San Juan los días domingos.
Fuelina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita y solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. jabones, cables D. luz.
Fuelina sueña con tener una tienda D. venta al por mayor, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Fuelina is a widow, and she has four children who go to school. Fuelina has a stand selling merchandise like soaps, knives, and some hardware items in the Santa Clara market. She does this activity everyday with her children’s help. Fuelina also sells her products at the San Juan fair every Sunday. Fuelina is a member of the Santa Rita Communal Bank. She is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles, which she will use to buy soaps and light cables. Fuelina dreams of having a wholesale store, giving her children a good education, and continuing to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps and light cables

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en: Benigno A. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 58 years old, married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Benigno owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Benigno has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 42,000 PHP per harvest. In 2007, Benigno joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benigno has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. Benigno is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Benigno from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of two school-age children. He has owned his shop since 2000 where he sells beauty products, perfumes and gadgets. In addition to selling his products from his shop, he also works as a traveling salesman. His story illustrates, on a day-to-day basis, the challenges facing Lebanese fathers in trying to satisfy their families’ needs. They always try to find new opportunities to earn income. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 to increase his store inventory to stock up before the coming holidays in Lebanon. During the holidays, his sales will increase and he needs to be prepared. He intends that his business productivity will grow as a result of the loan. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (e.g. blanking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese micro-finance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in micro-finance. At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement to its micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US$115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please click here.

loans.use: To increase his store inventory

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda B. is from the village of Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old. Imelda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: Luisa Amanda tiene 48 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi, con la ayuda de su esposo es que han logrado salir adelante, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento pues ha sido de muy buena ayuda. Ella está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener su hogar, ya que inicio con fondos propios. Este crédito será invertido en cambio de llantas, pintura entre otras cosas. El desea obtener otro taxi y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda is 48 years old and provides taxi services. With the help of her husband, they have manages to get ahead. The loans have been of great help; this will not be her first one. She is looking for a way to increase her income to support her household. She started her business with her own funds and will use the money from this loan to buy new tires, paint, and other things. She would like to buy another taxi and fix up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Group For Used Shoes

texts.en:
Solomon G., holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Group For Used Shoes. He is 40 years old, married, and has three children between the age of five and sixteen. He was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For five years, he has sold used shoes on Broad Street, down town Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 57,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of used shoes. He describes himself as a determine man whose goals are to expand his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy W. M. is 34 years old and single. She is a hardworking business lady and a seamstress. She also sells ready-made clothes. She has been in business for five years.

Mercy has benefited from Faulu Kenya because she has learned how to keep business records and has better customer care skills. With the loan of 20,000 KES she will buy fabric for making more clothes. She hopes to open another outlet for her business in the future and employ people.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana is married with two children. She sells clothing at the central market in Drogobych town. Oksana has been in this business for 13 years. Oksana understands people and their needs. She has great communications skills that help her to be good in this business. She loves selling clothing and would like to develop her business further. Oksana is requesting 5,500 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventories.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a 53-year-old man, married and very hard working. He is the head of five family members living in a self-owned permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His desire is to have a good standard of living for his family. Clovice has been into tea farming, which he ventured into after having been a businessman. He has now been in the tea plantation business for five years and, with such vast experience, he sees his business growing and being a role model plantation farmer. Clovice intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his tea plantation.

loans.name: Danny Isabel

texts.en:
Danny Isabel A. A. is 36 years old. She lives in the village of Bello Horizonte Tejedores in the district of Tambogrande. It is a relatively tropical region with a significant number of small farms. Danny owns her own home and shares it with her husband and their three children. Her husband works as a farm hand for local property owners.

Danny manages a small business selling foods and juices. She sells her products in the nearby town of Tejedores, which is approximately five minutes away. She sells her products on a daily basis to local workers during meal and snack hours. 

This is Danny’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to use the loan in order to expand her inventory and improve the service she provides to her customers. She hopes to be able to increase her clientele and increase her income. She is proud to provide for her family and to work independently.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Marlene De La Cruz

texts.es: La señora Marlene de la Cruz E., tiene la edad de 42 años, habita en la comunidad Rural de la Enramada, es casada, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, ella y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura contando con una experiencia de más de 13 años, fue con el apoyo de su esposo que se inicio en estas actividades de la siembra, es para sus terrenos que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes y fungicidas que le brinden un mantenimiento Fito Sanitario y mejoren día a día la producción y así mismo incrementen el nivel de ventas, para un mejor desarrollo socio económico en beneficio de toda su familia, y a futuro sin problema alguno puedan diversificar las siembras y remodelar su humilde vivienda con vision a su retiro en un lugar digno donde morar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marlene de la Cruz E., 42, lives in the rural community of Enramada.  She’s married and has three adult children.  She and her husband are farmers.  They have over 13 years experience.  She started out in farming with her husband’s support. 

She is asking for a loan for her fields.  She wants to buy farming supplies: fertilizers and fungicides that will provide good maintenance for her crops so that production will improve daily thus increasing sales so that she will have better economic development for the benefit of her entire family.  She hopes in the future to be able to diversify her crops problem free and to remodel their humble abode with the goal in mind to have a dignified place to retire to.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
This is Bernadette T., age 44 and resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Damaso T., a vendor, and together they have four children, all of whom are managing the household and helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Bernadette has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Bernadette operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies in wholesale price and selling them at piecemeal rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more supplies of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Bernadette dreams that her business will continue to mature and be successful. She also prays for continuous physical and spiritual strength so that she may be able to continue her work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon K. is two years old married to Helima Kandie who is a house wife.  He has a daughter named Renee Kemboi who is two years old.

He practices horticulture and he has been in this business for two years and right now his monthly income is Kshs 12,000.  He is borrowing a loan of Kshs. 40,000, that he plans to to use the loan as follows: Kshs. 36,000 to buy pipes for irrigation, Kshs 4000 for labour.

He will use the anticipated profit to diversify his business into keeping poultry.  This is his third loan, and he paid his previous loan successfully. His dreams and hopes is to expand horticulture and to have dairy farming in the near future.

loans.use: To buy pipes for irrigation and labour for poultry keeping

loans.name: Dilbarkhon Bokoeva's Group

texts.en:
The following story is about a woman, who feels a big responsibility for all who are dear to her. She hopes to make every single member of the group happy by offering each one a part of the loan. 

Dilbarkhon B., 49, is a leader of this group. For the past two years, she and her husband have been involved in a cattle reselling business. Most of the work is done by Dilbarkhon, because her husband’s main occupation is construction. Purchasing cattle is not a simple process. Customers usually pay careful attention to the physical appearance of the animal, its health and price. Sometimes Dilbarkhon has to wait several days in order to sell the cattle at a good price. Thanks to her good bargaining skills, she is usually successful. Unfortunately, she doesn’t get help from her children in taking care of the cattle, because all three of them are pursuing a degree in the bigger city of Osh. She is happy with how life has turned out and wishes her children the best. After thorough consideration of the financial possibilities, Dilbarkhon applied for a loan, which she would like to spend on buying more cattle. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora J. is 59 years old. Leonora is married. To make a living, she cultivates decorative trees to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

Leonora is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which again will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Esperanza En Paraiso 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
María es la coordinadora del grupo Esperanza en el paraíso, localizado en la ciudad de Puerto Plata, una ciudad cuya actividades principales es el turismo y una fabrica de ron, también esta ciudad es fuerte en el sector inmobiliario, son las principales fuentes de trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta de Joyas, Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

María posee una familia conformada por su pareja sentimental y 5 descendientes, entre ellos hijos y familiares. Nos cuenta que siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora, y siempre ha buscado la manera de tener diferentes negocios, por ejemplo actualmente posee un colmado el cual inicio hace ya unos 2 años y medio, después de haber iniciado a vender ropa interiores, y con las ganancias, las cuales fue ahorrando pudo comenzar su tienda de comestibles, lo que en Republica Dominicana llamamos colmado. Al recibir este segunda préstamo, sus planes son invertirlo en diferentes mercancías como arroz, habichuela, productos enlatados, botanas, azúcar, entre otros productos de consumo diario. 

Sus retos son poder lograr sus sueños de tener un colmado grande o un súper mercado, y que tanto sus hijos como su familia pueda trabajar en el negocio de la familia. Tener una buena estabilidad económica, y tranquilidad. Desea tener la oportunidad de ayudar a su comunidad y proveer a sus hijos sus necesidades de alimentación, vestimenta y educación.
texts.en:
María is the “Esperanza en el Paraíso” (Hope in Paradise) group coordinator.  It is located in the city of Puerto Plata, a city whose main activities are tourism and a rum distillery; real estate is also strong in this city.  These are the main sources of employment.  The group is mostly involved in sales of jewelry, clothing, shoes, accessories, cosmetics and food, among other miscellaneous products.

María’s family is composed of her spouse and five family members, children and relatives among them.  She tells us that she’s always been a hard working woman and has always sought to have various businesses.  For example, she currently has a grocery store that she started about two years ago after having started out in underwear sales; she used profits she gradually saved to start a grocery store, which in the Dominican Republic are called “colmado.” Upon receiving this second loan she plans to use it to buy several products like: rice, beans, canned goods, snacks and sugar, among other daily use items.

Her challenges are to reach her dreams of having a large grocery store or a supermarket so that both her children and family can work in the family business, to have good economic stability and peace of mind.  She wants to have the opportunity of helping her community and provide her children with the basic needs of food, clothing and education.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr M. labora como Higienista es Acompañado, tiene siete persona al su cargo  es el No. 7 del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  le ha dado esta institución con  este  desembolso para realizar  compra de  materiales de construcción como  cemento, bloque, hierro, cinz ,  perlines y mano de obra para hacer poche en su vivienda.
texts.en: Mr. Maleanos works as a janitor and he is married. He is responsible for seven (7) individuals. It is his seventh loan that Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) has granted him and he is thankful for the support that given to him by this organization. With this loan he plans on purchasing construction materials such as cement, construction blocks, steel, zinc, beams, and labor costs. He plans on making a porch for his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a twenty-year-old ambitious man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of building his own house in the next five years.

He has been providing motorcycle transportation for two years and his major challenge is having to remit 80% to his employer. He dreams of owning a motorcycle so as to increase his daily income, as the sector is very profitable. Robert needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a businessman who operates a motorbike (boda-boda) transport business.  He has been running the business for three years with one employee.  Besides, he is employed.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered; hence, he has grown his business.  He hopes to buy more motorbikes in the future.  With 20,000 KES, he will repair his motorbike and open a grocery shop.

loans.use: to repair his motorbike and open a grocery shop

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es: La Señora María Cruz está solicitando nuestra ayuda, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de productos a diferentes distribuidores, pero ella considera que le iría mejor si ella misma vendiera esos productos por lo cual la ayuda que solicito en este crédito es para invertir en la mercancía que comprara y que espera que le brinde muy buenas ganancias, y también que sea un buen paso para seguir avanzando en su desempeño laboral para que así su esposo y sus tres hijos se sientan orgullosos de ella. Ella pagara este crédito con los ingresos que gana de la venta de los productos.
texts.en: María Cruz is asking for our help.  She works selling products to different distributors, but she thinks it will be better if she sold the products herself.  She is asking for this loan to invest in merchandise that she will buy and that she hopes will bring her a good income.  This will also be a good step to advance in her business development so that her husband and her three children will be proud of her.  She will pay this loan with the income she earns from the sale of the products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Symy

texts.en:
Mrs. Symy N. is 33 years old and her husband, Mr. Channo Chai, is 28 years old. They have been married since 2003 and have two young sons. They live along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Symy N. sells fruit. She buys it from fellow villagers and sells it in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a construction worker. 
Symy is requesting her first loan of $800 US to buy a new motorbike to transport her fruit to the market, and also to expand the house where she lives.

Symy and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and expand the house where she lives

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar opened an auto repair shop in 2009. He has good experience in this field. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,500 loan to buy a nozzle cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a nozzle cleaning machine.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 57 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells condiments, sugar, milk, eggs, soft drinks, canned goods, baked breads and biscuits. Felicidad has had this business for one year. She is grateful because her business is improving. 

To continue to improve her general store, Felicidad is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more groceries such as condiments, sugar, milk, eggs, soft drinks, canned goods, baked breads and biscuits. Each month, Felicidad earns about PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell such as condiments, sugar, milk, eggs, soft drinks, canned goods, baked breads and biscuits

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (riz, sucre, huile végétale) depuis 2009, Ayaba est mère de 02 enfants. Elle a 47ans et a pour époux un fermier. Madame s’approvisionne d’habitude au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique à HEDZRANAWOE. Ce premier prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises vu que son stock s’épuise pour vendre à sa clientèle.
texts.en: A retailer of first necessity products (rice, sugar, vegetable oil) since 2009, Ayaba is a mother of two. She is 47 years old and is married to a farmer. This lady usually gets her supplies from Lomé Grand Market and retails in her shop in Hedzranawoe. This first loan will allow her to purchase merchandise to sell to her customers, as her stock is running low.

loans.use: to buy first necessity products.

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is the founder of a social bike project in partnership with an urban school in Detroit.  While Nick’s office is in his home, the bikes are built by students at a Detroit high school. The partnering school has a great deal of existing capacity for building, as well as a network for the next generation of cyclists, mechanics, and machinists. Founded in March, this bike project entails designing and manufacturing handmade bicycle trailers. Sales are generated in the neighborhood through open houses, in the city through retail outlets, and nationally through Nick’s website.  In Detroit there is a huge demand for public transportation as it is minimal and unreliable; expanding the capacity of bikes is an opportunity to impact change in the community. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Nick will purchase materials for the bikes and advertise the project. Nick hopes to cultivate the positive relationship with the school, allow students to continue working on the project and spread the word about the great need for transportation in Detroit. 


Additional Information About This Loan 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit

loans.use: to purchase materials for the bikes and advertise the project

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong is 45 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the busy local market for more than six years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and from other fishermen. Her husband is a construction worker in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. The family makes  approximately $12 each day to use for their needs. 

Mrs. Suong will use a loan from Kiva to purchase more fish to sell at the market. She will also use some of the money to buy zinc to repair the cracked roof of her house. Mrs. Suong has two children who are in school.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale and to repair her home's roof

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 53 years old and separated with one son who is 23 years old. Her occupation is selling tamales in the streets. She makes the tamales at her house and then carries them in a basket to sell all over the city of Cusco. Esther is asking for a $200 loan in order to buy ingredients to make her tamales such as flour, sugar, salt, and oil. She works everyday selling her homemade tamales. Esther is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 53 years old and married. They have a 10-year-old son. Grace has been selling secondhand clothing for three years, making a monthly profit of about KES 10,000. 

She has been loaned KES 20,000 which she plans to use to purchase clothes, socks, jackets, blouses, skirts, dresses, etc.

She will use the anticipated profit from the sales to support her child's education. She hopes to be financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, socks, jackets, blouses, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Santa Rita De Casia Group

texts.es:
Santa Rita D. Casia se denomina el excelente grupo D. mujeres conformado en la ciudad D. Ita, gracias a que la Señora Karina contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el segundo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria.
La señora Karina se dedica a la venta D. ropas, gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante, ya que le genera buenos ingresos. Comenta que tiene buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy lindas prendas a la venta. Sueña con poder tener una tienda donD. pueda exhibir sus productos, ya que D. esa forma atraerá más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas D. invierno, con lo que podrá abastecerse. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Santa Rita D. Casia is the name of an excellent group of women formed in the city of Ita thanks to Karina.  Karina contacted the advisor of the Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Women Entrepreneurs) during a weekly meeting in the area so that she could inform herself about the Comité's work.  Once Karina was advised about the program, she managed to bring together 15 women who now find themselves working together very comfortably and cooperatively in their second loan cycle.

Karina works in clothing sales.  Thanks to this job she has been able to get ahead, since it generates a good income for her.  She says that she has a good clientele because she always has very nice articles of clothing for sale.  She dreams of being able to have a store where she can show her merchandise, since that way she will attract more customers.

Karina is requesting a loan to buy winter clothes with which to supply herself.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity that this purchase will give her.

loans.use: to buy clothing for later sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
As a responsible father, John engages in a hog-raising business to earn additional income to satisfy his family needs. He is a farmer who has been raising his family in a village for almost 20 years, earning profits of only P15,000 for every harvest season. He aimed to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income in order to finance the education of his son who is now in college. 

He is asking for P10,000 in additional capital to buy feeds, vitamins, and materials needed to improve their pig pen. He believes that he will be able to improve their business and make it viable as he continues to work hard and strives harder despite the hardships and difficulties of life.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and materials needed to improve the pig pen

loans.name: Arco Iris 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en: Ambrocia leads this loan group, which is called Arco Iris (Rainbow) 1, 2 & 3. The members live in the slums located to the north of Santo Domingo. She makes her home in a simple structure with her two children and her long-term partner. She is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, which is selling shoes, clothing, and cosmetics. She will use the profits to expand her business and improve her family's life. Her most difficult challenge has been providing her children with various items they need. She enjoys her work and is known for having a clean, well-organized home. Like everyone in this group, she is committed to improve her family's life and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more product to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 43 years old, married, and has six children.  She runs a retail shop and has been doing so for 10 years.  She also does farming to improve her standard of living.  

Beth is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy cereals, sugar, and maize flour. Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business, which has helped her to pay school fees for her children. Beth hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, sugar, and maize flour.

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia, esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo, el cual lo utilizara para crecer más su tienda  y comprar más mercadería como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite,bebidas, de esa forma obtendrá mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Idalia  es  incrementar  sus ventas y  tendrá más variedad y cubrir sus obligaciones y salir adelante con su familia.Por eso acude al apoyo crediticio, ya que le ha ayudado hasta la fecha para mejorar su situacion economica y el comercio de los productos.
texts.en: Idalia is once again requesting a loan to make her store grow more and to buy more merchandise like: rice, sugar, beans, oil and beverages to earn more income.  Idalia’s dream is to increase sales and have more variety to meet her obligations and get ahead with her family.  Because of this she’s seeking financial support since it’s helped her to date to improve her economic situation and to sell the products.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil and beverages for the business.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 50 años.
Genoveva trabaja como cocinera en un recreo, ella todos los prestamos que saca lo invierte en la educación de sus hijos, tiene 5 hijos y gracias a su esfuerzo y a la ayuda de Finca pudieron terminar sus estudios superiores, su hija es profesora, dos hijos contadores y dos hijos policías, su meta es poder abrir su propio recreo, agradece a Finca por las buenas enseñanzas que le brindaron y todo lo que aprendía pudo inculcar a sus hijos. El préstamo que esta solicitando lo utilizará para la graduación de su hijo en paracaidismo. 
Genoveva manifiesta que Finca es una Institución que confía en la mujer emprendedora y luchadora, que ayuda a las mujeres a poder salir de la pobreza.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the Nueva Vida communal bank. She is 50 years old.

Genoveva works as a cook in a café. She invests all the loans that she has taken in the education of her children. She has five children. Thanks to her effort and the assistance of Finca, they were all able to finish their higher education. Her daughter is a teacher, two sons are accountants, and two sons are police officers. Her goal is to be able to open her own café. She is grateful to Finca for the good education that they have given her. Everything she learned she was able to instill in her children.  The loan that she is requesting will be used for her son’s parachuting graduation.

Genoveva expresses that Finca is an institution that trusts in entrepreneurial, hardworking women and helps women be able to get out of poverty.

loans.use: to fund her son's graduation.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Los problemas D. orden público que se han vivido en el barrio D. Medellín en el que vive Blanca Luz no han sido impedimento para que siga adelante con su negocio D. alquiler D. lavadoras que desempeña desD. hace algún tiempo con la colaboración D. uno D. sus 4 hijos. 

En el futuro esta emprendedora sueña con un espacio más amplio que le permita tener más lavadoras y generar empleo a personas D. la zona y para lograrlo poco a poco, por ahora necesita D. un préstamo para comprar 3 lavadoras lo que le permitirá ofrecer sus servicios a más personas y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Public order problems in the neighborhood of Medellín in which Blanca Luz lives haven't stopped her from getting ahead in her business renting washing machines.  She has been in this business for some time, together with one of her four children.

In the future, this entrepreneur dreams of having more space which will allow her to have more washing machines and create work for people from her area.  Right now, she needs a loan to buy three washing machines which will allow her to offer her services to more people and thereby improve her income.

loans.use: to buy washing machines

loans.name: Jyambere Muhinzi/nyghnk Group

texts.fr:
Théoneste fait partie du groupe Jyamberemuhinzi/Nyghnk. Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6  ans de primaire.

Théoneste est cultivateur des tomates. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture des tomates. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est agrandir la récolte des tomates en utilisant des engrais chimiques.  Dans les prochaines années. Avec les profits, Théoneste prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Théoneste belongs to the Jyamberemuhinzi/Nyghnk group. He is 32 years old and married with three children whose ages range from 3 to 8, and one of whom attends school. Théoneste completed six years of primary education.

Théoneste is a tomato farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers to grow tomatoes.

His strategy to expand his business is to increase his tomato harvest by using chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, with his profits, Théoneste intends to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Ndira Diagne

texts.fr: Madame Ndira est secrétaire  communal. En meme temps elle exerce une activité de commerce de  vente de thioups, parfums et déodorants. ELLE A UNE EXPÉRIENCE DE 3 ANS DANS SON activité  DE COMMERCE. Elle a choisi cette activité dan le but d’arrondir les fins de mois. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé  3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de parfums  et  déodorants qui seront destinés a la vente. Son dernier prêt lui a permis de réaliser des bénéfices et de s’équiper  en ustensiles de cuisine lors de son déménagement.
texts.en: Mrs Ndira is a secretary, as well as working in the business of re-selling perfumes and deodorants during the past three years. She chose to become involved in this business in order to increase her income. She is a member of the UIMCEC bank since May 2003, and has received and successfully reimbursed three loans previously. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs in order to purchase greater quantities of products to be sold. Her last loan allowed her to make a bit of profit which she spent on household and kitchen items.

loans.use: purchase perfumes and deodorant to re-sell

loans.name: Manuela Benedicta

texts.es:
Manuela de 46 años, empezó como costurera y gracias a sus esfuerzos decidió aumentar su trabajo, ahora también vende productos de uso personal.

Realiza su trabajo sola, por la mañanas vende en el colegio donde estudia su hijos y por las tarde recorres donde familiares y amigos vendiendo sus productos.

Sus dificultades son la delincuencia y el traslado a sus lugares de trabajo. No está casado pero tiene 1 hijos de 16 años que estudia en un colegio fiscal.

Su meta es poder seguirá adelante con su negocio para de esta manera salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuela is 46. She started as a seamstress, and because she is a hard worker, she decided to expand her business. Now she also sells products for personal use. She works on her own. 

In the mornings, she sells at the school where her son studies, and in the afternoon travels to the homes of family members and friends to sell her products. The challenges she faces are crime and getting to the places she works. She isn't married, but has a 16 year-old son who is in high school.

Her goal is to keep moving forward with her business, so that she and her son can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy purses, lotions and lipsticks.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una venta de ropa como camisas, blusas, ropa interior entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona pues siempre tiene para los clientes lo que necesitan y todo lo que comercializa es de muy buena calidad y a precios bajos además el servicio es inigualable ella siempre es muy amable con las personas;  Ana Gloria  siempre ha trabajado duro para alcanzar sus objetivos y hoy no es la excepción, está dispuesta a ver crecer su negocio,  piensa que el éxito no es para los que piensan que pueden hacer algo, sino para quienes lo hacen y el está dispuesto a lograrlo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas, zapato etc. Ana gloria tiene la esperanza que con su esfuerzo podrán darle a su familia una vida plena con mas oportunidades.
texts.en: Ana Gloria, who is 36 years old, lives with her life partner and their son. She sells clothing like shirts, blouses, underwear, among other things. She is well known in the area since she always has what her customers need and everything she sells is of good quality and at lower prices. Additionally, her service in unequalled. She is always very friendly with people. Ana Gloria always has worked hard to achieve her objectives and today is not an exception. She is determined to see her business grow. She thinks success is not for those who think they can do anything but for those who do it and she is determined to achieve it. It is for this reason she is requesting from Integral a loan that allows her to buy pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, shoes, etc. Ana Gloria hope that, with her effort, she will be able to give her family a life full of more opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, and shoes.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun, 61 years old, is married and has 5 children. She has permanently lived in Prey Chor district. Chhun and her husband have worked on their rice farming since 1980 and agriculture is her sole of income. Chhun presently owns only a few pieces of farmland for growing her rice crops and her rice yields are barely enough to meet the family's needs. She is seeking a loan from HKL, Kiva's partner, to buy stocks of rice for her daily food for the year. In the future, she hopes that she’ll be able to expand her farmland and produce a good output for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice.

loans.name: Toilalo

texts.en:
Toilalo is thirty one years of age and is married with four children. Toilalo owns and operates a business venture raising fish for sale. She has two years of experience in this business. Toilalo needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase a new canoe,fishing net and spears.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Toilalo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Toilalo's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a new canoe, fishing net and spears

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Paz has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a responsible, respectable, hard-working, honorable and honest woman who dedicates her life to raising her children, who mean everything to her. Irene is a very hard-working woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 10 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Irene offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. Being a caring and loving mum, Irene has been able to take care of her family and support them through the profits she has earned from farming. 

Irene has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to start the shop. 
Her projections are that, by the end of next year, she would be able to open another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she will be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta  B. is 38 years old. She is married and has a boy who is 8 years old. In 1992 her husband Rosen buys a truck and starts transport business. In 2004 he opens a shop for baby clothes and accessories and names in \"The Happy Baby\" but Rosen is occupied with transport and Violeta  starts to develop this new business. The shop is small but is on a busy street and is the only specialized shop for baby goods in the town. Rosen and Violeta want to buy a car to supply their shop and need $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a car to supply the shop

loans.name: Mahnur

texts.en:
Mahnur opened this laborotory  5 years ago. 
Having borrowed $400 she bought a microscope for analysis.
39-year-old Mahnur is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. She is settled in the Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. She is single.
Now she needs  a loan of $800 to buy chemicals.

loans.use: To buy chemicals

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 49 years old and the mother of two grown sons.  Her sons migrated overseas in order to find employment opportunities.  Both have their own families to look after, and Maria and her husband work hard to support themselves and not rely on their children for financial support.  They operate a vegetable farm and Maria’s access to micro-loan facilities have helped them upgrade their farm with better equipment and fertilizers.  They sell their crop at the local market.  Having repaid previous loan funds in full and on time, Maria is seeking an additional loan specifically to expand the variety of vegetables they grow and purchase some fertilizer to enhance their yield.

loans.use: Buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pest control agents

loans.name: Khudamali

texts.en: Khudamali is forty years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. Khudamali would like a loan of $1200 to purchase fertilizer and medicine for his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Hasifa

texts.en:
Hasifa N. is married with three children. She has been selling fish in Kayunga central market for the last four years. She started taking out loans three years back from Feed The children Uganda 's community banking program. She has been servicing her current US$400 loan well. She is a very hardworking and enterprising lady.

She recently traveled to Busia on the borderof Kenya and Uganda and noticed that the demand for fish was higher there than in Kayunga. After her visit, she made a test and surprisingly found that she had sold all that she had taken there with her. To-date she runs two stalls in Kayunga and Busia. However, her funds are limited and don't allow her to stock enough for her customers, hence she is requesting a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy five large baskets of dry fish twice a week.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a 37-year-old father of two and a resident of the Kisiwani area in Dar es Salaam city. Juma sells both used and new shoes, for ladies and men. He has been in this business for the past six years and owns a shop in the Kisiwani area, where he does all his business. He is in need of U.S. $325 to help him expand his stock and his business.

loans.use: To expand his shoe business

loans.name: Toaga

texts.en: Toaga E. comes from the village of Saoluafata. She is on her fourth loan and her business is the plantation. She grows taro, bananas and taamu. Her husband is unemployed and helps out by doing the manual labor. Instead of going to the market, which is more expensive, she prefers to sell her produce in front of the village store. She sells five days of the week and can earn $80 WST ($32 USD) a day, and about $400 WST ($160 USD) a week. She is looking forward to receiving more loans from SPBD. She says these loans are very supportive not only to the family, but especially for the children in school.

loans.use: To buy knives, an ax, weed killer, and a wheel barrow for her plantation

loans.name: Benito Javier

texts.es:
For four years Benito M. has sold movies on DVD. Having established a home and with the added responsibility of looking after a young child, he started this business.

In reality he doesn't have his own store but rather he sells outside on the outskirts of the central market in Leon, where he displays his products.

In spite of his situation he has not lost the dream of improving his quality of life now that he has received loans from Ceprodel that have sufficiently helped him purchase movies and manage his home. He has received 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Benito M. desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de películas en dvd, inicia este negocio por la necesidad de que al haber formado un hogar y con un pequeño a quien mantener tiene la responsabilidad de velar por su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente no posee un local propio sino que vende a la intemperie en las afueras del mercado central de León , exponiendo sus productos a daños físicos ya que no posee un local seguro. .

A pesar de esta situación no ha perdido las esperanzas de mejorar su nivel de vida ya que ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel que le han ayudado satisfactoriamente en la compra de las películas y en las necesidades de su hogar. (Su record crediticio es de 10 créditos).

loans.use: Purchase of DVD movies

loans.name: Kubirat

texts.en: Kubirat Olarewaju, 42-years-old, is married with four children. Her family lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been selling building materials for 15 years. Mrs. O. is requesting a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional inventory for resale.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana has had this stand for approximately 12 years. The stand is located in the property of the Military School of Engineering E.M.I in the area of Alto Irpavi. Her husband works as a janitor in the same area.

Mrs. Juana has been a customer of Emprender for 5 years, demonstrating punctuality in her payments because her business is solvent because of the characteristics of the Military School. She has 5 children, two of whom work independently. Together with her husband Isidro Muni, who receives a salary, they collaborate to support their children and fulfill their loan obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Juana ya lleva en el puesto aproximadamente 12 años de antigüedad, este se encuentra ubicado en los predios de la Escuela Militar de Ingenieria E.M.I. de la zona de Alto Irpavi, en la misma su esposo trabaja como portero.

La Sra Juana es cliente de Emprender de hace 5 años atrás, demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos, ya que el negocio que tiene es solvente por las características de esa Institución de estudio, ella tiene 5 hijos de los cuales los dos mayores trabajan ya independientemente, y juntamente con el esposo Isidro Muni quien recibe un sueldo se colaboran para llevar adelante a sus hijos menores y cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.

loans.use: Stock her stand with all kinds of sweets (Surtir el puesto de venta con todo tipo de golosinas)

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en:
Fawzia is thirty-four years old and the mother of three children. The children are currently in school. She has a grocery store where she sells a variety of products, such as toiletries, baby foods, canned drinks, and pomades.

Fawzia wants to use her loan to buy more cartons of baby foods, boxes of diapers, and bags of rice and sugar

.

She is a member of the group called May Flower. Group members guarantee for each other as social collateral in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baby foods, boxes of diapers, bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Num Nheb Group

texts.en:
Six members in Sna Pich Village consist of one group that Mrs. Num N. leads. She is a grocer in the local village. Though her business activity has experienced more improvement over recent times, she now would like to expand it.

Mrs. Num N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her customers. Mrs. Num N. is 35 years old and married with four children, three of whom are enrolled in school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Mean Korng, is a farmer. Mrs. Num N. previously has obtained a loan open a grocery store in the village. (Mr. Rom M. is not presented in the photo but his wife is).

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Abdufattoh

texts.en:
Abdufattoh O. was born in 1977 in the D.Kholmatov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has a child. Though Mr. O. has only been a MicroInvest client since 2008, he has been in the livestock business for 20 years, and he has solid practical skills. Mr. O. dreams of having a big livestock farm so he is ready to work hard. He is also a good carpenter with mastery of home repair.

Mr. O. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $1050 US for 6 months to purchase a pedigreed bull and some rams.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull and some rams

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Mrs. Om V., 40, is a tailor who works from her house and provides services in her village. She makes about $9 per day. Her husband is on the staff of a non-governmental organization and his income is $5 per day. They have five children, all of whom are young. They all live in Deylo Village, Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia.

Because of increasing expenses, she wants to reduce cost of the family's transportation, so she is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Agnes is a fifty year old widowed mother of seven children, two of whom are in school. She owns a small store, which she runs with two employees, from which she sells traditional Tanzanian cloth with which one can tailor outfits. The choice of colors and types of material of cloth that she sells is quite varied! Her store currently generates a monthly profit of $300. She is requesting $275 to purchase additional stocks of cloth for her business. Agnes intends to spend the increased profits that she hopes this loan will generate on her family and hopes to expand her business in the near future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies of cloth for her store

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Anna S. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of five and twenty-three. Anna has been running a cloth business since 2006. She sells traditional African cloth that her customers use to make dresses. Anna currently earns about $300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 USD to purchase more cloth. Anna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cloth.

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en: Chhang N., 49, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and one child. She works with her husband selling porridge and grocery products every day. Their combined income is typically US$6 each day. Many in Cambodia are facing economic difficulties with rising inflation making both food and especially rice prices soar. Her son is married but still lives with her. Chhang has asked CREDIT for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi. This will increase their daily income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: EL SEÑOR CESAR TRABAJA PARA UNA EMPRESA BIEN ESTABLECIDA, SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA GLORIA ES AMA DE CASA YA QUE SE DEDICA AL CUIDADO DE SU PEQUEÑO BEBE. ELLOS ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UNA BARDA PARA MAYOR SEGURIDAD DE LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar works for a well established factory, his wife, Gloia is a housewife now that she is dedicated to the care of their small baby. They are asking for this loan for the construction of a house to improve the security of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a fence

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: Nyame B. is a single parent with four dependants. She has received schooling through the junior high level. Nyame sells fish that she buys from fishermen and brings home for processing and preservation. She sends the fish to the market for sale at Boatase near Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Nyame uses her income to pay for her children's school fees, utility bills, and other expenses. This loan will enable Nyame to buy more fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. Nyame plans to use part of the new profits from her expanded business to provide a quality education for her children. The remaining profits will be saved towards a house she wants to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: El señor Roger Espinosa García tiene la edad de 58 años, habita en el barrio santa Rosa ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposa y hijos la señora trabaja para poder compartir los gastos del hogar ; ya que tiene a su cargo un hijo que actualmente estudia su secundaria y se gasta mucho, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar su negocio para poder brindarle el apoyo a su hijo que pronto ira a la universidad , él trabaja como artesano y a la vez elabora zapatos desde hace treinta años , con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado mantener esta pequeña mico- empresa la cual carece de materia prima para poder elaborar producción . El solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder crecer en su empresa y comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando bonitos y variados zapatos.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Espinosa García is 58 years old, lives in the neighborhood Santa Rosa, located in the city of Masaya, together with his wife and sons. His wife works to help share the household expenses because they have a son dependent on them who is currently studying in secondary school and costs them a lot. His family plans to improve his business to provide support to his son who will go soon to university. He works as an artesan and has produced shoes for 30 years; with his efforts he has maintained this small microenterprise which lacks raw material for production. He asks for support from Afodenic to grow his business and purchase raw material to continue producing varied and beautiful shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material to make shoes

loans.name: Elizabeth Adhiambo

texts.en:
Elizabeth Adhiambo A. rents a workshop in the Likoni area of Mombasa, Kenya where she has a woodworking business. Elizabeth buys timber from local shops to make chapatti boards for rolling chapatti (a local flat bread), chopping boards, mug hanging stands, bottle openers, and mortar and pestles. She started this business in 1997 so that she could pay for her children’s school fees. 

Elizabeth takes large orders from local supermarkets, as well as supplying smaller shops. From large supermarket orders, Elizabeth might make a 7,000 KSH profit from each order – she receives about 2 orders of this kind a month, as well as smaller orders from the small shops. 

Elizabeth has applied for a loan in order to buy more timber and a blade for carving the wood.

Elizabeth is married with 7 dependent children. She dreams of building her own house, so that she and her family no longer have to rent living space above her current workshop.

loans.use: To purchase timber and a carving blade.

loans.name: José Guillermo

texts.es: José Guillermo R. P. vive en Soyapango , departamento de San Salvador. El no contar con educación formal nunca ha sido impedimento para buscar trabajo, y desde hace ya varios años se dedica a la albañilería por contrato.  El negocio de la albañilería  es muchas veces inestable, pues Jose Guillermo  trabajo por proyectos, y no siempre logra obtener contrataciones continuas. Esto no desanima a Jose, quien siempre busca la manera de aprender nuevas cosas que le permitan lograr mas contratos, en este momento, solicita un préstamo para adquirir nuevos materiales y herramientas de albañilería que le permitan acceder a nuevos y más proyectos.
texts.en:
José Guillermo R. P. lives in Soyapango, a district of San Salvador. Although he doesn't have a formal education this has never been an impediment in looking for work, and he has worked for a number of years as a contract bricklayer. The bricklaying business is often unstable, and as Jose Guillermo works on a project basis he is not always able to obtain continuous work. This doesn't deter Jose, who always looks for ways to learn new skills which will allow him to obtain more contracts. He is currently seeking a loan to buy new bricklaying tools and materials which will give him access to new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bricklaying tools and materials

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa Y., a 50-year-old food vendor and member of a village bank called ‘Cynthia,’ lives in the village of Wasa Simpa in the western part of Ghana with her husband, who is a farmer, and their five children, one of whom has finished senior high school, while the others are still in school.  

Adwoa has been in business for the past six years selling kenkey as well as maize. Kenkey, prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish, is enjoyed by many Ghanaians for breakfast, lunch and supper. Adwoa therefore has a good base of customers and is now requesting a loan to buy more raw materials including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood, hoping to thereby increase her savings to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina M. is married with five dependent children. She has received schooling through junior high. Justina has sold groceries, soft drinks and building materials at Agona, near Elmina, since 2001.

Her husband is employed as an auto mechanic. Justina uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Justina will use the loan to increase her stock, to sell more groceries, soft drinks and building materials to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justina plans to reinvest to promote the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries and supplies to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam de 49 años, vive junto a su esposo y su única hija en casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería (pintura, clavos, lijas, etc) en forma ambulatoria, llevando a vender sus productos por los diferentes lugares de su zona. En esta labor lleva un periodo de 2 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se encarga de movilizarla en su motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y se relaciona con varias personas, quienes se ganaron su confianza y ahora son sus clientes regulares, además le es rentable porque sus productos tienen mucha demanda y se venden muy fácilmente, porque bien son comprados al contado o cambiados por alimentos o animales que valoricen el monto. Para el futuro, Miriam desea tener un local para instalar una ferretería con todo lo necesario. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros de grupo son unidos y respetuosos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más materiales de ferretería para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and only daughter. She sells hardware (paint, nails, files, etc) from door to door in the various places in her zone. She has been doing this for the past 2 years with the help of her husband who drives her from place to place. What she likes about her job is that she gets to know many places and meet a lot of people who trust her and become her regular clientele. Additionally, her business is profitable because her products are in high demand and they sell easily at good prices either for cash or in exchange for food or animals with the same value. For the future, Miriam would like to have a well-stocked store from which to sell her hardware. This is her third loan with MFP and she likes to work with her comunal bank because the members of her group are united and respectful. The money she is asking for on this occasion is to buy more inventory to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
el sr. Jose G. tiene 63 años de edad, el vive en union libre con su compañera de hogar la Sra. Maria Carbajal, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales. el vive en Coyolito y se dedica a la venta de Refrescos y Molino de Quebrar Maiz esta es su actividad principal, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para moler maiz, ya que mucha gente le gusta moler el maiz para hacer tortillas temprano para el desayuno.
el necesita el credito para poder comprar repuestos para el molino que es su unica fuente fuerte de ingresos que tiene, la venta de refrescos le genera ganancias pero no muchas.
su deseo es que sus hijos sean hombres de bien y que todos se graduen de la universidad y asi tengan una mejor condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose G., 63, lives with his common law wife, Mrs. Maria Carbajal. They have 5 children. He lives in Coyolito. He sells soft drinks, however grinding corn is his primary business. Every day he gets up at 4 in the morning to grind corn. Lots of people like ground corn to make tortillas for breakfast. He needs a loan to be able to buy replacement parts for his mill. The mill is his only strong source of income. Soft drink sales generate some income, but not much. His hope is that his children become good people, and that they all graduate from the university. That way they will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for mill and soft drinks

loans.name: Dominga Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Dominga pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; Tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil viuda, tiene 5 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio San Miguel.

Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles.  La señora Dominga se dedica a la compra-venta de golosinas.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar cajas de galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, jugos, etc. y así poder surtir su negocio.
Su sueño es poner una tienda grande bien surtida o en todo caso poner una librería.
 
A ella le gusta el ahorro y los encuentros organizados por La institución Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the "Micaela Bastidas" communal bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 53 years old, a widow and has 5 children.
