She completed her secondary school education and lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 2 years. Her first loan was for S/. 300,00 new soles. Dominga buys and sells sweets. She currently needs a loan for S/. 1000.00 new soles to buy boxes of cookies, chocolates, candies, soft drinks, juices, etc. so she can restock her business. Her dream is to have large, well-stocked store or at any rate to start a bookshop. She likes saving and she likes the meetings organized by the Manuela Ramos organization.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, chocolates, candies, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica O. is from the city of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 27 years old. Jessica is married and has 5 small children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling used clothing to local community member. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and the needs of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hope Sisters Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Fatu J., Saidu B., Alamatu B. and Bilkisu K. of the Hope Sisters group. They are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, located in northern Sierra Leone. To date, these entrepreneurs have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. With those loans, they have been able to expand their businesses. As a result of this, they have been able to provide their children with three meals a day, send them to school and solve most of their daily financial challenges. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 so that each of them can further improve her businesses. 

Fatu J. (second from left) is the leader of the group. Fatu was born in Makeni and is now 46 years old. She is a widow with seven children. Four are grown-ups and three are attending secondary schools. Fatu sells market food and has been in this business for over 35 years now. With this loan, she will be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business selling food in order to further expand her business

loans.name: Afia

texts.fr:
B. Afia est née le 08 Janvier 1960 à BOPA dans le département du Mono. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants qui sont actuellement aux Etats-Unis. Afia vend principalement des boissions, comme les jus de citron et bissup, jus très sucré qui vient de Bénin. Elle mène son activité à son domicile.  

Bénéficiaire dynamique et crédible, Afia est à son troisième crédit d’Alidé.  Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour s'approvisionner plus de lait en poudre, des citrons, du sucre, des boîtes de canettes.  Elle a le souci de bien rembourser le montant emprunté.
texts.en:
B. Afia was born on January 8, 1960 in BOPA in Mono county. He is married and the mother of two children who are currently in the United States. Afia sells mainly beverages, such as lemon juice and bissap juice, which is a very sweet drink from Benin. She operates her business in her home. An energetic and credible beneficiary, Afia is on her third loan with Alidé. She is requesting a new loan to stock up on powdered milk, lemons, sugar, and cans. She has the care to repay properly the amount borrowed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans, lemons, sugar, powdered milk

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela D. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 57 years old. Cerela is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Cerela owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling kitchen supplies and products to local community members. Cerela is just starting this business.

In 2007, Cerela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerela successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Cerela is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Cerela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura M. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 63-years old, married with one adult child. Laura owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of revenue for the business comes from selling everyday use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Laura joined Kiva partner GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Laura from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase everyday use products

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde sells provisions and drinks to make a living. She is very determined to expand her business and to maximize her profits. Yetunde is 43 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
la sra. Josefa F. vive en union libre con el sr. Oscar Armando Ortiz, no tienen hijos por los momentos, Josefa se dedica a la compra/venta de refrescos de cola al por mayor y tambien al detalle, este tipo de prodcuto es muy vendido en esta zona, ya que las personas toman mucho refrescos de cola, es una costumbre para muchas personas ingerir sus alimentos del almuerzo y comprar un refresco de cola.
tambien ella elabora pan casero y tamales los fines de semana, Josefa necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos al por mayor. 
nos comento que le va muy bien y que esta muy agradecida con Dios porque todo le esta saliendo bien, con su compañero de hogar estan planeando el año que viene tener un hijo.

loans.use: compra de refrescos de cola

loans.name: Zakiya's Group

texts.en:
N. Zakiya is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 24 years old and the single mother of two children aged 3 years and one and a half years and both of them are not yet in school.

Zakiya is a business lady involved in the sale of fish, mostly dried fish, in Tongolo. Since we are in a rainy season, it takes a lot of time for her to dry her fish and hence most of them rot. In a good season, she is able to make 100,000/= as profits and this is attributed to her good customer care.

She has the aim of expanding her business to ensure that she can earn more money and be able to educate her children to the highest level. Zakiya needs a loan to help buy more fish for resale. She is such a hardworking and determined lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean S. is a mother of five children and a loving wife to Mr. Procopio S.. She is 45 years of age and from the village of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. Jean operates a frozen food retailing business. Though her work is laborious as she processes her products herself, Jean really loves her business because it serves as her source of income. While Jean is busy processing her products, her husband, Procopio, is busy farming their field.

For Jean to earn more income, she sells her frozen foods in the different villages near their home. She dreams of improving her small business and being able to process more frozen foods to supply the needs of her customers. With this in mind, Jean is asking for the amount of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as additional capital for her business. She is very optimistic that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: As additional capital for her frozen food business

loans.name: Ekuka

texts.en: Ekuka G. sells food supplies such as canned tomatoes, fresh ginger, locally made spices and so on at Elmina fish pot.  Ekuka has received a senior high education.  She is single and has four children. Ekuka has been selling food supplies since 1979. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida B. is 47 years old and already a widow. “Prayer accompanied by hard work” is Adelaida's guiding principle. The couple together with their children are happily living in the village of Anquiray Amulung,Cagayan. Their children are: George, 28 years old and a college undergraduate; Jennifer, 25 years old, and a college undergraduate; Jennifer, 23 years, a college graduate who is working in Manila; and Janice 12 years old, and a  freshman high school student.  Adelaida says that through her business she tries to support her family. But due to the high cost of commodities, the income that she generates from her general store is insufficient for their daily needs. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000, allowing her to make the general store progress. This amount will be a big help in expanding her business and fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan A. is from the village of Gud, San Isidro. He is 23 years old. Ryan is single. To make a living, Ryan owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from motorcycle transport. Ryan has been engaged in his business for almost a year and earns approximately 300 PHP a day for these activities.

In 2009, Ryan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ryan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Lucila Berta

texts.es: Lucila Berta tiene 49 años de edad, su actividad económica es ofrecer el  brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio como un medio de vida para su familia. Además tiene 1 hija de 10 años, de la que se hace cargo pues ella tiene la enfermedad de síndrome de Down y ella la baña, la viste y está pendiente al cuido de su hija. Asimismo se dedica a impartir clases en un colegio llamado Asunción, en donde labora como docente desde hace 30 años, ella está muy orgullosa de ser una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora. Su deseo es ampliar su taller y establecer boutiques en donde sus prendas de vestir sean las mejores.
texts.en:
Lucila Berta is a 49-year-old tailor, something she has been doing for more than seven years. In addition, she takes care of a 10-year-old daughter with Down Syndrome. She bathes her, dresses her, and is key to her care. At the same time, she gives classes at Asunción high school, where she's worked as a teacher since she was 30. She is very proud to be an enterprising and motivated woman. Her wish is to expand her workshop and establish boutiques where her garments will be the best.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue the main source of income comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sugar, salt, shampoo, soap (bath and laundry) & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz A. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Luz is single. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products like beverages in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luz is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luisa Amada

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca ubicada en el centro sur del país, esta ciudad es una fusión de tres culturas ricas en simbolismo tradición y arte como Cañari, Inca y Española los integrantes de éste banco son mujeres  luchadoras cabezas de hogar  en busca del bienestar de sus familias, son un grupo muy alegre y solidario que siempre están dispuestas a colaborar  entre ellas para que todas salgan adelante tanto familiar como económicamente. 

Luisa F.  tiene 49 años vive  en una casa arrendada en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con  tres de sus seis hijos,  los tres primeros ya son casados y viven independientes,  sus hijos de 16 y 13 estudian en un colegio nocturno para  trabajar y ayudar a su madre en casa ya que no tienen papá.

Luisa trabaja como cocinera en el  restaurante Pio Pio  hace 15 años y sus horarios son rotativos de 8 a.m. a 4 p.m. y el otro  de 3 p.m. a 11 p.m. y cuando falta alguno de sus compañeros tiene que doblar el turno,  además de ésta actividad  se dedica a la cría de pollos pero más sólo para entretenerse en casa  y no para negocio.

La señora Luisa se integró al banco comunal Alianza Unida  hace  cinco  años motivada por una vecina que es miembro del mismo, los créditos le han ayudado a salir adelante con sus hijos y tener hábito de ahorro, el dinero del préstamo solicitado  va a invertir en la educación de sus hijos pagando pensiones y  en la compra de nuevos uniformes y si le queda algo comprará  mas pollos.

Su meta es  comprarse un terreno para poco a poco ir construyendo su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alianza Unida" was formed in the city of Cuenca, located in the central southern part of the country. This city is a fusion of 3 rich cultures in its traditional symbolism and art, the Cañari, Inca and Spanish. The members of this bank are women who are heads of their households, and who struggle to provide for their families. They are a happy and supportive group; they are always ready to work together so that they all see their families advance economically. Luisa F. is 49 years old and lives in a rented house in the suburb of the city of Cuenca with 3 of her 6 children. The three oldest of her children are already married and live independently. Her children who are 16 and 13 years old study at a night school so they can work and help their mother at home, since they have no father. Luisa has worked as a cook in the restaurant Pio Pio for 15 years, and her schedule rotates from 8am to 4pm, to 3pm to 11pm. When one of her co-workers does not show up, she has to double her shift. In addition to this activity she raises chickens, but only to enjoy at home and not for a business. Luisa joined the communal bank "Alianza Unida" 5 years ago; she was encouraged by a neighbor who is also a member. The loans have helped her to get ahead with her children, and to have the habit of saving. The money from the loan she requests will be invested in the education of her children, paying school fees and buying new uniforms. If there is any money left she will also buy more chickens. Her goal is to buy herself some land so that, little by little, she can start building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy new uniforms for her children, and also to buy chickens

loans.name: Rachele Ann

texts.en:
Rachele Ann M. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 24 years old. Rachele Ann is married and has 3 pre-school children. Rachele Ann owns and operates a specialized retail business selling dried seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rachele Ann has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Rachele Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachele Ann is requesting her first loan, for 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La señora Clotilde es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 42 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, de 21 (casado), 15 y de un año y cuatro meses, se dedica a la venta diaria de ropa, (como ambulante), en la estación de verano a la venta de refrescos de fruta (chicha, maracuyá) y por las noches a la venta de pollo brosther, desde hace 20 años.
Clotilde nos cuenta que los préstamos le han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, ha comprado artefactos y una moto taxi, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de pago de servicios, y el capital que resta lo invierte en su negocio. El gran sueño de Clotilde es tener una tienda de ropa. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para comprar accesorios de moto taxi (puertas, kit de retroceso). Clotilde agradece toda la ayuda que le han dado porque gracias a eso ha salido adelante, por eso es responsable con sus créditos, ha crecido y sigue creciendo junto con su familia y también  como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Clotilde is an enterprising woman. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three children; ages 21 (married), 15, and 1 year, four months. She sells clothing daily (on foot). In the summer station she also sells fruit drinks (chicha, and maracuyá) and in the evenings she sells roast chicken. She’s been doing this for 20 years. Clotilde tells us that the loans have helped her make improvements to her home, helped her buy artifacts, and buy a moto taxi. Her income is enough to cover her service payments. Whatever capital is left over, she reinvests in her business. Cliotilde would like to have a clothing store some day. The money from this loan will be used to buy mototaxi accessories (doors, backup kit). She appreciates all the help that she has been given. Thanks to it, she has come out ahead. This is why she is responsible with her loans. She has grown and continues to grow, along with her family and as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi parts

loans.name: Perlas Group

texts.es: El grupo D. Mujeres Perlas  Acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para poder ayudarles en el incremento D. capital ya que ellas venden ropa tipica   en otros municipios y lugares para poder salir avante ya que con este trabajo  han logrado salir en la vida, ya que tiene 8 años atras  D. realizar dicha ventas y por ello piden esta ayuda y asi surtir la mercaderia y tener buenas ganancias y tener otro nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
The Perlas (Pearls) group of women have come to the ASDIR association to request assistance to raise capital. They sell traditional clothing in other municipalities and places in order to get ahead. With this work they have been able to get ahead in life. They have been selling clothes for 8 years. They are requesting this loan to add inventory, have strong earnings, and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise capital

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Argentina N. M. es soltera tiene cuatro hijos dos en edad escolar vive en el barrio san Agustín trabaja en la alcaldía municipal desde hace cinco años como secretaria de vice-alcalde
La señora Rosa Argentina N. M. tiene cinco años de  trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha cancelado cinco créditos demostrando ser una persona responsable en cuanto a obligaciones, los desembolsos anteriores los utilizo para construir su vivienda y brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
La señora Rosa Argentina N. M. es soltera tiene cuatro hijos dos en edad escolar vive en el barrio san Agustín trabaja en la alcaldía municipal desde hace cinco años como secretaria de vice-alcalde La señora Rosa Argentina N. M. tiene cinco años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, ha cancelado cinco créditos demostrando ser una persona responsable en cuanto a obligaciones, los desembolsos anteriores los utilizo para construir su vivienda y brindar mayor seguridad a su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción (perlines, puertas, clavos, mano de obra)

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu J. sells palm oil and gari (cassava flakes) at Flamingo Axis and she is well organized as she operates from a rented store. She has spent four years in this business and spends her entire time on it.

Isatu is married to a trader and they have four children. She needs a loan to buy more palm oil and gari and hopes to use the proceeds to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more gari and palmoil to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 34-year-old married lady who has two children, aged eleven and four.  She operates Neema Retailers, a retail shop, to earn a living.  She also does welding, with the help of her husband, in order to earn extra income to support their family. She previously sold clothes before venturing into this business.  She is an active member of Hope Group in Faulu, Kenya. Hope Group's members guarantee each other loans.  She has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 to buy sugar, maize, flour and rice.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize, flour and rice

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years-old and married to Diosdado. They have three adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

In 2008, Teresita joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase pigs to raise. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI provides not only credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Yaira Lisbeth

texts.es:
La señora Yaira es soltera no tiene hijos forma parte del banco comunal Las Cumbres en la ciudad de Manta, hace algún tiempo atrás mantenía una relación pero se separó, ahora vive en casa de su ex cuñada quien le ha apoyó en sus momentos difíciles.

La actividad de nuestra socia  es la venta de comida rápida comparte el negocio con otras personas, por semana invierte un capital de cien dólares, compra carne, chorizo y demás alimentos necesarios, le ha ido muy bien en todo este tiempo y está muy agradecida con la Fundación por los créditos recibidos.

La señora Yaira con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo el dinero en su negocio, cuenta que tiene gran demanda en sus ventas ya que los clientes del local son fijos, tanto así que trabaja todo los días y noches vendiendo más de 50 chuzos ( carne en palito).

 El sueño de nuestra socia es poder terminar sus estudios ya que solo logró llegar hasta el quinto grado de la escuela.
texts.en:
Yaira is single and has no children. She is part of the communal bank Las Cumbres [The Mountaintops] in the city of Manta. Some time ago she was in a relationship but separated. Now she lives in the home of her ex sister-in-law who has supported her during difficult times. Our associate is in the fast food business in a venture she shares with others. She invests a weekly capital of 100 dollars in order to buy meat, sausage and other necessary ingredients. It has been going very well for her this entire time and she is very grateful to the Foundation for the loans she has received. Yaira will be able to invest the entire amount of this loan in her business. She reports that there is a strong demand in her business since the area customers are regulars, so much so that she works every day, all day and evening, selling over 50 chuzos (meat on a stick). Our associate's dream is to be able to finish her studies since she was only able to get to the fifth grade in school.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat, sausage, potatoes and rice

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian E., 60, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. She is married to Alfred E., a taxi driver and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn sufficient income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own food stall where she sells various snack items.

Lilian has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times at the CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues and she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her food business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying groceries and raw ingredients needed to continue the sale of her snack items.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying groceries and ingredients needed to continue producing and selling of her snack items

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Mr. Saroeurn B., age 40, and is a villager who lives in Sam raong village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mr. Saroeurn B. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add her old one to cultivate rice. And side from farmer, she is also pig breeder at home. Her husband, Mr. Nhy Koem, is a motorbike taxi driver, who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has four children, who all are students and also help their mother on the farm. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy an ox to add her old one to cultivate rice

loans.name: Daniel Saningo

texts.en:
Daniel is a farmer who is 32 years old. He has been farming in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He plants maize to sell and at the same time rears animals to sell.

He was introduced to KADET micro finance by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He has no history with any other MFI.  He plans to use the cash to add more cows to his herd of cattle, which he will sell later at a profit.  

Daniel also is planning to open up a retail shop in the near future, which he will run when not busy on the farm.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Geiner De Los Angeles

texts.es: Geiner de los Angeles G. Rubí, tiene la edad de 20 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de chile dulce, la idea es comprar el techo (el cual se utiliza para proteger el cultivo del sol y la lluvia) y los insumos necesarios para la producción y también para la mano de obra. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Geiner  también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Geiner de los Angeles G. Rubí, age 20, is single and lives with his parents. He wants the loan to plant sweet chilies. The plan is to buy a roof (to protect the crops from sun and rain), buy the supplies needed for production, and to pay for the labor. He wants to give his crops adequate maintenance in order to get a better quality. He wants to do this in order to get the greatest possible income at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He is very happy with the services that have been provided. Geiner has worked in agriculture for several years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also wants to be able to keep growing as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant sweet chilies

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Rey de Reyes lo integran Mirna María López M. de 29 años, Virginia del Carmen Rodríguez Martínez de 41 y Ayda Lea González González de 35. Mirna, la coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de frituras y platanitos de manera ambulante en su comunidad y en los colegios aledaños. Virginia, vende leña y carbón en su casa de habitación; y Ayda se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo y además vende hielo y helados en su casa.

Estas mujeres desean aumentar su capital de trabajo e invertirán el monto prestado en la compra de más materia prima para seguir laborando.
texts.en:
Mirna María López M., 29, Virginia del Carmen Rodríguez Martínez, 41,and Ayda Lea González González, 35, make up the “Rey de Reyes” (King of Kings) communal bank. Mirna is group Coordinator. She sells fried snacks and fried banana chips throughout her community and nearby schools. Virginia sells firewood and charcoal from home and Ayda sells catalogue cosmetics and also sells ice and ice cream in her home. These women aim to increase their working capital and will invest the total loan in the purchase of more ingredients and raw materials to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Ronavic

texts.en: Ronavic  P. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Maasin, Brgy. Gargato, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food vending business. Her husband Joel P., who is 28 years old, works as a driver, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is five years old. Ronavic joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to achieve something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ronavic has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 4000 increased her monthly income to PHP 6000, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to stock her general store so that she may continue to save up for her child's education. Ronavic P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Stock store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna G., 40, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Arbi L. G. and mother to two young college kids and two high school students. By the grace of God, Lorna has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Lorna operates a direct selling business and manages a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling at piece rate prices. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lorna dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 34-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a permanent house and lives with seven family members. His family dream is to improve his household income. Peter is a motorcycle rider and has been in the business for 10 years now. He says his business dream is to have his own motorcycle. His challenges are irregular customers and fluctuating fuel prices. He needs this loan to buy his own motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: You

texts.en:
You S. is 28 years old and works as a local teacher at Takeo province. He is able to make about US$2 each day, while his wife (shown in the photo), works in the field, growing rice. This couple has two children living at home to support.

Because You S. spends a lot on transportation, he is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en: Lhagvajav D. is 42 years old and lives with husband in their apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. Lhagvajav operates a business making clothes out of her home. She began her business in 1992 after graduating as a seamstress in Russia in 1987. She makes a variety of clothes according to her customers’ specifications. After many years of owning this business, she has gained much experience and designs high quality clothing items. Lhagvajav is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and materials

loans.name: Tim

texts.en:
Mrs. Tim S., 29, is a cake seller who, since early 2008, has been operating her business located in Kompong Tom province. She buys her ingredients on credit to make cakes, and pays after she finishes selling. She is able to generate about $3.50 each day to support the requirements of her family. 

Another source of family income comes from her husband’s job. He sells wooden beds that he has made himself. Currently, his business is going well, so he wishes to expand his business by buying some wood to make more beds to sell. This is why Mrs. Tim S. is requesting a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy wood for making beds to sell

loans.name: Julius Kimani

texts.en:
Julius is 32 years old and married to Jane Wangui. They have one child. For the last 12 years, Julius has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

Julius was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his first loan of 30,000 KES well and in good time.  Julius will use this loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Julius hopes to practice large-scale dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson has a mixed farm in Litein town, Rift valley Kenya that produces tea and pineapples. He has been in the farming business for six years now and employs one farmhand. He is also employed as a driver.

He has requested a loan of 50,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. His major challenges are lack of enough animal feeds and diseases which affects his production.

Robinson is 28 years old and married with one child who attends school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the village of Katipa. She is 64 years old. Lolita is married and has six adult children. 

To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general store. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2002, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides tiene 37 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Aristides trabaja en la municipalidad del Cusco como chofer pero también se dedica a la venta de minerales, él requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para el estudio de su hija. 
     
Aristides pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Aristides, 37, has a child and lives in the city of Pisaq in Calca province, Cusco department, Perú.  He works for the City of Cusco as a Driver but also sells minerals.  He needs the loan for personal use, specifically for his daughter’s schooling.

Aristides is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means while also committing to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: He needs the loan for personal use, specifically for his daughter's schooling.

loans.name: Ánge

texts.es: El Sr A. labora como Higienista es soltero, tiene cuatro persona al su cargo  es el No. 7 del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que  le ha dado esta institución con  este  desembolso para comprar terreno..
texts.en: Mr. A. works as a janitor and he is single. He has four individuals in his care. This is the seventh loan granted to him by Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and he is thankful for the support granted to him by this organization. This loan will be used to purchase land.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana S. is from the village of Pob. Manukan. She is 37 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. 

Ana operates a family member's sari-sari (general) store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for her store renovation. 

Ana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her store. This will be the second loan taken out by Ana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Tô

texts.en:
N. Tô Thị  (20206030049) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N.. She is married and has three adult children.  

To making a living, N. sells liquor such as beer and wine in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,496,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  

N. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to buy more products to meet the demand of customer. This will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Tô Thị  (20206030049) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc N..  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán loại thức uống có cồn như bia & rượu trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to buy more products to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda B. is from the village of Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 30 years old, married, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Luzviminda has been involved in her business for over four years, and she earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and her ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a loan of 2000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip K. is 52 years old, married, and has eight children. He runs an agrovet in Kambu market near Kibwezi town.which he has been doing for the last year. Kambu is a dry area in which the prevailing economic activity is livestock farming. His clients are mainly people from Kambu and its environment. 

Philip was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing member; this is his second loan from KADET LTD. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to stock the agrovet.

loans.use: To buy veterinary equipment and medicine

loans.name: John Karanja

texts.en:
John has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 40 years-old, married to Leah Nduta and they have two children.  

He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is 28 years old. Her 2 children are not yet in school, aged 8 months and 3 years old. She separated from her husband and she takes care of the children alone. She sells clothes in the market and she has done this business for 6 years. This business enables her to meet all of her family's needs. 

Racheal is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell, in order to make more profits. She plans to have savings and also to pay her children’s school fees with the extra profits that she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a teacher. Aba has been selling cosmetics in Elmina for the past 10 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Aba will use this loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business as a result of the loan, she plans to plough back into her business.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is the father of seven between the ages of 23 and 6 and lives with his family in his hometown area of Nyamira, North Rift, Kenya. He has two farmhands and his farm produces tea, coffee, bananas and maize. He makes additional income from his trade in animals within the local market.

Jackson has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to pay for the education of his children and raise their living standards. He plans to own five cows and construct a modern dairy unit for his animals.

Jackson is grateful for the loans provided by Juhudi Kilimo but says animal diseases and rampant theft of cows are great threats to dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 63 years old and a married woman with three adult children. She is a farmer from the town of Santa Josefa, Agusan Del Sur.

Teresa primarily grows rice to sell. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP because she needs to purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities. Teresa hopes this loan will help to improve her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco conocimos a la señora Santusa y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Canas, tengo 44 años edad, tengo seis hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mis actividades económicas que son: venta de golosinas en el parque principal de la ciudad”. 

Santusa es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, a ella una amiga le invito a participar en el nuevo  banco comunal “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” de la Asociación Arariwa y ella accede al préstamo para invertir en el negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo galletas y chocolates.
texts.en:
We met Santusa in the middle of the small settlement of Kiteni, Quillabamba District, La Convención Province in Cusco and she told us: 

“I was born in the city of Canas.  I’m 44 years old and have six children.  I now live in the city of Kiteny where I carry out my economic activities which are: selling snacks in the city’s municipal park.”

Santusa is a tenacious, enterprising woman who is moving her family forward.  A girl friend invited her to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s new, “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” communal bank and she’s accessing the loan to invest in her business; she wants to buy merchandise, like cookies and chocolates, for example.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cookies and chocolates, for example.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana Gladys de 53 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su compañero de vida Manuel de 74 años de edad el cual ya es un hombre pensionado. Ella posee una tortillería la cual atiende todos los días con mucha dedicación y amabilidad. El negocio de Ana se encuentra en una zona muy transitada y estratégica semiurbana ya que alrededor se encuentran muchos negocios que son sus principales clientes. Además de la venta de tortillas, todas las tarde se dedica a la venta de ricas pupusas. Ana es una mujer ejemplar que no se cansa de trabajar a pesar de su avanzada edad. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su tortillería que es el negocio más fuerte que tiene. El crédito lo necesita para invertir en la compra de: maíz, leña, agua, gas propano, etc. De esta manera espera mejorar sus ventas, su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Gladys is 53 years old.  She lives in her own home with her life partner Manuel, who's 74 years old and a pensioner.  

She has a tortilla business that she attends to every day with dedication and kindness.  Ana's business is located strategically in a very busy,semi-urban area, where she is surrounded by many businesses that are her main customers.  In addition to selling tortillas, she sells rich pupusas (stuffed tortillas) every evening.

Ana is an exemplary woman who never tires of working despite her advanced age.  She has decided to apply for this loan through INTEGRAL to invest in her tortilla business, so the business will become stronger.  She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of corn, wood, water, propane, etc.  In this way she hopes to improve her sales, her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, water, propane, etc.

loans.name: Abakundumurimo (Mrm) Group

texts.fr: Félicien est le client d.ACB, il est le membre du groupe Abakundumurimo .Il  est  célibataire, il a 30 ans, il vit avec son petit frère et il est dans son charge, il est Rwandais, il  a 6 ans des études secondaire. C’est son première cycle de prêt avec ACB, et avec le prêt il va acheter des fertilisants (urée, NPK) pour les champs des tomates.la stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer les activités actuelle de l’agriculture de tomates en augmentant la quantité des tomates pour satisfaire le marché. Pour son ambition il voudrait être un grand distributeur de tomates dans sa région, paye les frais des scolarités pour son petit frère  et prépare l’avenir pour sa famille.
texts.en: Félicien is a client of the microfinance institution ACB and a member of Abakundumurimo Group. He is single, 30 years old and Rwandese. He lives with his younger brother who is under his care. He studied until sixth grade in secondary school. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy fertilizers (urea, nitrogen-phosphorous-potassium fertilizer) for his tomato fields. His growth strategy consists in improving his current tomato crops and harvesting more tomatoes to satisfy the demand from the market. His ambition is to become a great tomato seller in his area, pay the tuition fees for his young brother and secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (urea, nitrogen-phosphorous-potassium fertilizer) for his tomato fields.

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli is 42 years old and single. He is a farmer who tills land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Noli primarily grows rice crops to sell. With his income, he is able to help his family financially.

Noli has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to continue earning and save for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives and works in Jukwa selling cloth. After completing senior high school she started her business and she has now been selling cloth for 14 years. She hopes to use the loan money to buy cloth to sell and the profits to feed and support her two children. She plans to reinvest back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty has been a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) for the past two years. Last year, she took out a loan through the ELA program in the amount of 200,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX). She used the money to buy braids and treatment oil for her salon. With these extra supplies, Resty's business has grown, and Resty was able to fully pay back the 200,000 UGX, with interest. Because of the success of the first loan, Resty is now eligible for a loan of 300,000 UGX from the ELA program. She plans on using this loan to buy more braids and other hair products to continue to expand her business. 

Resty would like to thank BRAC, Kiva, and the lenders who contributed towards her efforts to build her business. You can support BRAC Uganda and other entrepreneurs like Resty by contributing to one of our current fundraising loans or by joining the Friends of BRAC Uganda lending team.

loans.use: to pay for materials to make braids.

loans.name: Aleida Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica poblado san Jacinto departamento de león, la señora Aleida se dedica arduamente  a laborar como maestra, actualmente esta desempeñándose como Docente en el colegio antes mencionado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 30 años, es Soltera con 1 hijo al que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle.
Una de las necesidades que la señora Aleida atraviesa hoy en día es de Mejorar su vivienda, la que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Bloques, Hierro y Mano de Obra, ya que por medio de esta actividad brindara mejores condiciones y nivel  de vida y a ella propia. Cabe mencionar la importancia de la actividad en la familia, por el mejoramiento mismo
texts.en:
In San Jacinto village, which is located in the municipality of Telica in the department of León, Señora Aleida works very hard as a teacher and is currently working in the local school. She has been teaching for 30 years. She is a single mother of one and she must provide her son with everything he needs for his development.

One thing that Señora Aleida now needs is to improve her home which is in bad condition. Due to this necessity she has taken the wise decision to visit CEPRODEL to apply for a loan to pay for construction materials such as: blocks, iron and labor. This activity will result in providing improved living conditions and a better standard of living. It is worth mentioning how important this activity is to the family, for the improvement of their lives.

loans.use: to purchase construction material such as: blocks, iron and labor.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: El señor Genaro vive en la zona de Lagunas  de la ciudad de el Alto,  con su esposa y sus tres hijos pequeños de los cuales el mayor ya esta en la escuela, el señor  es sastre desde hace varios años se dedica  a la  confección de  uniformes para policías, con los cuales el tiene contratos para la entrega de uniformes, vive en casa propia donde esta su taller   el necesita capital para invertirlo en la compra de telas por rollo su mayor sueño es tener una microempresa y poder contrata mano de obra para dar oportunidad a otros jóvenes de aprender un oficio y también el de ver algún día  profesionales a sus hijos  y brindarles comodidad, es un apersona emprendedora con muchas ganas de superación y de mejorar su calidad de vida de el y de toda su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Genaro lives in the area of Lagunas in the city of El Alto with his wife and three small children, the eldest of which is in school.  Genaro is a tailor and has been making police uniforms for several years under contract.  He lives in his own house where he has his workshop.  He is in need of capital to buy rolls of fabric.  His goal is to have a microenterprise and be able to hire young people and give them the opportunity to learn a skill.  He also wants his children to be professionals one day so they will have a better lifestyle.  He is an enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Jonibek

texts.ru: Чонибек женат имеет двоих детей. Семья молодая. Жена работает учительницей. Содержать семью в городе очень трудно. Цены высокие, расходы большие. Вот и стал Чонибек заниматься бизнесом-продажей женских тканей. Стартовый капитал он взял у своей тети. Для получения большего дохода и пополнения товарооборота он хочет получить займ и расширить свой бизнес. Он надеется на ваше великодушие и поддержку.
texts.en: Jonibek is married and has two children. They are a young family and his wife works as a teacher. It is difficult to support a family in the city because prices are high and there are many bills to pay. So Jonibek decided to start a business - selling fabric for women's clothing. His aunt provided him with start-up capital. To increase his income and turnover, he wants to apply for a loan to expand his business. He is counting on your generosity and support.

loans.use: purchase goods

loans.name: Makalie Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Makalie” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in order to further develop their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata who is age 39. Fatmata was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For four years now, Fatmata has been selling clothes and shoes. With this loan, she will buy clothes and shoes wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is a 29 year old young man. He has a mobile phone store, one of his brothers has a barber shop and another is a worker with decent salary. Yousef wants to expand his store and improve it by purchasing mobile phones and their accessories in bulk to resell. He hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Yousef gets the loan, he will purchase more mobile phones and their accessories. This enable him to have abetter selection and the chance to compete with others  as well. He hopes to increase his profits In this way so that he will live in better living conditions. Yousef is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and their accessories to resell.

loans.name: Loida Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Loida Elizabeth, es una señora trabajadora que dia a día se dedica a su negocio  para darle una vida mejor a su familia, desde hace años ella a empezado su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa típica que lo realiza en el mercado municipal de su localidad en los días de mercado y también sale a vender a otros municipios en los días de mercado porque ella esta apoyando a su esposo para poder sacar adelante a su familia ya que están bajo su responsabilidad sus ocho hijos que necesitan el cuidado y el apoyo de sus padres, en los tiempos libres que ella tiene se dedica a elaborar tejidos típicos a mano para después venderlos, gracias a dios todo le ha salido bien y ahora necesita un capital para poder surtir mas su negocio con diferentes trajes típicos y obtener un poco mas de ganancia. en si el credito lo esta solicitando para compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
Loida Elizabeth is a hard-working woman who works at her business on a day to day basis in order to give her family a better life. Years ago she started her business buying and selling traditional clothes in her local town market on market days. She also goes to other municipalities to sell on their market days because she is supporting her husband in order to help her family get ahead. She has eight children under her responsibility who need the care and support of their parents. 

She spends her free time hand making traditional fabrics to later sell. Thanks be to God everything has worked out fine and she now needs a loan to be able to stock her business with different traditional costumes and obtain a little more profit. In itself she is requesting the loan to buy supplies to make traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela, 61, is married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 9 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP. 

Rosela has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase more products to resell. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to resell

loans.name: Amour

texts.en:
Amour is from Quirino, Isabela and married to Vilma. The couple has four grown up children. Amour's primary source of income is planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has 1.5 hectare of land. His business is very profitable for the region. He is earning a net income of 7,000 PHP monthly for this kind of activity. 

Amour is a hard working and responsible individual. He always wanted to save some funds for the future of his family. He is not going to stop at what he has achieved, but plans to develop the business further. Amour is asking for a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm. He is hoping that lenders will approve his request because that loan is of great help for the improvement of his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis, 25 years old, is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as a social and talkative man. For the last two years, Denis has been selling cabbages in a busy market. His customers are hotels and residents. His business challenge is the high cost of transportation when buying the cabbages. He will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cabbages. In the future, he sees himself as a wholesaler and distributor of the cabbages. Denis also hopes to have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Eulalia has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Eulalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eulalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association SIBAMONDOUMA de DIALAKOROBA. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne six enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements  à l’image de FANTA  qui est la première personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à DIALAKOROBA dans la préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente d’habillements : pagne wax et balle de friperie.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. 
FANTA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  DIALAKOROBA, excellente dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 05 pièces de pagne wax et de 1 balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  DIALAKOROBA en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group within the Sibamondouma association in Dialakoroba. It brings together women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. They are on average 41 years old, married with six children.

They lead different activities such as the trading of clothes like Fanta, who is the first person standing from right to left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Dialakoroba, part of the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are much sought after in their commerce of clothing: pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric) and bales of used clothing.

To satisfy the growing demands of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, where they are on their fourth group loan.

Fanta, who is the president of the group and well known in Dialakoroba, excels at selling clothes. She intends to use her loan to buy five lengths of pagne wax fabric and one bale of used clothing.

She gets her supplies in Bamako and from local wholesalers, and conducts her retail sales in Dialakoroba, for cash and on credit, to a mixed clientele.

She is hoping to achieve monthly profits of 30,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her clothing business activity.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Khurshedjon

texts.en: Khurshedjon is a responsible father. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. He is living in small town with his family. He is married and has three children. His wife is a teacher. He has six year work experience in secondary school. Recently it is 5 year as he works at their village as a secretary of governance of this village. At the same time he tries to work on himself studying and learning at university. He doesn’t waste a time and goes ahead to be self-efficient. The salary that he earns is not enough to pay his tuition fee of studies. Beside education costs he has to ensure his family. He appealed to IMON and asked a loan to pay his higher education costs. He awaits KIVA lenders kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Dusahidiane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dusahidiane est composée de 5 femmes.Sur la photo Shakina est remplacée par son mari Elysée.
Mariane est la représentante du groupe.Elle  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a  35 ans et est mariée  à Juvénal, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 3 à  17 ans, tous étudient. Elle a sous sa charge un enfant membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce  des habits et des produits de beauté   depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à  son  quatrième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait avoir un grand magasin des habits.

loans.use: elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits   à revendre pour gagner plus.

loans.name: Violeta Deyanira

texts.en:
Violeta is mother to two young children. Her husband is a laborer and they all live in Escobedo, Nuevo Leon. Her husband Juventino\\\'s income was not enough to cover all the household costs, which is why 5 years ago she decided to start selling shoes by catalogue. And having seen success in the business she has continued on until today.
