Violeta\\\'s objective is to contribute and support her husband and to be able to secure a better quality of life and an education for her children.

She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to expand her business by purchasing more inventory and meet the demands of her clients, and reinvest some of her earnings back into the business. Become part of the family\\\'s successes. They are very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Violeta es madre de dos pequeños, su esposo es obrero y viven en Escobedo Nuevo León. El sueldo de Juventino no alcanza para poder cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que hace 5 años ella decidió iniciarse en la venta de zapatos por catálogo, y al ver que obtenía ingresos extras ha continuado con ésta actividad hasta el momento. El objetivo de Violeta es ofrecer apoyo a su marido y poder garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos.

Ella esta solicitando un crédito de $250 DLLS para poder hacer crecer su negocio al tener mayor capital para surtir los pedidos de sus clientes en ésta época y poder reinvertir parte de sus ganancias. Se parte de los logros de la Familia Ávila B., ellos te estarán sumamente agradecidos.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tevekkul

texts.en:
Tevekkul opened dental clinic for 3 years ago. In the beginning of his business he borrowed $400 to purchase some basic dentistry tools.
He wants to improve his dental clinic in order to improve the quality of services to his clients.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy medicines.
Tevekkul is 39 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region. He settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. Tevekkul is married and has a child.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Vaiolupe

texts.en: Vaiolupe is twenty-one years old and is married with one daughter.  When her daughter was born, she knew that she would need to take it upon herself to support her family financially.  In school, she learned how to print fabrics by hand.  She used this knowledge and an initial SPBD loan to start up her fabric printing business.  Vaiolupe is now seeking a second loan to purchase supplies that will enable her to expand her product line, such as a larger quantity of better quality materials and different types of paints.  She knows that her family will grow, and she wants to take responsibility for ensuring that she can support that growth.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and printing paints

loans.name: Zulfugar

texts.en: Zulfugar is 39 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in Gusarchay village, in the Khachmaz region. He has six years of farming experience, and would like a loan of $825 to purchase fertilizer and medicines to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a widow who supports herself with her small market business selling women’s clothing. She operates her business from a small but abundantly stocked kiosk at the bustling central market in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. She sells a variety of clothing including women’s pajamas, slippers and shirts.

Nina has been running her business for about three years now. She is a friendly, careful entrepreneur who is true to her word. In profits, Nina makes about $300 USD per month. Her goal is to be able to earn enough so that she can improve her currently poor living conditions.

Nina has requested a loan of $1000 USD to purchase new inventory for her business. We are happy for this additional opportunity to help Nina as she works to provide for herself in the future.

loans.use: To purchase apparel inventory

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana takes a tro-tro (Ghanaian mini-bus) from 10:00pm to 4:00am every 2-4 weeks just so she can purchase the best cloth for her business. She buys and distributes polyester and lace cloth to businesses in and around the Kumasi central market. When she has extra time, Diana walks around busy areas in Kumasi selling the cloth that she is able to balance on the top of her head.

This is Diana's second loan with Sinapi Aba Trust. She used the first loan to jump-start her business by purchasing $650 of polyester and lace cloth. Diana wants to expand her business with your loan in order to purchase undershirts and boxer shorts.

With the money she earns, Diana hopes to one day own her own store. It can be very tiring to her health distributing products after spending all night on a tro-tro. She has also expressed that she has some pain in her neck and head from carrying products to sell on the streets.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing undershirts and boxer shorts.

loans.name: Nghor

texts.en: Mrs. Nghor S., 26, is a mother of one school-aged child and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She stays at home cooking food and her husband works at home operating a stand where he charges a variety of batteries for the people in his area. He earns on average around $7/day. In order to help her family generate more income, Mrs. Nghor S. would like to open a business selling sugar cane juice in her community. She is requesting a loan of $700 so she can purchase a machine used to produce sugar can juice, utensils, chairs, tables, and other items for her new business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine used to produce sugar can juice, utensils, chairs, tables and other items for a new business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun L., 29, is a mother of two school-aged children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her plot of land growing yams and raising pigs, earning on average around $5 each day. Her husband operates a motor-taxi business and typically earns about $8 each day in revenue. Mrs. Oun L. has applied for a loan to purchase a mini truck to enable her to carry a large quantity of her yams to sell in her community. This will raise her income.

loans.use: To purchase a mini truck to enable her to carry a larger quantity of her yams to sell.

loans.name: Zabidahon

texts.ru:
Zabidahon M. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 29 years old, single and does not have children. She has a university degree in education. Zabidahon works in school №1 of Quargan-Tube. Additionally, she has a business. She sews dresses and sells them to clients. She would like to use her loan to purchase material in order to sew dresses and sell them to clients. She plans to repay her loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Мамаджанова Забидахон Рахманджановна жительница города Курган-тюбе.Возраст 29 лет , не замужем, детей не имеет. Образование высшее, по специальности преподаватель средней школы. Работает в лицее №1 г. Курган-тюбе. Кроме того работает в сфере производства. Занимается пошивом платьев. Планирует получить кредит для приобретения материала, чтобы отшивать платья и продавать клиентам. Кредит планирует погасить в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase material for dresses

loans.name: Lourdes Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Lourdes Teresa is a woman with a sharp sense of humor and charisma, and she is the leader of a group of five businesswomen in San Cristobal. She sells men’s and women’s clothing. Lourdes explains that she pays close attention to customer demand and the season when she makes the purchases of goods to add to her inventory. She says that her business is successful and profitable. She plans to use her loan to purchase more clothing in bulk in order to increase her sales volume and her income.

The loan funds will be distributed among the five entrepreneurs, and each one will invest her loan in her own business.

The other members of the group are:

Lucia D. L. S. Martinez, who sells clothing in bulk.

Daysi Victoria P. M., an active woman that sells a collection of beauty products.

Miguelina C., who runs a small grocery store.

Amantina D. L. S. Martinez

NOTE: Members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one of the members fails in repaying the loan, the other members will have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk to boost a small business.  The others entrepreneurs will invest their funds in their own business.

loans.name: Salima's Kusaidiana Group

texts.en: Salima is 30 years old and is a married woman. Salima is a cloth seller with a business she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $775 to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in fish sales, charcoal and firewood sales, cloth sales and shop management.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Sareth Muth Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth M. is the group leader of four members in the Chey Bak Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife and she always cooks food for her children. She is 50 years old and a widow of three children, one of whO. is employed at a garment factory while another one is a primary school teacher. The youngest is studying in state school.

Mrs. Sareth M. and her children live in small house. Additionally, her house is old and the roof always leaks during rainy season. Now, Mrs. Sareth M. is asking for a loan to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house.

loans.name: Selling Vegetables And Fruits Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy N. (her husband is in picture on the left) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are four families including hers. The entire group members are living along National road number six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Chanthy N. (age 41) and her husband were married in 1992. They have one son, who is in school. She has been selling vegetables in her village for over one year.  Her husband, Mr. Koeun Phreap has been a construction worker for two years. Now Chanty is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase vegetables for resale.

2- Mrs. Nara N., aged 51 (the second shown in the picture from the left) and her husband were married in 1979 and have five children, two sons and three daughters. She has been selling food products for over three years. Her husband is a driver for an organization in Phnom Penh. Now Nara is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase vegetables and meat to cook for selling.

3- Mrs. Nat M., 65, (the second shown in the picture from the right) and her husband were married in 1971 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. She and her husband have been selling water melons for four years. Now Nat is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase water melons for resale.

4- Mrs. Thea M., 29, (shown in the picture at the right) and her husband were married in 1995 and have two daughters. She has been selling fruit for two years. Her husband, Mr. At Sum has been a mason for over ten years. Now Thea is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruit for resale

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji (baji is the Urdu term of respect meaning "elder sister") is the wife of S. M.; they have been living in Kasur, Pakistan for the last 20 years. She is the mother of eight children: four sons and four daughters. Her eldest son, 20 years old, drives an auto-rickshaw. The remaining children are enrolled in a local school near the family's neighborhood. Her husband is a driver who also drives a rented auto-rickshaw. Sakina baji successfully completed her loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and now is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit business. Parveen baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Rashida baji also wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Kure

texts.en: Kure J. is 45 years old, married and has five children. Since 1990, he has made a living operating a palm-kernel plantation that he owns in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is applying for a loan of $1,200 to process palm kernels into palm oil.

loans.use: To process palm kernals into palm oil

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada was born in 1977, and she lives with her husband and two children in the town of Doboj. Nada is a housewife and her wish is to start making cookies at her home. She has a lot of free time and she wants to use this loan to buy ingredients for making cookies. She will buy molds in order to have more interesting cookies to sell in her neighborhood and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making cookies.

loans.name: Luavalu

texts.en: Luavalu G., 50, is married with 8 children. She has many years of experience in a taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public 3 days per week. She has had 5 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately 145 USD). SPBD loans are Luavalu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and a shovel. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: To purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and a shovel

loans.name: Sarum Ket's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum K. (pictured on the right, with her group member on the left) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. The group members live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sarum, 54, and her husband, Mr. Yat Sun, 61, were married in 1979 and have six children, four sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Two sons are silk weavers and one son raise cows. Her two daughters have full time employment in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sarum has been weaving since she was 21 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a fisherman.

Mrs. Sarum is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to run her weaving business.

The other group member, Mrs. Sary K., 47 has been married for over 13 years to Mr. Vat So, 63. They have four children, two sons and two daughters, who all study in local school.

Mrs. Sary has been weaving since she was 13 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband does farming. He grows corns and tomatoes.

Mrs. Sary is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to run her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokren Yem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan is made up of eighteen people in Tong Rong Village in Kampong Cham Province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sokren Y., the village bank president, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice and earn a living. Her husband, Mr. T. Mol, collects palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine. In this business effort, at present he cannot proceed because he does not have enough material to conduct it. Thus, Mrs. Sokren Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie to a palm tree for her husband to climb up and gather palm juice. 

Mrs. Sokren Y. is 34 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child who is too young to wO. or study.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to tie to a palm tree for her husband to climb up and gather palm juice

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca  de 55 años de edad esta, felizmente casada hace 35 años con el Señor Ramón Fleitas   de 69 años. El matrimonio tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales uno  de ellos ya esta casado. Los otros cuatros viven con sus padres, todos están trabajando y ayudan en los gastos de la casa.
 Doña Francisca se encuentra al frente de una tienda de ventas de telas  en el cual se inició hace 20 años. Actualmente cuenta también con cinco salones que esta alquilando.  Como sueño personal desea remodelar dos salones que tiene en la avenida principal de la ciudad, para alquilar. 
La clienta solicita el crédito para la compra de tela para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Francisca is 55 years old and happily married for 35 years to 69 year old Mr. Ramón Fleitas. The couple has 5 children, one of whom is now married. The other four live with their parents, they are all working and help with the household expenses. Francisca can be found at a fabric store she opened 20 years ago. Today she also has five locales that she is renting. She dreams of remodeling two of the locales she has on the city’s main avenue in order to rent them. She is seeking a loan to buy fabric for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different types of fabric

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep H., 36, lives in the province of Banteay Meanchey, Cambodia, where she owns and runs a plot of land next to her house growing vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of five children. All of them are single and still live in the family home. She is married to Srey Thoun, age 38, who is a local horse-cart driver. He also buys oxen from far-away places to raise and re-sell for a profit. Because oxen-selling is a very important business for earing money, Thoun and his wife would like to ask for a loan to buy extra oxen to raise and sell.

loans.use: to buy extra oxen to raise and sell

loans.name: Gatete

texts.en:
“Assalamu alaikum", which means peace be to you, from GATETE A. in Remera sector, Gasabo District, Kigali the capital city of Rwanda!! A. is 29 years old, single without orphans.

A. is a bead worker; he has been employed in a barbershop as a barber for 3 years and he decided to open his own barbershop at Remera in Gasabo District near the AMAHORO Stadium. A. employs 7 people who help him to run the businees. His Barbershop is called HAVANA Barbershop.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 515,000Rwf, which will be used in to buy more material in order to expand his business. A. believe that once he gets this loan, the number of staff will increase and also his monthly income will increase. This loan will be repaid in 12 months on monthly basis.

loans.use: Exapand his Business

loans.name: Ayub

texts.ru: Мелиев Аюб молодой парень, неженат. Проживает со своими родителями и чтобы помочь своим родителям занимается мелким предпринимательством – выпекает национальный хлеб лепешки. Оборот его бизнеса небольшой, но приносит хорошую прибыль и поддерживает семейный бюджет. Чтобы увеличить количество выпекаемых лепешек Аюб решил получить займ. На полученные деньги он собирается купить муку и уголь.
texts.en:
Ayub M. is a young man, he is not married. He lives with his parents and helps them by running a small business - he bakes Tajik national flatbreads. His turnover is not very big, but gives him a good income which supports the family budget. To increase the amount of his production of flatbreads Ayub has decided to get a loan. He will use the loan to buy flour and coal.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and coal

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru:
Саёхат,"Мелиева Саёхатхон Абдукаюмовна",1979,0,1600,0000,6,20015134,"28.02.2009","Савдо",48,0000

Саёхат исполнилось 30 лет, она замужем. Ее муж нигде не работает и подрабатывает на частных работах. Заработок непостоянный и никогда нельзя сказать что будет завтра. Сейчас Саёхат устроилась на работу к одному богатому человеку и работает у него на даче: смотрит за скотом, работает на огороде. Недавно Саёхат договорилась со своим хозяином и он дал согласие, чтобы она могла купить баранов и смотреть тут же на даче. Сейчас у нее 4 барана и она решила обратиться в МикроИнвест за получением займа и прикупить еще 4 баранов.
texts.en:
Sayohat turned 30 years old, she is married. Her husband does not have a job and takes temporary jobs. The income is not regular and one can never say what will happen tomorrow. Right now Sayohat got a job from a wealthy individual and works at his summer home: oversees the livestock, works in the garden. Recently Sayohat made an agreement with her boss and he gave his agreement that she could purchase sheep and raise them at the summer house. Right now she has 4 sheep and she has decided to turn to MicroInvest for a loan and to purchase 4 more sheep.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four sheep

loans.name: Mireya Del Socorro

texts.es: Mireya esta solicitando  su 4to refinanciamiento para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es Compra de zinc y perlines para cambiarle el techo a la casa antes que llegue el invierno, trabaja comos delegada del INSS en nueva Guinea desde hace 2 años, esta clienta tiene dos hijos el Mayor de 20 años estudia su segundo año en la universidad URACCAN y el  menor de 17 años estudia su 5to año de educacion secundaria, su esposo tambien trabaja como tecnico en la planta procesadora de frutas, tambien trabaja en los dias libres en finca que ellos tienen, ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos. Mireya es una mujer que  inició a laborar desde temprana edad ya que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos,  desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, expresa  se siente feliz  con su trabajo pues ayuda a su familia con lo que ella puede,  posee un alto espiritud de superación personal, su sueño es poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y que a sus familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Mireya is requesting her fourth loan to invest in making improvements to her home, including replacing the roof with new zinc paneling and beams before the winter rains arrive. For two years, Mireya has worked as a delegate at the Nicaraguan Social Security Institute, and she is the mother of two children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and a sophomore at URACCAN (the University of the Regions of the Caribbean Coast of Nicaragua), and her 17-year-old is in the fifth year of secondary school. Her husband works as a technician in a fruit processing plant and spends his free time working at their family farm. They both share responsibility for household expenses and financial obligations.

Mireya is a woman who began working when she was very young, since her family had few financial resources. She carries out her work in a very responsible manner, and feels happy to be able to help her family however she can. She is highly motivated to get ahead, and her dream is to little by little improve her standard of living so that her family wants for nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc and beams to replace roof

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá en el barrio Cerrito distante a 8km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 

Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las  actividades ya mencionados mas arriba.  Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
texts.en:
In Carapeguá city, 8 km from the Carapeguá office, some women of scant resources entered the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras of the Paraguay Foundation. They decided to get together to receive information about the program. These women are active and hard working. They are engaged in the activities mentioned (see sidebar). They are looking for a little more support. A loan will give their family income a boost and improve their quality of life. They need operating capital to invest in their respective jobs. Then they can achieve sustainable growth. This will make them grow individually and as a group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread for weaving

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo  "8 D. diciembre" están representados por la señora Geovana Angelica y conformada por 12 miembros dentro D. los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Neyza y su hija Leticia, en todos los casos se cuenta con ingresos independientes. Este grupo tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. ropa, comida, promotoras D. cosméticos,  tiendas en su barrio y a la elaboración D. pan. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda por lo que los integrantes del grupo están concientes que deben esforzarse para que sus productos sean D. buena calidad y a un bajo precio para competir en el mercado. El crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden al desarrollo D. sus pequeños puestos D. venta. A pesar D. que las socias se encuentran es su primer ciclo como grupo solidario en la institución ya contaban con experiencia D. otras entidades similares por lo que cuentan con la habilidad para la buena administración D. los fondos y con la responsabilidad que se requiere para cumplir a tiempo con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the 8th of December Group are represented by Señora Geovana Angelica and consists of twelve members among whom there exists a strong relationship between Señora Neyza and her daughter Leticia, and all of them have independent incomes. This group engages in various activities such as the sale of clothing, or meals, cosmetics saleswomen, neighborhood stores and baking bread. As in all commercial areas, you have supply and demand, and the group members are aware that they must struggle with this, so that their products will be of good quality and at a low price in order to compete in the marketplace. The loan is intended for product diversification and materials acquisition, ingredients and tools that help to develop the small market stands. Although these members are in their first cycle as a solidarity group, they have experience in other similar organizations and have the capacity for good administration of the funds and have the resonsibility required to fulfill their obligations on time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Jonayon

texts.en:
Jonayon D. is from the city of San  Simon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 25 years old, is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jonayon owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Jonayon is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jonayon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Jonayon has repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. Now she is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will also be used to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to support he child's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Salina

texts.en: Salina G. is 27 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Salina trades in vegetables such as onions on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Salina has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Гулбахор женщина 1961 года рождения. Вдова и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с сыновьями. Гулбахор откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Гулбахор продают их на скотном рынке. Гулбахор кредитуется в нашей организации более 1 года. Она успешно закончила предыдущие займы, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Гулбахор планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Гулбахор очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gulbahor is a woman who was born in 1961. She is a widow and has four children. She feeds and sells cattle together with her sons. Gulbahor feeds cattle at home and when it's ready for sale her sons sell it on the cattle market. Gulbahor has been taking out loans at our organization for more than a year. She has successfully completed her previous loans and now wants to take out a new loan. Gulbahor plans to increase the amount of cattle and by that increase the profit for her family. Gulbahor very much likes the terms of our loans and is happy that organization like these exist and support the communities.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria I. sells gari (fried grated cassava), maize and kenkey (fermented maize dumplings) at Atabadze near Elmina. Victoria has received a senior high school education.  She is a single parent and has six dependents. Victoria has been selling gari, maize and kenkey since 1990. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy maize and other ingredients for the preparation of the food for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing food for resale.

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
H. Elise is married and has one boy, a toddler. Elise is a hairdresser. She runs a beauty salon and also sells cosmetic products and other various goods on the side.  She buys her goods in Cotonou.  Elise brings her son with her to work and watches over him while she is cutting or braiding hair. 

Elise is seeking a loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin.  She would like to restock her salon.  Specifically, she wants to buy notebooks in preparation for the upcoming school year and cosmetic products.  She says that notebooks are less expensive over the summer when school is not in session.  Elise hopes to increase her sales with the help of a loan.

loans.use: Cosmetic products and notebooks

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mrs. Chann S., age 30, sells fish that she and her husband purchase from wholesale suppliers and other fishermen. She buys the fish on credit and repays the debt after she sells the fish. She starts her business in the late morning and finishes during the evening with much income. In addition, her husband also uses his motorcycle to run a taxi service for a fee. Chann S. lives with two children who attend school and are dependent on her. Chann S. will be using the loan to buy a plot of farmland in a good location for basic farming. She will rent it out to a farmer for a fee, and she proposes to plant crops on it in the future.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland in a good location for basic farming

loans.name: Eprendededores 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Martina's story is representative of the other members of her group, as well as Esperanza's mixed Dominican and Haitian associates (many of whom have recently illegally migrated to the Dominican Republic and are now looking to start businesses to support their families). Los Alcarrizos is a dusty industrial town north of S. Domingo where running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable at best. This is where Martina makes her home, in a simple structure comprised of wooden walls and a tin roof, with her husband and four young children.

Martina came to Esperanza seeking a loan that would better her business and, by extension, her community. She sells women's shoes and jeans from her home, and it is the primary source of income for her family. She has over two years experience in this business, and she is confident that this new loan will help increase her profits. She plans to use the profit to invest in her family by purchasing a bed for her children and school supplies, including notebooks. Her long term dream is to improve her economic position so that her children will be able to be important individuals in the community.

Martina is the coordinator of the group Emprendededores (roughly translating to "The Movers and Shakers") which is based in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic.

loans.use: To buy women's shoes and jeans

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 46 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Mouhamad has owned a coffee shop for a over year now. He offers all sort of coffee and he also serves narguileh (also known as shisha in Egypt). Narguileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe and other countries. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and change the décor of his coffee shop. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan. 
Mouhamad opened his coffee shop at a strategic point which is in the middle of the city, therefore, he is well known and people feel comfortable going to his coffee shop. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. When Mohamad first started his business, he passed through some financial issues He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work since he was unemployed and couldn’t find a work. In the future, he plans on improving his shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and change the décor of his coffee shop.

loans.name: Nening

texts.en: Nening D. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 21 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Nening owns and operates a small variety store, selling a variety of daily-use products and foods in the local community. She has improved her business activity as the years have passed by and as her loan amounts have increased. In 2008, Nening joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nening is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
El señor Gregorio trabaja como chofer de transporte publico y su esposa es comerciante de ropa ambulante, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones nuevas en su vivienda, porque sus hijos crecen y no cuentan con espacio suficiente.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Gregorio C. lives in his own house in the Pasankeri zone on the west side of La Paz. He lives with his wife and their three children. Gregorio is a public transport driver, and his wife is a roving clothing vendor. With these earnings, they support their family. This loan is for the construction of two new bedrooms in their house, as the children are growing and there is not enough space. This is their fifth loan, and it has been approved by the socioeconomic analysis.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of 2 new bedroom for their house

loans.name: Tali

texts.en: Tali M. is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Lotopa. She is married and has five school-aged children. Tali owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 600 WST a month. In 2007, Tali joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Tali is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes M. is from the village of District 1, Cauayan City. She is 26 years old. Agnes is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by the Kiva field partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Agnes is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Agnes owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $43 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Agnes is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santos Domingo

texts.es: El señor Santos Domingo  H. H., tiene 53 años habita en el Bario Borgoña es casado y su esposa es ama de casa, en ocasiones vende frutas obteniendo ingresos para la aportación  a los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores, cuyas edades van entre los  35, 30 y 28 años de edad, todos son independientes pero viven en el terreno del papá en casas apartes, todos se integran en las tareas de la finca,  desearían en un futuro poder tener las posibilidades de construir un cauce, debido a que en la época del invierno se les inunda todas sus casas, ellos tienen 29 años de dedicarse a este rubro y  el principal problema que han enfrentado a lo largo de estos años, han sido el alza de los precios de los productos, esto incrementa de gran manera los costos de producción, para esto han solicitado de un préstamo para poder brindarle un mejor mantenimiento a la producción de este año, todo este fuerte trabajo se ve encaminado a alcanzar un objetivo, el cual es el poder conseguir la legalización de sus tierras, ellos se han sobresalido por ser una familia muy unida y responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Domingo Hernandez is 53 years old and lives in Barrio Borgoño. He is married and his wife tends the house and, occasionally, sells fruit, adding to household income. They have 3 grown children, aged 28 to 35. All are independent but they live on their father's land in separate houses. And they all carry out tasks on their farm.

In the future, they hope to be able to finish constructing a ditch, because each winter all their houses are flooded. They have dedicated 29 years to farming and the main problem they have encountered over all these years is the rising price of products. This raises greatly the cost of farm production and, for that reason, Santos has solicited a loan to better maintain this year's production.

All this hard work is aimed at achieving an objective, which is to achieve the legalization of their lands. They have overcome much by being a very united and responsible family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO MAINTAIN FARM PRODUCTION

loans.name: Simona Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Simona G. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación.
Simona va usar el crédito para comprar productos para la pulpería.
Quiere el préstamo para incrementar su mercadería y a si poder ofertar diferentes productos a su clientela.
Su negocio empezó cuando empezó a vender hielo, helados, jugos y gaseosas en el vecindario y al ver que vendía mas quiso poner la pulpería.
Simona ha tenido la pulpería en su casa de habitación hace 10 años, trabaja cada día de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche junto con su hija quien le ayuda.
Ella espera que con la compra de estos nuevos productos la clientela aumente.
Simona  es  viuda y madre de dos hijas estas ya no dependen de ella, aunque a veces ella les ayuda a sus nietos.
Ella lleva trece créditos con  CEPRODEL. 
Ha trabajado con ceprodel 6 años, y los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel me han ayudado a que mi negocio sea más solido que la competencia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Simona G. operates a general store from her own home. She will use this loan to buy goods for her store, expanding her merchandise to see if she can offer different products to her customers. She began in business selling ice, ice cream, juices, and soft drinks in the neighborhood. Upon seeing that this sold well, she decided to install a general store. Simona has operated the store from her house for 10 years, working daily from 7 in the morning until 8 at night. Her daughter helps her. Simona hopes that with these new products, her clientèle will increase. Simona is a widow and mother to 2 daughters who no longer depend on her, although at times she provides help to her grandchildren. She has had 13 loans during her 6 years with CEPRODEL, and the loans have helped her business to become more solid than those of the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY NEW PRODUCTS FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Lourdes' Group

texts.en:
Lourdes U. is from the village of Santa Cruz in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old. Lourdes is the leader of a 2-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lourdes is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lourdes plants, harvests, and sells vegetables, like "kalabasa" (squash) in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be Lourdes's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Medardo

texts.en: Medardo and his wife moved their women's clothing import-export business from Mexico City to Miami in 2006, hoping to better serve their increasingly global client base. Their decision paid off since their business has steadily grown; they now have an employee and clients who sell their products locally. Medardo and his wife, originally from Honduras, heard about ACCION USA from their daughter. The proceeds of their loan will be used to purchase bathing suits and sportswear and other items from their suppliers' Summer 2010 collection. This investment ensures that they can fill orders fast, better serving their clients and, hopefully, increasing profits. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy bathing suits and sportswear

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel A. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Richel is married. To make a living, Richel works in someone else's business venture, operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Richel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Richel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Richel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julissa Maricel

texts.es: Julissa Maricel tiene 27 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ofrece todo tipo de productos de consumo como es azúcar, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, refrescos naturales, detergentes, jabón y jugos. Por lo que busca la forma de ganarse la vida tiene 1 hijo de 3 años que está a su cargo pues siempre está luchando para mejorar los servicios en su pulpería. Es así que solicita este financiamiento que será necesario para materia prima y ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos. Ella sueña con obtener otro medio de ingreso que le genere más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julissa Maricel is 27 years old and manages a store. She has been in this business for more than four years and offers all types of consumer products such as sugar, beans, oil, candy, natural sodas, detergents, soaps, and juices. Julissa works to earn a living for her three year old son, but she is always striving to improve the services in her store.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan that is needed to acquire materials and a wide variety of products. She hopes to find another form of income that will generate more revenue so that she can improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina R. E. tiene 53 años  y vive en el barrio las Palmas de la Ciudad de Barranquilla, con sus dos hijos  de 24 y 26 años de edad.  Su negocio lleva por nombre “ Variedades Luz”, allí  vende mercancías y tiene una pequeña sala de Internet y de servicios  de telefonía celular; en la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar mercancías como calzado, vestuarios para damas y caballeros, perfumes shampoo y ropa interior; Inició su negocio en el año 2002, cuando vendía mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos cosméticos y fue la forma de ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos familiares,  porque ella sola afrontó el sostenimiento de su familia, a este negocio fue agregándole otras mercancías ,  servicios de llamadas, a celulares y un equipo de informática con Internet, todo esto es los que en la actualidad tiene.
Los créditos en la Fundación le han ayudado a cambiar su vida porque con ellos  ha logrado incrementar las ventas y  apoyada con capacitación ha mejorado la administración de su negocio, en la medida en que ha ido creciendo.
Ella quiere seguir ampliándolo, sueña con tener  un local propio con activos y equipos necesarios y ahora lleva un gran paso, que es el de la legalización y formalización de su negocio, ante la Cámara de Comercio pues ya tiene su registro mercantil.

Hasta le fecha el negocio ha manejado una regularidad  en las ventas producto de su organización, responsabilidad y por el potencial de clientes que existe en su  entorno de  gente emprendedora, con mucho civismo y capacidad de compra de sus productos y servicios.
texts.en:
Luz Marina R. E., 53, lives in Barranquilla’s Las Palmas neighborhood with her two sons, who are 24 and 26 years of age. Her store is called “Variedades Luz;” she sells general merchandise and provides a small Internet access and cell phone service. She is asking for a $2.000.000 loan to buy merchandise like: shoes, women’s and men’s clothing, perfumes, shampoo and underwear. She started her business in 2002 selling catalogue cosmetics as a way of improving family income because she was the sole provider for her family. She gradually started adding other products to her sales as well as phone services and Internet access services; this is everything she has as of now. The Fundación’s loans have helped her to change her life because she has managed to increase sales and, with the training received, has learned how to manage her business better as it has grown. She wants to continue to expand; she dreams with having her own location with assets and necessary equipment and she is taking a big step in that direction, which is the legalization and formalizing of her business with the Chamber of Commerce; she now has her business license. To date, the business has maintained steady sales thanks to her organization, responsibility and the potential customer base of enterprising, civic oriented people with buying power that exists around her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, men's and women's clothing, perfumes, shampoo and underwear.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes Rodríguez es una señora con 42 años, apenas estudio hasta quinto curso de primaria, tiene 4 hijos, sus hijos tienen 18, 12, 7 y 5 años. Lourdes y sus hijos  viven en Mallcorrancho zona de Sipe-Sipe. Su esposo trabaja como albañil.

La señora  se dedica a la producción de leche pues tiene sus vacas, de las cuales ordeña leche y hace quesillo, para vender a sus vecinos, además se la producción eventual de haba, maíz en su casita que le ayudan a sustentar su hogar y a sus hijitos. La señora Lourdes, tiene tres hijos de un primer matrimonio, el cual los abandono hace muchos años, en ese tiempo conoció al Sr. Issac Vásquez Ledezma, quien la apoyo mucho desde entonces, a iniciar con el negocio de la lechería, y ahora se han casado y ya tienen un hijo mas. Las condiciones en las que viven son muy precarias, tienen una casita con habitaciones pequeñas de adobe, su ganado en la misma propiedad. La señora Lourdes  es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y su hija se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas, y luego llevar la leche para poder comercializarla, por fortuna ahora entregan la leche al modulo de la Planta de industrialización de Leche, quienes si bien les paga de forma fija cada quince días por la leche entregada, los precios son bajos.

La señora Lourdes solicita el crédito para poder comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero, y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda producir más leche, e incrementar  sus ingresos. El ideal que tiene la señora Lourdes es poder hacer estudiar a su hija Veterinaria, ya que ella nunca puedo cumplir sus sueños de estudiar una carrera; con el crecimiento de su negocio de la producción de lechería podrá pagar sus estudios de su hija mayor.
La visión que tiene la señora Lourdes es ver a sus hijos crecer sanos y fuertes, responsables, y que ellos logren tener un futuro mejor que ella tuvo además capaces de poder enfrentar cualquier dificultad que la vida les ponga en frente.
texts.en:
Lourdes Rodríguez, age 42, just has a fifth grade education. She has four children. Her children are 18, 12, 7, and 5. Lourdes and her children live in the Mallcorrancho area of Sipe-Sipe. Her husband works as a bricklayer. She devotes herself to milk production. She has cows that she milks, and she makes cheese to sell to her neighbors. She also occasionally grows beans at home, which helps her to maintain her home and her children. Lourdes has three children from her first husband, and he left them many years ago. During that time she met Issac Vásquez Ledezma. He helped her a lot from then on; he helped her start the dairy business. They are now married, and they have one more child. The conditions in which they live are meager. They have a house with small adobe rooms. She keeps her cattle on the same property. Lourdes is very dedicated to her work. She and her daughter get up very early everyday to milk the cows. They then take the milk to be able to sell it. Luckily, they now deliver their milk to the Milk Industrialization Plant unit. They are paid regularly every 15 days for the milk they have delivered. The prices are low. Lourdes is requesting the loan to be able to buy a dairy cow and balanced food so that she is able to produce more milk and increase her income. The idea that Lourdes has is that her daughter be able to study to be a veterinarian. Lourdes could never fulfill her dreams of studying a career. With the growth of her milk production business she could pay for her oldest daughter’s education. The vision that Lourdes has is to see her children grow healthy, strong and responsible. She wants them to have a better future than she had. She also wants them to be capable of confronting whatever difficulty confronts them in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow and food for her dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Kholiskhon

texts.en:
Kholiskhon R. is a married woman and has three children. She has been running her own business for 3 years already. Kholiskhon, together with the help of her son (pictured), sells clothes for women in a store, which is located in one of the heavily inhabited parts of the city. She is very nice and polite and has many clients. The business is quite stable and serves as a significant source of income for the family. Kholiskhon has been a client of IMON for almost a year and this is her second loan from our organization. She managed to pay all her loans accurately and precisely. Now she requests $3000 USD. Kholiskhon is planning to purchase women's summer clothes to sell. She deeply appreciates your support and sincerely thanks all of you. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new women's summer clothing to sell

loans.name: Margelia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Margelia del Rosario S. B., tiene la edad de 27 años es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad que dependen totalmente de ella, habita en el barrio Buena Vista y se dedica a la agricultura de la yuca desde hace más de 15 años, fueron sus padres que la iniciaron a laborar en este rubro y tener un sustento para su familia.

Ha pensado comprar unas vaquillas, para agrandar el hato ganadero que actualmente posee,  uno de los problemas que se les ha presentado a lo largo de su trabajo en la agricultura ha sido el robo de la producción y ha pensado en construir una caseta para vigilar las áreas de cultivo, por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de matariles agrícolas, que brinden un mantenimiento óptimo a las cosechas y una producción superior a las pasadas que aumenten los volúmenes de ventas y los ingresos mensuales, para la obtención del capital necesario para los futuros proyectos que tiene en mente que aportan al porvenir de sus dos hijos. Ella es una mujer que ha luchado sola y habita gracias a su esfuerzo de una forma digna pero desea mejorar aun mas sus condiciones de habitad para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Margelia del Rosario S. B. is 27 years old. She is a single mother to 2 small children who totally depend on her. Margelia lives in the suburb of Buena Vista and has worked in agriculture growing yuca for over 15 years. Her parents started her working in this area, and she now has a way of sustaining her family. She has been thinking about buying some cows to increase the livestock she has. One of the problems that she has been presented with has been the robbery of the crops. Margelia has been thinking about constructing a small hut to keep an eye on her cultivation, but for the moment is seeking a loan to purchase agricultural materials. This will allow her to optimally maintain the crops and give her a superior sowing season, increasing the volume of sales and her monthly earnings, thereby obtaining the necessary capital for future projects she has in mind that will contribute to her children's prospects. Margelia is a woman who has worked hard by herself, and thanks to her efforts has a dignified life, but she still wants to improve her living conditions more for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as fertilisers, pesticides, and vegetative items

loans.name: Edita

texts.es: Edita, de 50 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa que es  propia.Desde hace más de 30 años, se dedica a las labores agrícolas, siembra papa y alverja, y en la actualidad sus hijos le  ayudan en esta tarea, cuando su cosecha esta lista la vende a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica también a la atención en  una pequeña tienda, trabaja durante todas las mañanas, y luego se va casi todo el día a  pastear a sus animales en el campo. Después de casi  2 meses de cuidar a sus becerros los vende en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Edita cuenta que el engorde  de sus animales requiere de mayor  tiempo, pero de todos modos  la venta de animales le genera mas rentas, por lo que ha decidido continuar con esta actividad e incrementar su  capital de trabajo.Es la oportunidad número 13 que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Para mas adelante tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de algunos becerros  y también adquirirá  abono  que necesita para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Edita is 50 years old and lives with her 2 children in a house that she owns. She has been farming for over 30 years. She grows potatoes and peas. Currently, her children help her with this. When her harvest is ready she sells it to wholesalers in the city. In addition to this, every morning she runs a small store, . Then, almost everyday, she goes to let her animals out to graze in the field. After almost 2 months of caring for her calves she sells them at the cattle market in her area. Edita realizes that the fattening of her animals requires more time, but of all of her jobs, the sale of animals generates the most income. Because of this she has decided to continue this activity and increase her working capital. This will be her 13th loan with MFP. She is committed to being responsible with her payments. Edita is grateful to everyone who has made this loan possible as it will be very useful in the advancement of her business. She plans to use the loan to buy more calves and fertilizer that she needs for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Bebie Rose

texts.en:
Bebie Rose R. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She is 38 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling a variety of different products such as snack foods, shampoo, sugar, salt, and so on in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $220 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Bebie Rose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Bebie Rose is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Raheela Shoqat's Group

texts.en:
Raheela shoqat is 30 years of age, married and a mother of three children: two boys and one girl. All of her children are getting an education; two are in kindergarten and one is in 1st standard. A very caring lady, Raheela stays at home, manages the household chores and takes care of her family. She has completed her education through 8th standard and couldn’t study further due to her family's poor financial condition. She has decided that the same destiny will never befall her children; that’s why she is focusing on their studies and giving them a good educational base.
  
Raheela's husband, N. S., is a rickshaw driver. He earns 300 PKR per day and 15,000 PKR on a monthly basis. Raheela has applied for her 4th loan from Asasah for her husband. He will use the loan to repair his rickshaw and improve his working conditions.

By being with Asasah for last three years. Raheela has become a regular client. Each year, she has maintained a good credit record and attended all meetings regularly.

loans.use: Repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Enterprise. Group

texts.en:
Thomas S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Enterprise." Thomas is a 56-year-old married man. He and his wife have four children, who are between the ages of 9 and 29 years old. He explains that he was only able to attend school through the 11th grade due to financial problems.

For 22 years, he has been operating a carpenter shop on Broad Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his portion (6,000 LRD) of the group loan (30,000 LRD, or $425) being sought to buy more timber and planks. He describes himself as a determined person, and he notes that his goal is to improve his business and to continue to educate his children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jebeh S. is in the inset at the lower right because she was absent when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To improve his business by purchasing additional raw materials (timber and planks)

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: H. amivi est une dame de 35 ans, elle est veuve et a à sa charge son enfant. afin de subvenir à ses propres besoins et aux besoins de son enfant, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de tubercules d'ignames; Elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 5 ans déjà. elle s'approvisionne  à Lomé. beaucoup de propriétaire de restaurant togolais s'approvisionne chez elle. elle a connu une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle voudrait s'approvisionner, elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour s'acheter  05 tas de tubercules d'ignames.
texts.en:
H. Amivi is thirty-five years old, a widow, and takes care of her child. In order to meet her needs and the needs of her child, she took up the business of selling yam tubers. She has been involved in this business for more than five years. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She supplies many restaurant owners in Togo. She has seen a reduction in her stock of merchandise. She would like to stock up and has already received one loan from WAGES. She is requesting this second loan to buy five loads of yam tubers.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy yam tubers

loans.name: Esperanza En Ti 1 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group Esperanza en ti 1 (Hope on you). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to buy a computer for my children and to finish studying. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work. She started very young and she likes it a lot.

Altagracia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for nine years. She started selling in her Mom's business. After some years, she become the owner and had some loans which she used to pay daily. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pork meats and seasonings. Then she will produce sausage to sell. She will use the profits to build a wall for her house and in a short time, wants to finish building her house.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she had a first one and liked the facilities and learned a little more about business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy pork meat

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Lungala-Mpigi Group

texts.en: 36-year-old N. Agnes who belongs to Zibula Atudde group-Mpigi is a go-getter by nature. With steadfast and hard-working principle, she has for the last 13 years managed to make ends meet  with her fruit and vegetable sales business in Kibuye market-Mpigi. This mother of four who is also happily married began this business at the urging of her close pal. In a week she makes 120,000 shillings and with this loan she wants to buy more bags of fruit and vegetables that she will resell. She also says she will use some of the loan money to pay school fees for her kids.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of fruit and vegetables for resale and paying school fees

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena Rodríguez M. es una joven comerciante de 24 años de edad, casada, madre de un niño de cinco años y junto a él y su esposo reside en la Colonia Los Ángeles en la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. De Lunes a Viernes María Elena tiene un empleo fijo y desde hace un año en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta ambulante de joyería de plata y otros productos de uso personal. Ella es una persona con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y compañeros de trabajo y estudio. María Elena solicita el financiamiento para comprar una mayor cantidad de joyas como aritos, pulseras, cadenas, anillos, etc. para así llamar la atención de sus clientas con estilos nuevos y a la moda. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera obtener más ganancias para seguir pagando sus estudios universitarios y los de su pequeño hijo. Su sueño es graduarse lo más pronto posible para dejar de su empleo y establecer su propio negocio a tiempo completo. Tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y ser cliente de la institución le ha ayudado a mejor su vida económica.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a young merchant, 24 years of age, married, mother of a 5-year-old boy.  Together with him and her husband, she resides in Colonia Los Angeles, in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho province.  From Monday through Friday she has fixed employment, and for the last year, during her free time, she sells jewelry, silver, and other personal-use products in the streets. Maria Elena is a person with very good references from her neighbors, fellow workers, and classmates.

Maria Elena is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of jewelry, such as earrings, bracelets, chains, rings, etc., to attract the attention of her customers with new and fashionable styles. With the help of the loan, she hopes to obtain more earnings in order to continue paying for her university studies and her little child's expenses.

Her dream is to graduate as soon as possible, so she can leave her job and establish her own full-time business.  She has had various loan cycles with FAMA and while a client of this institution, she has been able to better her life economically.

loans.use: BUYING JEWELRY AND OTHER PERSONAL-USE PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Lita Bucol's Group

texts.en:
Lita B. is from the village of Sipaloc, Sibutad. She is 52 years old and is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if either is delinquent or defaults.

Lita is married and has six adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing crops to sell. Lita has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional working capital for the business. Lita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase a cow. This will be the fifth loan that Lita has taken out from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian F. is from the village of Mandih. She is 53 years old. Vivian is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.
