In 2007, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Vivian is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona J. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Rona is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rona owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, breads, canned goods and snack foods in the local community. Rona has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Rona is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rona from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Gulayim

texts.en:
Gulayim E. is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She has been selling bread for the past 15 years and has become known as a reliable supplier of high quality goods. Her husband is a driver who helps Gulayim transport her products to the local markets. She started her bsuness in 1995 with the initial sum of 20,000 KGS and managed to develop her business and buy a truck for transportation.
 
To expand her business, Gulayim borrowed two loans from Bai-Tushum and Partners, which were used as intended and repaid without any delays. Now Gulayim plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to open a new store and increase her floating capital.

About Bai-Tushum: 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To open a new bread store

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie S. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Tessie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk foods in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods and biscuits. This will be the third loan taken by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nasurullo

texts.en:
Nasurullo T., 43, is a an optimistic, hardworking married father of four children. In an agribusiness for more than 15 years, he works his land with love and dedication everyday so that it produces excellent crops. Nasurullo in fact draws from his strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. His loving family is also engaged in this business. Additionally, Nasrullo runs a public transportation business with his minivan as an extra source of income.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and timeconsuming job, Nasurullo hopes to gather a rich harvest, and for this purpose he is requesting a loan of 12000 Somoni. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the wellbeing of his family. Nasurullo appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol T. is from the village of Dohinob. She is 36 years old. Mirasol is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Mirasol  sells a variety of snacks in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Mirasol joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Mirasol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business. This will be the second loan taken out by Mirasol from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase  ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta P. is from the village of Mansabay Alto. She is 66 years old. Restituta is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Restituta owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from cultivating fruit trees and harvesting their fruit to sell. Restituta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2001, Restituta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Restituta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Restituta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to expand the business. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Restituta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 32 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Paulina se dedica a la venta de artesanía en la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Pisaq. Ya son 8 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. Paulina requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas, ponchos y muchas cosas más. 
   
Paulina pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Paulina, 32, has two children and lives in the city of Pisaq in Calca province, Cusco department, Perú.

Paulina sells crafts in Pisaq’s main square.  She’s been in this business for 8 years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it. Paulina needs the loan to buy morel merchandise like sweaters, shawls, ponchos and many other things.

Paulina belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like sweaters, shawls, ponchos and many other things.

loans.name: Mayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mayra es una pequeña comerciante, que como objetivo ha sido la construcción de su casa, ha trabajado en diferentes labores para lograr ingresos y apoyar a su familia. Tiene dos hijos y su esposo labora como albañil.
Hoy en día tiene su propio negocio de venta de carne de res y cerdo, iniciando con pocas ventas, logrando la clientela por tener precios accesibles y de buena calidad.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo, será para seguir cerrando su casa, con el crédito anterior logro cerrar parte del techo pero no termino, faltándole material con lo que con este nuevo financiamiento que Afodenic está otorgando podrá cerrar completamente el techo. En donde comprara, láminas de zinc, golosos, puertas, ventana, siendo su noveno octavo crédito en donde se ha beneficiado obteniendo un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Mayra is a small trader whose main goal has been the construction of her home. She has worked in different things to generate more income and support her family. She has two sons and her husband is a builder. She owns a meat-selling business (beef and pork), which she started with a few sales and now has a regular customer base thanks to its affordable prices and good quality. 

With this new loan she will continue with the roofing of her house. With the previous loan she managed to do it partially but wasn't able to finish it beause she lacked material. This new loan that Afodenic is providing her with will enable her to completely finish the roofing. She will buy sheets of zinc, screws, doors and a window. This will be her eighth loan and she will benefit from it as her house will have a much better roof.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc, screws, doors and a window in order to finish covering the roof.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin O. N. is 35 years old and married. He and his wife have five children aged 3 to 19 years old, to whom they hope to give good educations to the university level. 

His business is located at a market at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region of Kenya that harbors lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. 

He owns a retail shop called Salaben Mini Shop and sells general items to the local people. He says that his major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to increase the stock of the items he sells to meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also sees himself owning a matatu (minibus) some day. He describes himself as trustworthy and customer-friendly.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, detergents, beverages, etc., for resale

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married, 43-year-old woman. She and her husband have an 18-year-old child. To earn a living, she works in the farming business sector. Specifically, she has been growing rice for 5 years, and she sells her harvest at the market. She explains that she works very hard to support her family, especially her child's educational needs because she would like for her child to be successful.

Daisy is seeking a loan in the amount of $100 (4,000 PHP) to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She truly believes that the loan will help her improve the business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Connie Adaro Group

texts.en:
Connie A. is from the village of Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and is the leader of this three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

Connie is married and has three school-aged children. 

She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Connie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Connie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a variety of products to expand her product offering. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married woman with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

For the past four years, she has operated a coconut-selling business and she sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a food stall business which contributes her other source of income. Maimuna faces a major challenge of competition from other coconut sellers in the market. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and repair her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts and repair her food stall.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman is 34, a very courageous man who can manage tough jobs like fishing.  He is the father of four children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, after much time Elman was able to get ahead through his business of purchasing and breeding fish. His greatest goal is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. Elman is a fisherman and usually buys fish from fish vendors early in the morning. He works seven days per week without weekends and holidays because fish is in very high demand  among local people. For this reason, Elman applied for 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more fish for his breeding business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and married to his wife, Rahab. He has been selling clean water to his community for over 11 years. John intends to take a 50,000 KES loan to buy distilled water in large quantities for his business. 

John has been a good client who repays his loan well. This is his second loan with KADET. As a hardworking individual, he plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand his business. He hopes to become a wholesaler of a water depot one day.

loans.use: to buy distilled water in large quantities for his business

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: For the past 10 years, Ama has been married to an electrician. They live together with their five dependents. Ama sells gari (processed cassava) and maize in Elmina. Her income is used to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase cassava to process for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava to process for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more carpentry materials.

loans.name: Samonn

texts.en:
Samonn is 56 years old and his wife, Sat, is 57 years old. They live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1978 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. 

Samonn sells porridge. He cooks it himself and carries it on a cart that he attaches to his motorbike (pictured with Samonn). He sells it in his village and the nearby villages. His wife sells sugar cane juice. Samonn is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new trailer because the old one breaks. He will use part of the loan to buy additional materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new trailer.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es:
Daysi, vive con su esposo, tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad, ella administra una tienda, se fundó hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 7:00pm, surgió por iniciativa propia y su esposo la apoyo para instalarlo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, aceite, huevos, pan, boquitas y condimentos, con esta mercadería piensa surtir el negocio, para ofrecer a los clientes mayor variedad, contando con un buen servicio.
Su aspiración es que a través del negocio pueda garantizarle a su familia el sustento diario, velando siempre por las necesidades más urgentes.
texts.en:
Daysi lives with her husband. She has one son, aged 16. She runs a store which she opened 5 years ago. She works every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. She started this business on her own initiative and her husband supported her in opening it. 
She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, eggs, bread, snacks and condiments. With this merchandise she will stock her business, in order to offer her customers a greater variety and good service.
Her goal is to, through this business, be able to guarantee her family their daily bread and most urgent necessities.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, eggs, bread, snacks and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Jocinta

texts.en:
Jocinta is 37 years old and single with two children. She is a dressmaker and has been in the business for four years, making a monthly profit of KES 7,000. She has been loaned KES 20,000. She plans to purchase more pieces of cloth to use in her business.

With the anticipated profit, she hopes to educate her children to higher levels of education. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth

loans.name: Los Tres Barrios - Qoricancha Group

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, tiene 31 años D. edad, nació en la provincia D. Anta del distrito D. Cachimayo (Cusco) y ahora vive en la comunidad D. CCoricancha distrito D. Chinchero D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ella radica hace varios años en la comunidad y donD. realiza sus actividades económicas. 

Isabel está casada con el señor Cesar y fruto D. esta unión tiene dos hijos, ellos se esfuerzan para sacar adelante a sus hijos pues ellos se dedican a la artesanía, agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y otras cosas más que se necesitan para el sembrado D. papas y maíz. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Los Tres Barrios - CCoricancha” son cada treinta días en la comunidad D. CCoricancha en la casa D. unas D. las socias. El Banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la comunidad D. CCoricancha y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. comida, crianza D. animales menores, venta D.  granos, venta D. tubérculos, venta D. carne, elaboración D. artesanía. La comunidad D. CCoricancha se encuentra ubicada a una hora y treinta minutos en carro D. la ciudad del Cusco. Cusco es conocido desD. hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica D. América".
texts.en:
Señora Isabel, who is 31 years old, was born in the province of Anta in the Cachimayo (Cusco) district, and she now lives in the community of Qoricancha in the Chinchero district of the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. She settled in this community some years ago, and this is where she carries out her business activity.

Isabel is married to Señor Cesar, and they have two children. They strive to raise their children, working in handicrafts, agriculture, and raising livestock. They have worked in these areas for several years, and things are going well for them, thanks to the effort that they put into their work. At this time Isabel needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other additional items that are needed for the planting of potatoes and corn.

The meetings of the members of the communal bank "Los Tres Barrios -- Qoricancha" (The Three Neighborhoods -- Qoricancha) are held every month in the community fo Qoricancha in the home of one of the members. The communal bank consists of people who are workers and entrepreneurs who are always looking for opportunities to advance and, through their daily effort, to give a better future to their children. The majority of the members live in the community of Qoricancha, and the businesses of the other members are, for example, food sales, raising small animals, selling grains, selling root vegetables, selling meat, and making handicrafts. The community of Qoricancha is located about and hour and a half by car from the city of Cusco. Cusco has been known for many years as the "Archaeological Capital of the Americas."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Alexander did not pursue his studies in college. He kept helping his parents in cultivating their farm until he decided to get married. He is now 49 years old and has two school-aged children. Together with his wife, they are striving hard to manage their rice farming business to earn income and satisfy their basic necessities. 

Despite the hardships of life, they planned to improve the business and increase their income to continue sending their children to school. He wants to ask for additional capital of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for labor required in rice farming. He believes that the loan will help a lot to increase their crop yields this coming harvest season.

In the future, Alexander hopes that their business will grow and their children will finish their studies. He mentioned that he needs to endure hardships and pursue the business to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and pay for labor required in rice farming.

loans.name: Kyei

texts.en: Kyei has been making palm oil extract and koko in the village of Jukwa for the past 11 years. She is married to a cleaner. The CRAN loan received through Kiva will enable Kyei to continue purchasing palm fruits to make the oil to sell. After using the profits to take care of their home, she tries to save money to reinvest into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to puirchase palm fruits to make oil to sell.

loans.name: Joilyn

texts.en:
Joilyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Joilyn has a shop that sells soaps, detergents and cleansing agents. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy detergents, cleansing agents and soaps.

Joilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Joilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, cleansing agent and soaps

loans.name: Delia María

texts.es:
La Señora. Delia es socia del banco comunal Ensueños, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia de Cañar, es considerada patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador. Su gente es amable, gentil, cálida y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía.

La Señora. Delia tiene 59 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, uno de sus hijos es casado  e independiente, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y  estudian en la universidad. La casa en la que vive es pequeña pero de su propiedad.

Doña Delia labora tiene una tienda de comestibles, lleva 7 años en esta actividad y trabaja de lunes a sábados solo medio día ya que el resto de su tiempo se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar. 

Realiza los créditos en la banca comunal hace 4 años y esto le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en los estudios de su hijo y en productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es  que sus hijos se incorporen en la universidad y que sean  profesionales.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the "Ensueños" communal bank, and lives in the central part of the city of Azogues. This city is the capital of Cañar province, and is considered part of the architectural and cultural heritage of Ecuador. Its people are friendly, kind, and warm. They maintain their culture and traditions, and have a varied cuisine.

Delia is 59, a widow, and has four children. One of her children is married and on his own. Her three single children work, and study in university. The house where she lives is small, but it belongs to her.  Delia has a grocery store. She has been in this business for seven years, and works Mondays through Saturdays; only half the day, since the rest of her time is spent doing her household chores. 

She has been undertaking loans at the communal bank for four years, and this has helped her business grow.  She will use her new loan to pay for her son's studies, and to buy basic household products to stock her store. Her goal is to have her children attend university and be professionals.

loans.use: To buy basic household products for her store, and pay for educational expenses.

loans.name: Indira

texts.es: La señorita Indira tiene una movilidad  que lo hace trabajar como taxi  ella administra la movilidad ya que tiene un chofer que la maneja y  la renta le entrega a diario,  su coche esta en buen estado pero la señorita quiere hacer cambiar a  de gasolina a GNV gas, la señorita es egresada de la carrera de odontología actualmente es ayudante de un consultorio odontológico,  ella esta en los tramites para su titulación, ella actualmente es soltera pero tiene su novio ellos quieren formar una familia en un futuro, el crédito será invertido en la refacción de su movilidad y cambio de gasolina a GNV, y a si de esta manera reducir gastos en lo que implica la compra de gasolina, es una persona joven emprendedora con ganas de superación y se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señorita Indira has a vehicle which she uses as a taxi. She organizes the running of the vehicle and she has a driver who operates it and pays her a daily rent. Her car is in good condition but the Señorita would like to change from gasoline to NGV. She is a dentistry graduate and is currently working as an assistant in a dental surgery. She is in the process of becoming qualified. At the moment she is unmarried but she has a boyfriend and they want to start a family in the future. 

The loan will be invested in the renovation of her vehicle and the change from gasoline to NGV. This will help to reduce the bills associated with the purchase of gasoline. She is an enterprising young woman with a  desire to succeed and she is grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to convert from gasline to NGV and to renovate her vehicle.

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
As shown in the picture, Mrs. Doeun is standing with her husband in front of her poor thatch-roofed house. It’s here that she's given birth to three children. Currently, the roof has become fragile because of the weather conditions. Doeun is a local farmer in Prey Chor, Kompong Cham province. Because of the low income she earns from farming, it’s not possible to cover daily costs and provide for the basic necessities of the family. Therefore, her husband and her older son also help in earning more income by working outdoors. They work as construction workers in mobile places with their team of workers.

Doeun has been concerned about her house, which is becoming harder to live in. She wants to reroof her house and fix it partially. That’s why she is taking out a loan from Kiva, through HKL. She hopes that all Kiva’s lenders will help her family.

loans.use: to reroof her house and fix it partially.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building materials like staples, ropes, nails, etc. to add to his business inventory.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is fifty years old and married with four children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol in the Philippines with her family.

Mariana and her husband are both farmers; she has been farming for fourteen years. They grow rice and vegetables to sell. The couple has been able to provide for their family through the work on their farm.

Mariana has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities. She hopes her farming business grows.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm necessities.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is 61 years of age and married with 9 children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Lupe needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Lupe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lupe's 1st loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score". For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es: María Catalina de treinta y cuatro años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos. Ella posee una tienda muy surtida donde vende productos de consumo básico como frijoles, leche, pan, huevos entre otros, desde hace poco tiempo la demanda en su negocio ha aumentado y María no quiere decepcionar a su clientela y quiere abastecer la tienda con mas productos de buena calidad y por supuesto a un buen precio ; María es una mujer muy enérgica siempre dispuesta a trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas, para ella el éxito en la vida consiste en seguir siempre adelante, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  productos instantáneo, granos básicos, aceites, condimentos, bebidas etc. María Catalina tiene fe que con su esfuerzo podrá llevar a su hogar  seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: María Catalina is 34 and lives with her husband and 3 children. She has a general goods store and sells products such as beans, milk, bread, eggs and other items.  Demand for her products has increased over time and María wants to stock a better variety of items at attractive prices; María is an active woman that believes in getting ahead through personal effort.  For this reason she seeks this credit from INTEGRAL to stock her store with varied items such as instant food products, staples, grains, oil, spices, soft drinks. María Catalina has faith that her hard work will lead to a better future for her family.

loans.use: instant food products, staples, oil, spices, soft drinks

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a separated woman and has one little angel. Joan is 21 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Joan has a piggery and a general store, selling pigs and a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been running her business for 3 years

She's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase pig feeds and grocery items to sell. Joan joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Joan hopes to a motorcycle with cab use for the delivery of the domestic animal pigs to the contract buyer.

loans.use: To purchase pig feeds

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 30 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Jane is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and beer. She will use her extra income from this loam to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and beer to sell

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 45-year-old man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a father of three children. He  completed secondary school only.

Mohammed`s business  is a grocery store that he started  five years ago with limited capital. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. Though he has been working hard, he can`t meet his customers' requirements due to limited capital as wholesalers require cash payment to provide him grocery supplies. So, Mohammed started to offer more services to customers such as bringing foods and soft drinks to their homes, etc which helped him to attract more clients.

Mohammed was happy about the attracting new clients but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demand is hindering his business progress and growth. So, he took a loan of 100,000 YER  in order to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.

In the future, Mohammed hopes to expand his business into a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies for his business.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es:
Ana comparte su vivienda con su esposo y una hija de 17 años de edad, tiene dos dependientes y no recibe ayuda económica de sus parientes, desde hace más de 5 está desarrolla la venta de pupusas para tener entradas de dinero, el oficio lo aprendió de una hermana y lo realiza a tiempo completo.
Ella piensa utilizar el crédito para comprar una plancha para pupusas más grande, así como también ingredientes como maíz, harina, aderezos, etc., para surtir el inventario de su negocio, de esta manera mejorara la calidad y servicio que da a sus clientes, espera mantener sus  ventas e ingresos estables con los que resarcirá la deuda y ofrecerá mejor calidad de vida a su familia, 
Sus sueños son administrar  de la mejor manera el capital y  seguir luchando por mantener la frecuencia de sus clientes.

loans.use: comprar una plancha para pupusas más grande, así como también ingredientes como maíz, harina, aderezos, etc., para surtir el inventario de su negocio

loans.name: Natig

texts.en:
Natig is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He married and has 2 children. He is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning his business he sold the vegetable. He borrowed the loan amount of $500 to be engaged in sale of vegetable. For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $1100 to rent a mini shop and bought foodstuffs. 
He applies for the loan $1500 to expand the area of his shop and to increase the food assortments.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop and to increase the food assortments

loans.name: Intizar

texts.en:
Intizar is a widow who has 4 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in the Khirdalan settlement.
Having borrowed $400 she bought a refrigerator.
For the second loan she borrowed $800 and bought foodstuffs.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to start the sale of all types of industrial goods and to buy necessary equipment for the store.
She run this business for 4 years ago.

loans.use: To start the saleof all types of industrial goods and to buy necessary equipment for a store

loans.name: Maluai

texts.en: Maluai is a 28 year old mother of three children.  She runs a small grocery shop to support her family.  She started a stall in front of her house where she sold fruits, vegetables and a few basic household items.  However, she found that she was not able to generate enough income to cover her family’s expenses.  When she heard about SPBD from a friend, she joined.  With her loan, she expanded her stall into a proper village store.  This marked a turning point for Malauai and she now is a proud proprietor of a small but successful grocery.  She is applying for additional loan funds in order to further expand her grocery store.

loans.use: to expand and re-stock her shop

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción is originally from the town Escobedo, in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She is married and has a son and a daughter, ages 16 and 25 respectively. They were the motivation for her to start her business selling cosmetics, jewelry and shoes five years ago. Her husband works for an oil excavating company, which requires him to travel often. To cover the costs of her children's education, she started the business and has been able to make it grow little by little, and she now has a larger clientele.

To be able to meet all the orders she's getting, Concepción is requesting a loan of $550, which she will use to purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be an important part in the growth of this business and help Concepción and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Concepción es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es casada, tiene un hijo y una hija de 16 años y 25 años respectivamente, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual Concepción inició su negocio de ventas de cosméticos, joyería y calzado hace cinco años, el empleo de su esposo como operador en una petro-escavadora le exige constantes viajes y para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos emprendió este negocio que ha hecho crecer poco a poco, y ahora ya cuenta con una amplia clientela.

Para poder surtir todos los pedidos que tiene Concepción está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esa cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Concepción y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas y la oportunidad de mejorar.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Ricardo Camelane

texts.pt:
Ricardo M. was born and raised in the province of Inhambane, in the south. He is married father of 3 children all of whom are in school. He joined the FDM in 2006. Ricardo sells cell phone accessories, school materials and beauty products to support this family. His first loan was of 200$, now he is requesting a loan of 375$ in order to increase his inventory. Ricardo is determined and hard working. In the future he plans on saving enough money to improve his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardo M. e natural da Provincia de Inhambane ao Sul do Pais. ele e casado e tem 3 filhos. todos os sus filhos vao a escola. Entrou para o Programa de credito do FDM em 2006.Ele venda muma miscelaea de artigos tais como alguns acessorios para celulares, algum material escolar, e artigos de beleza para senhoras. O seu negocio esta a crescer. Por isso subiu de valor de $200 que tomara no ciclo anterior para $375 que vai tomar agora. Ele e um cliente muito empreendedor e determinado. No futuro com os rendimentos do negocio pensa melhorar a sua moradia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mercedes Abreu

texts.en:
Mercedes is 60 years old and she has seven grown-up children. They all are working and have their own families. She lives with her husband, a retired officer.

Mercedes dedicates herself to the preparation and sale of natural juices, ‘arepa’ (fried or baked corn), sandwiches, coconut, and pastry-making. She has been running this activity for two years with the purpose of staying active at home and not depending only on other people. She operates the business close to her house, since she doesn’t want to get tired by walking a lot.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to continue with this small business, which has made a big change in the couple's living conditions.

loans.use: The entrepreneur will use the funds to buy raw materials to keep on preparing and selling food and natural juices.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao F. is forty years of age from the village of Falelauniu. She is running a taro and banana plantation, and she sells at the Fugalei Market. Sao’s husband does not work and he is the one that is really helping Sao out with the plantation. She works six days a week and she sells three days at the market.

Sao said that this is the first time she has had access to loans and that she will make good use of this opportunity. This is her first loan and this is the beginning of her business life. She is very active and she is confident that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: To buy knives, fertilizers, weed killer, and a hoist for the plantation

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.en: Mashkhura M. lives in Spitamen and she is married with 3 children. She started her business selling small wares but now has her own store trading socks, fibers, mirrors, clothespin and the every day small wares. She is experienced in  her business (about 10 years) and has great ideas on how she would like to develop her business that she would like to implement. She is now requesting a loan to import new goods.

loans.use: to import new goods

loans.name: Leia Jose Zavala

texts.pt:
Leia is married and the mother of 2 children. Her husband is unemployed. She lives by small means to sustain her family. For this Leia decided to enter to the credit program to help her husband with the household expenses. Leia, besides selling staple food products in her home, she also makes homemade bread for sale. This loan she is seeking is her first. She says that if her business runs well, like has happened to other ladies that are already clients, she believes that besides helping her husband with the expenses she will be able to save money to begin construction on a home with conventional materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Leia e casada e mae de 2 filhos. O marido de Leia nao esta empregado. vive de pequenos expedientes para sustentar a sua familia. Por isso Leia decidiu entrar para o Programa de credito , para ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa. Leia para alem de vender produtos alimenticios de primeira necessidade em sua casa, ela fabrica pao caseiro e vende. O emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o primeiro. Ela diz que se o negocio correr be tal e qual como tem acontecido com outras senhoras que ja sao clientes, ela pensa para alem de ajudar o marido nas despesas poupar dinheiro para iniciar a construccao de uma casa com material convencional.

loans.use: Purchase more food products for sale

loans.name: Thi An's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dương Thị An is 27 years old and has three young children. She lives with her large family which includes four generations under one roof. Her husband is a factory worker, but his job is in another part of Vietnam. Mrs. Dương is solely responsible for her business and for looking after her extended family. She earns a living by making rice noodles and raising pigs and sometimes has to resort to manual labor to make ends meat. Although Mrs. Dương has never borrowed money prior to this request, she would like a loan for $130 in order to expand her core business of producing rice noodles. Another group member, Mrs. Đỗ plans to use her portion of the loan for her woodshop. Mrs. Nghiêm needs $130 for her grocery business. The last two members of the group, Mrs. Nguyên and Mrs. Nguyên will use their funds to raise pigs. | Chị Dương Thị An, 27 tuổi, có 3 con nhỏ. Chị sống cùng chồng, mẹ chồng, ông chồng và 3 con gái. Gia đình chị đông người, chồng là công nhân đi làm xa nhà nên mọi gánh nặng gia đình dồn lên vay chị. Hàng ngày, ngoài chăm sốc gia đình, chị còn làm mỳ gạo, nuôi lợn và khi có thời gian chị còn đi làm thuê để có thêm thu nhập. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nay tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô Binhminh với mức vốn 2006000 đồng để mua gạo làm mỳ. Chị hy vọng với khoản tiền này sẽ giúp chị phát triển nghề cũng như cải thiện cuộc sống gia đình hơn.
Trong nhóm chị còn có:
Chị Đỗ Thị Mai vay 2006000 đồng để chồng phát triển nghề mộc
Chị Nghiêm Thị Mai vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hoá bán.
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hợi vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua cám cho lợn
Anh Nguyên Văn Ninh vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua cám cho lợn.

loans.use: Business expansion | Mua hàng

loans.name: Dativa's Awali Group

texts.en: Dativa  is a married woman with 3 children.  She is also a cloth seller through a business she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $265 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $425 to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mawkema and Asha, who have businesses in cloth sales and soft drinks sales.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more eggs for sale

loans.name: Ana María

texts.en:
Click this link to view Ana Maria's first loan

Ana Maria belongs to the Village Bank Comunal Señor De Huanca. She is married, 23 years old, and has three children. Ana Maria, along with her husband, makes different sorts of bread, biscotti, and cake in her husband's parents' oven. She distributes their breads mainly among the stores around their area and for a month they go to the different fairs of the region to sell their breads – traveling in her husband's parents' car. They also buy cheese at the fairs that they sell to the stores in their neighborhoods as well.

Ana Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles ($US700), which she will invest in the purchase of flour and to pay for part of the land she has acquired.

Ana Maria's dream is to build her house, have a big store where she can sell her products, and that her children will be professionals one day.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of flour and to pay for part of the land she has acquired.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia E. sells fresh fish as well as groceries. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Emilia and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Danica

texts.en:
Danica is a widow from the town of Laktasi.  She receives a small retirement pension in the amount of 350 KM (less than 270 USD) per month.  To support herself, Danica has been selling milk to the local dairy, and can make up to 350 KM a month with these sales.  This business has been going well for her, but Danica's cow is old, and she will need to get a new one to keep up her income.  

Danica is requesting this loan in the amount of 1200 KM to buy a young dairy cow that she will use for milk production. She thinks she can increase the amount of milk she can sell to the dairy and increase her household income with this investment.

loans.use: To buy a young cow and sell its milk

loans.name: Advija

texts.en: Advija is a 45-year-old widow and she receives a pension in the amount of 600 KM. She has two children. This is not her first loan at WWI, and this loan amounts to 1,100 KM. Her intent is to buy poultry for the winter. After some time, when she has fattened them, she will sell the birds and earn money that she will spend on her daughter's needs. She is going to school and she needs additional money for that reason.

loans.use: To buy poultry to raise

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa M., 54, is married and has six children. She has many years of experience in her shop business, which is open six days per week. She has five previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1500 Tala (about $625 USD). SPBD loans are Epenesa's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Epenesa has a very good loan history, she always pays in advance, and she saves every week.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator and display shelves

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun C. is a villager in Khnar Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a recyclables collector who can buy empty bottles, cans, plastic …etc to re-sell in recycling factory for an income. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more waste things to re-sell and she hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Sor Phoeurn, assists his wife business. Mrs. Aun C. is 43 years old and the mother of two children one of whom helps the parents while the youngest one is attending the local school. A man who is on the photo is her husband.

loans.use: to buy more rrecyclable things to re-sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D., 45 ans, mariée, 05 enfants  en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tanaff depuis 5 ans. Elle achète des tissus et des produits pour faire la teinture et vendre, elle vend des légumes au marché et gère un restaurant. Mariama veut renforcer  ses diverses  activités. Ses revenus lui permettent de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé, de scolarité de sa famille  Elle sollicite un  prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mariama D., 45, married and raising 5 children, has been a member of the village bank of Tanaff for 5 years. She buys cloth and products for dyeing and sells them. She sells vegetables in the market and manages a little restaurant.

Mariama wants to bolster her various businesses. Her income permits her to contribute to improving living conditions, health, and schooling for her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth, vegetables, dyeing products, and food ingredients for her little restaurant

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia A. is fifty-six years old. She is married and has nine children; seven of them are independent, and the last two are still in school. Sophia has been working to help her husband support their children. She fries doughnuts and sells them in schools in her community. She buys the necessary materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for twenty-two years. Sophia wants to use the loan to buy her materials in bulk, in order to cut down on transportation costs. Sophia belongs to the community group called All Nation Trust Bank group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral so as to access the loan, and support one another in handling repayment. She was attending her group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her food business.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is 29 years old and is married with two children. Currently, one is schooling and the last born is still breastfeeding. She lives with her family in Kumasi. According to Georgina, she works very hard to support her husband in taking care of the home. She lives in her husband's family's house with the kids. She says the family members of her husband put pressure on her to work as if she is a servant to them. She has thought of renting a house but she is constrained by lack of funds to run her business, never mind talk of money to rent a single room. She is now confused about what to do because everything boils down to funds.

Georgina sells household products such as cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door-to-door sales in the community. Georgina is an achiever and her focus is on saving enough to see her kids through school. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She believes with that she can save enough to rent a single room. She would be very grateful for your support. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make her business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to take care of her household.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: A sus 27 años, Ana es madre de dos pequeños niños, Jhon de 2 años y Lizbeth de 9 meses, tiene una casa propia, la cual esta hecha de adobe, ella se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y así darles a sus hijos una mejor vida. Tejiendo chompas, chalinas, guantes, etc, Ana pasa sus días. Ella disfruta mucho de tejer y lo hace con mucha habilidad, sus tejidos son comprados por tiendas de ropa, donde son vendidas con mucha rapidez, es por eso que tiene una gran demanda por las prendas que teje. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma la ropa que teje y así mejorar sus ingresos, aunque tiene 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad, todavía le sigue siendo difícil realizar los acabados a las prendas que hace, con todo el esfuerzo que realiza, espera poder darles unos buenos estudios a sus hijos y anhela que sean unos buenos profesionales útiles a la sociedad. Ana se encuentra en su cuarto préstamo con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con el dinero solicitado planea comprar más lana para confeccionar más prendas, lo que le costará alrededor de 1500 soles, lo que le falta para completar esta suma, lo sacará de sus ahorros personales.
texts.en:
vAt the age of 27 Ana is the mother of two small children, Jhon, 2 years, and Lizbeth, 9 months, and she has her own adobe house. She's working very hard to get ahead so she can give her children a better life. Ana spends her days weaving sweaters, scarves, gloves, etc. She really enjoys weaving and she is very good at it. She sells her garments to clothing stores, where they sell very quickly, so they are in high demand. In the future she would like to have a store where she can sell her hand-woven clothing herself and increase her income. Even though she's been weaving for 9 years, she still finds it hard to add the fine details to her garments, no matter how hard she tries. Ana hopes to be able to provide her children a good education, and she longs for them to become professionals and useful members of society. This will be her fourth loan with MFP and she's saving up to make her payments on time. She's very happy with her village bank and she doesn't want to cause the members any problems. She plans to use her loan to buy more wool to make additional garments. That will cost around 1500 soles, and if funds are short she'll draw from her personal savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool for weaving

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 23 years old. She is married and has 1 young child, but her husband doesn’t currently live in Guatemala. Maria Auxiliadora supports herself and her family by selling food every weekday morning at a nearby school. In the afternoon Maria tries to spend time studying. In addition to her food sales, she also sells perfume and the income from both businesses helps to pay for her daily expenses. Maria is requesting a loan in order to increase the variety of food products that she can offer her customers. She dreams of increasing her income so that she can finish studying and better her life. 


*********************************************************************************************


Maria Auxiliadora, es casada, tiene 23 años de edad y tiene solo un niño pequeño. Su esposo actualmente no vive en Guatemala.  Ella  vende comida en una escuela para niños, todas las mañanas de lunes a viernes de cada semana, por las tardes dedica su tiempo para estudiar. Además ella también vende productos de perfumería, y con esos ingresos se ayuda para todos los gastos de su casa.  El préstamo lo necesita para tener más productos para su negocio de venta de comida. Su sueño es contar con mejores ingresos que le permitan terminar sus estudios y salir adelante en la vida.

loans.use: Increase variety of food products to sell

loans.name: Maria Marcionila

texts.es:
La señora Maria Marcionila M. A. tiene 55 años, vive en el caserío de Tupac Amaru, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio solo transición, dejo de estudiar debido a que sufría fuertes dolores en sus pies que le impedían caminar; tiene 03 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende económicamente de ella. 
María se dedica a la compra-venta de animales (reces, chanchos y huachos) desde hace 30 años, al comienzo solo vendía animales pequeños como gallinas, cuyes, en tiempos de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa; así también los fines de semana vende cuajada, por un tiempo también tuvo una bodega que cerro debido a que no le era rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Luchando por el Progreso”, lo invirtió en la compra abarrotes para su bodega.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de una vaca y gallinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Marcionila M. A. is 55 years old and lives in the settlement of Tupac Amaru, district of Salpo, Otuzco province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She only completed primary school, and had to stop studying due to strong pains she suffered in her feet that made it difficult for her to walk. She has three children, but none of them depend on her financial support. María has worked for the past 30 years buying and selling animals (cows and pigs). In the beginning she only sold small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. During harvest time she works selling cereal and potatoes. Also during the weekend she sells cheese curds and for a time she had a small grocery store that has since closed due to it not being profitable. She is developing a business in her home. The first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank "Luchando por el Progreso" (Fighting for Progress) was invested in purchasing groceries for her store. This loan of 1500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, will be used to buy a cow and chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and chickens

loans.name: Faapepele

texts.en:
Faapepele L., 25, is married with 2 children. She has 1 year of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the general public three days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Faapepele’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy chicken thighs, sausages, sauce, onions, foam plates, forks and spoons, tissues

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 52 años de edad, de estado casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Vive en el barrio Jose A C..  Cuenta con estudios de 5to de primaria. 
La señora Lucia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra y venta de fibra (lana de alpaca). 
Con este préstamo de 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará fibra (lana de alpaca) para abastecer su negocio.
Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda o un restaurante, ya que el trabajo como acopiador es muy fuerte, lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y los ahorros que ha podido acumular.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Dios es Amor community bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 52, married, and has 3 children. She lives in the Jose A. C. neighborhood. She has a 5th grade education. Lucia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital for her business of buying and selling alpaca wool. With this loan of 2,000 PEN she will buy alpaca wool to stock her business. Her biggest desire is to have a store or a restaurant because working as a gatherer is very hard. What she likes best about her community bank are the meetings and the savings she has been able to accumulate. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alpaca wool

loans.name: Adilia Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Adilia tiene 34 año de edad, casada, con cuatro hijos de 5, 9,10, 17 de edad, solo el mayor es independiente, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur, su esposo se desempeña como enderezador y pintura de autos, ella trabaja de cocinera en un pequeño comedor, desde hace cuatro años, sus anhelo es poder terminar de construir su casa. Es por eso que con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que no quiere mojarse en este invierno. Sus planes es poder tener un pequeño negocio su casa para dejar de trabajar en la cocina ya que es cansado.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. is 34 years old, and is married with 4 children who are 5, 9, 10, and 17 years old, respectively. Only the oldest is independent. Mrs. M. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood with her spouse who does auto body work and paint. For the past 4 years she has worked as a cook in a small cafeteria, and her wish is to be able to finish building her house. That is why she is going to use this loan to buy materials for a new roof for her home, since she doesn't want to get wet in the winter. Her plan is to have a small business in her house so that she can quit her job in the kitchen (which she is quite tired of).

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for a new roof

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khanh Thị Hoàng was born in 1975.( no: 010102090016). She has a bazaar at home. There are 4 other people in her family: her father in- law, her husband, and 2 children. Her husband is a worker.  She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 1.972.000 VND (or 110 USD ) to invest in her bazaar. There are 2 other Fund participants in her group . 
Ngát Thị Nguyễn  was born in 1982. ( no: 010102090015). She sells fish in the market. She has 2 children, one goes to school. She wants to borrow 3.132.000 VND (or 175 USD) to invest in her small business.
Hải Thị Nguyễn was born in 1976. ( no: 010102090019).  She sells fish in the market. She has 2 children. She needs 2.204.000 VND (or 125 USD) to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to invest in her bazaar

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel H. is married and has one child. He has received schooling up to junior high level. Emmanuel is a kentey weaver at Bla in Hohoe, which he has done since 1998. Kentey is a typical Ghanaian cloth that is woven with different colours of silken weaving twines. It is worn on special occasions to portray the rich culture of Ghana. Emmanuel uses his income to support the financial needs of his children. Emmanuel will use the loan to buy twines and threads to weave the kentey cloth to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy twines and threads to weave kentey cloth.

loans.name: Idrissa A.'s Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are all teachers at a secondary school in Makeni. The school was built in 1989 by a Muslim leader, with a body of religious and businesswomen to help educate the children of Makeni city and the surrounding villages. This school (a junior secondary school) has a total of 38 staff and 500 pupils. It is one of the most advanced secondary schools in Makeni city. Over the years, the school has produced teachers, doctors, lawyers, accountants, ministers and so on.

Teachers are one of the poorest paid workers in Sierra Leone. Because of this, many of them find alternative means of making a living. Some engage in business or agriculture while others organize extra classes for pupils. These teachers are therefore seeking a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects. They will gradually repay the loan out of their monthly salaries.

Idrissa A. M. is a senior teacher at the school. He is 50 years old and was born in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. Mr. M. has been a teacher for over 29 years now. He is married with four children, all of whom are at university. He will use this loan to pay the second semester college fees for two of his children in N’Jala University College.

loans.use: To pay his children's college fees

loans.name: Sulemani

texts.en:
Sulemani Y. sells sandals and material at Atabadze near Elmina. Sulemani has received junior high school education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a petty trader.

Sulemani has been selling sandals and material since 2003. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to expand her business with more and greater variety of footwear and fabric for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: expand her business with more and greater variety of footwear and fabric

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo A. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Mateo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mateo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from cultivating seaweed and harvesting this seaweed for sale. Mateo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mateo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mateo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mateo is requesting a new loan of ,PHP which will be used to purchase materials for seaweed production. This will be the second loan taken out by Mateo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase materials for seaweed production

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells sarongs of various colors and shapes, her sole source of income.  Forty years old and married with five children, Kemi is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn E. is 31 years old and a mother of three. She is from and owns a rice field in Agusan Del Sur. She joined CEVI to partake in their financial services because she has learned, from past experience, that limited finances can affect the size of her harvest. She believes that CEVI’s program will help to improve her family’s lifestyle. Marilyn applied for a loan of Php 6,000. The loan will increase her capital which will hopefully result in a good harvest.

loans.use: To help support rice growing/harvesting activities.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 56 years old and she is married to Victorino.  They help each other in managing their vulcanizing shop business. They have seven children, six of them are married and their youngest is Adela - 14 years old, a fourth year high school student.  They are living in Barangay Alicaocao, Cauyan City, a rural and plain area across a low bridge that overflows in times of heavy rains. 

They are earning a weekly gross income of PHP8, 000. They also buy and sell old car wheels that gives them additional income.  She is planning to ask for a loan amounting to PHP15, 000 from the KIVA lenders to further improve their business. She hopes to buy more items of car wheels to sell in their shop.

loans.use: Additional capital for their vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia P. is from the village of Beverly Hills Suarez , Iligan City. She is 57 years old. Alicia is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear items (RTW) in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 56 years old. She is widowed and the mother of four children. Two of her children are in school while the other two are traders. Her husband died after a prolonged sickness.

Janet is a supplier of local palm oil and also sells tubers of yam. Palm oil is produced from palm fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like for frying fish, or for making pastries, or for making local soaps. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is limited as a result of low working capital. Janet cannot afford a machine for the processing.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm fruits, tubers of yam, and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery of using manual effort. She will be able to produce palm oil in larger quantities. Janet believes the loan will enable her to save more toward her children's education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of palm oil and tubers of yam.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Leak Ty Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people and they all live in Tonle Bati village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Srey Leak T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Lay Bun Chhorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is employed operating a rice mill (a machine used to remove the chaff and outer husks from rice grains).

Now Mrs. Srey Leak T. wants to become a dessert seller to earn income for her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some plates, glasses, tables, chairs, and some ingredients to make dessert to sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living with this loan.

Mrs. Srey Leak T. is 31 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school and the others are too young to work or study.

Mrs. Visal T. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy equipment and ingredients to make and sell dessert

loans.name: Sarong

texts.en:
Sarong C., 48, and her husband Cheung Brach, 46, live in a small village along the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. Four attend school.    

Sarong has been a silk weaver for 30 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who sells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house builder for 10 years. 

Sarong is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business. She will also use a part of her loan to repair her house.

loans.use: Purchase silk for weaving business and repair home.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana de 36 años es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, vive sola en un cuarto alquilado y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio de Maximiliana es la venta de queso, es así que desde muy temprano sale a repartir los quesos que previamente los compró en los poblados de Taraco y Saman, y llevados a los principales mercados de Juliaca, en donde es muy esperada por sus clientes, quienes ya conocen la calidad de su producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la libertad de horarios que tiene, por lo que lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad de manera independiente, siendo lo más trabajoso es conseguir quesos de buena calidad, ya que ella tiene una  reputación ganada ante sus clientes y no quiere perderla. En adelante espera juntar el capital necesario para alquilar un puesto de venta y poder ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para que así no pueda causar problemas a sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal, ya que es muy estimada por ser una persona muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más quesos, ya que últimamente esta teniendo más demanda por parte de sus compradores.
texts.en:
