Maximiliana, 36 years old, is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She lives alone in a rented room and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Maximiliana's business is the sale of cheese. Consequently, she leaves very early to deliver the cheeses, which she previously buys from the towns Taraco and Saman. She takes them to the main markets of Juliaca, where she is eagerly awaited by her clients, who already know the quality of her product. What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has in her work schedule. From doing this activity for six years independently, the most laborious part is obtaining good quality cheese, as she already has an earned reputation before her customers and she does not want to lose it. From now on, she expects to raise the necessary capital to rent a store stall and be able to offer her customers a better service. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay all the dues on time so that it will not cause problems for her other companions from her communal bank as she is very esteemed for being a very responsible person. With the 1000 nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will buy more cheese since lately she has had more demand from her buyers.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cheeses

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel I. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Anabel owns and operates a business using her van to provide transport services to local community members. She is just starting this business. In 2005, Anabel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Anabel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirna Elizabeth H. F. de 24 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Vicente. Vive junto a una hermana, su cuñado y sobrinos, esto debido a que sus padres se vieron en la necesidad de emigrar a los Estado Unidos. A pesar de esto, Mirna decidió seguir adelante y poder iniciar su propio negocio, el cual es una venta de ropa para mujeres y hombres, dicho almacén de ropa está ubicado en el centro de San Vicente, lugar el cual siempre tiene una gran afluencia de personas, y debido a que su negocio está ubicado en la calle principal cuenta con muy buenas ventas, las cuales se incrementan los fines de semana. Así de esta manera es como Mirna se gana la vida, trabajando muy duro por mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y poder surtirlo con más mercadería. Es por esta razón por la que Mirna solicita un préstamo, ya que ella desea poder comprar mucha más ropa en diferentes tallas y colores, la cual siga la tendencia de la moda actual, de manera que pueda incrementar sus ventas, y de esta manera contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Mirna es una joven muy emprendedora, la cual es muy admirada en el lugar, por sus grandes deseos de seguir adelante y valerse por ella misma y que siempre está tratando de superarse y obtener nuevos retos en la vida.
texts.en:
Mirna Elizabeth H. F., 24, lives in San Vicente department with her sister, brother-in-law, and their children, because her parents emigrated to the United States. Despite this, Mirna decided to forge ahead and set up her own business. She sells clothing for men and women in a store that is located in downtown San Vicente, an area that has a lot of foot traffic and, because it is on the town's main street, sales are very good, escpecially on weekends. This is how Mirna earns her livelihood, working hard to improve her business' condition and increasing her stock. This is the reason why Mirna is requesting funding; she wants to buy a greater variety of colors and sizes of fashionable clothing so that her sales will increase and she will have better economic stability. She wants to continue to make progress, to be self-sufficient; she is always striving to improve and to set new goals for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Arco Iris (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Arco Iris está  formado por mujeres muy alegres, activas que buscan la unión y cooperación entre ellas para salir adelante y sobre todo tienen un vínculo familiar , el banco está ubicado a  unos diez minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca  en la comunidad Tres Marías en  la parroquia Turí, esta localidad es conocida como el balcón de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, muchos habitantes  han migrado a las grandes ciudades en busca de un buen trabajo y una mejor calidad de vida.

Nancy C. es una señora de 37 años y es una de las socias más alegres  del banco, vive  en su casa propia en la comunidad Tres Marías a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca junto a su esposo de profesión albañil y sus cuatro hijos de 15, 14, 11 y 10 años, su hijo mayor trabaja en una carpintería para sus gastos personales porque no le gusta estudiar y su hijo de 11 años es un niño especial que requiere mayores cuidados. 

Nancy se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, colas, golosinas,  lleva ya 10 años en este negocio que lo tiene en su misma casa, tiene días buenos y otros no tanto pero sigue adelante. Este  es su octavo ciclo en la fundación y los créditos  obtenidos ha invertido en la construcción de su casa, con el préstamo que pronto le entregarán va a comprar colas, papas, embutidos y salsas para incrementar su negocio y hacer realidad su sueño.

 Marcia tiene 27 años vive con su esposo  y sus  dos hijos que se encuentran de 8 y 7 años de edad, su esposo es albañil de profesión, no poseen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus padres,  

Marcia C.  se dedica a la cría y venta  de cuyes y  pollos estos son  vendidos en su comunidad ya pelados lleva varios años  en esta actividad que le ha permitido estabilizarse económicamente, es su octavo ciclo en la fundación y los créditos le han ayudado para incrementar su negocio.

Con el dinero que reciba del préstamo solicitado va a  comprar  pollos y alimento para su crianza e ir incrementando su criadero de pollos y hacer su sueño de tener casa propia una realidad.
texts.en:
The Rainbow communal bank is formed of active, very happy women that seek union and cooperation among them to do well. Above all they have a family link. The bank is located some ten minutes on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in the Tres Marías community of the Turí parish. This area is known as the balcony of Cuenca. Its people are dedicated to agriculture and stockbreeding. Many inhabitants have emigrated to the large cities in search of good work and a better quality of life. Nancy C. is a lady of 37 years and she is one of the happiest associates of the bank. She lives in her own house in the Tres Marías community on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca along with her husband, a professional bricklayer, and their four children ages 15, 14, 11 and 10. Her oldest son works as a carpenter for his personal expenses because he does not like to study. Her son of 11 years is a special boy that requires great care. Nancy is dedicated to the sale of salchipapas (a fast food made of fried potatoes and hot dogs or sausage), carbonated drinks, and other delicacies. She has been running this business for 10 years from her house. She has good days and bad days, but she continues ahead. This is her eighth loan cycle with the foundation and the loans she has obtained have been invested in the construction of her house. With the loan that she now requests, she will buy carbonated drinks, potatoes, sausage and sauces to increase her business and to make her dream a reality. Marcia is 27 years old and lives with her husband and their two children that are 8 and 7 years of age. Her husband is a bricklayer by profession. They do not have their own house, but live in the house of their parents, Marcia C. is dedicated to the raising and sale of guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells already prepared in her community. She has carried out this activity for several years, and it has allowed her to become economically stable. This is her eighth loan cycle with the foundation and the loans have helped her to grow her business. With the money that she will receive, she is going to buy chickens and food for breeding them and grow her chicken coop. She hopes to make her dream of having her own home a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated drinks, potatoes, sausage for a fast food business and also chicks and feed for a chicken raising business, among others.

loans.name: Mr. Buntheng Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fifteen people who live in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. Mr. Buntheng S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members they will use a loan in different purpose. He owns a harvest machine to rent to farmers and his wife, Mrs. Chanra K., is a farmer who owns 2-hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family. In the rice field, they have some problems because their field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, in order to improve productive rice, Mr. Buntheng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, and the others are too small to work or study. 

On the day of the loan disbursement Mr. Buntheng S. was busy working in the field. Instead, his wife, Mrs. Chanra K., received the loan for him. The photo above is of Mr. Buntheng S.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy fuel

loans.name: Khotte

texts.fr: Khotte N. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants et a la responsabilité de 4 autres enfants qu'on lui a confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis 2ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés régulièrement. Elle est détentrice d'un petit restaurant où elle ne vend que le petit déjeuner. Cette activité lui un permis d'équiper sa chambre à couché en achetant un lit en bois, elle lui permet aussi de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Khotte N. is a 45 year-old mother of 8, who has another four children in her care. She has been a member of the Darou-Khoudoss Banc Villageois (credit association) for the past two and a half years, and has received five loans that she repaid successfully. Khotte is the owner of a small restaurant which serves breakfast only. This business has enabled her to equip her bedroom with a wooden bed, and has allowed her to maintain her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her restaurant business

loans.name: Mauro Juvenal

texts.es:
Mauro, tiene 73 años y tiene tres hijos de las cuales todos ya son independientes, él es un padre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a sus hijos.

Mauro es docente jubilado y trabajó 33 años para el colegio particular “Integrando de Urubamba”. Actualmente, él socio tiene un pequeño negocio que es un café restaurante que esta ubicado en su domicilio, en el restaurante se prepara desayuno y almuerzo para personas que están pensionadas. 

Mauro pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 15 años que funciona el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente el socio requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante y para pagar las  matriculas de sus nietos.                 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mauro is 73 years old, and he has three children who are all independent. He is a responsible father who looks every minute for opportunities to get ahead. He looks to use his daily effort to help his children. Mario is a retired teacher. He worked for 33 years at Integrando de Urubamba, a private school. He currently has a small business, which is a café type restaurant. It is located in his house. He prepares breakfast and lunch for retired people. Mauro belongs to the Tercer Milenio Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa. The bank has been in existence for 15 years. His first loan was for 100 dollars, which he invested in his business. He currently needs a loan to equip the restaurant and to pay his grandchildren’s school enrollment fees. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip his restaurant and to pay his grandchildren's school enrollment fees

loans.name: Gladys Luz

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 31 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 08 años de edad, vive en el sector La Zaranda, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe sus actividades principales son la agricultura y la crianza de animales, la zona en donde vive queda ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. Ella cría ovejas y chivos en un potrero que posee, allí ellos se alimentan de algarroba (fruto del arbol algarrobo, abundante en la zona). Cuando alcanzan su grado máximo de desarrollo ella los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentan el lugar, esta actividad es la única que le provee de ingresos económicos, por lo que da lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio.

Gladys desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y de alimento para complementar su nutrición durante los siguientes meses en los que la algarroba se pone escasa, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Gladys es uma madre luchadora que siempre da todo de si para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior de modo que se aseguren un futuro próspero. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gladys, 31, is separated and has two children, a 14-year-old and an 8-year-old. She lives in La Zaranda, a rural district of Pítipo, Ferreñafe province. She is a farmer and raises small farm animals. The area where she lives is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has raised small farm animals for the last five years. She raises sheep and goats in a pasture she has. There, they feed on algarroba [fruit of the algarrobo tree (vetch)] that is abundant in the area. When they reach ideal weight she sells them to merchants that frequent the area. This activity provides her only source of income so she gives her best in order to maintain her business. Gladys would like to expand her business buying more animals and feed to complement their nutrition during the next few months when algarroba becomes scarce. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to reach this goal. Gladys is a tenacious mother who has always given everything of herself to raise her children. Her greatest wish is to offer them the opportunity to study a professional career so that they may have a more prosperous future. She has collaborated previously with our institution and has been punctual and responsible with her installment repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep, goats and animal feed.

loans.name: Santa Cecilia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Cecilia debe su nombre a L. patrona D. los músicos “Santa Cecilia” y porque el grupo es muy alegre, les encanta L. música. Así es L. gente del poblado Tapotzingo, en Nacajuca. Cuatro señoras conforman el grupo: Doña María DomitiL. es L. representante del grupo, elL. venD. zapatos por catálogo, doña Sara venD. antojitos, doña María Concepción hace artesanía (petates) y doña María del Rosario tiene una tiendita D. abarrotes.

Me gusta el trabajo D. L. artesanía, nos dice doña Concha, como L. conocen en L. comunidad, tiene 4 hijos, uno D. ellos es su ayudante en L. elaboración D. sus artesanías (aparece en L. foto tejiendo) y su esposo es campesino. L. señora D. dedica a L. elaboración  D. petates desD. hace aproximadamente 20 años, también  hace bolsas y abanicos. ElL. aprendió a elaborarlas  en un curso que se llevó a cabo en su casa por parte del gobierno. El crédito que pidió es para comprar más materiales como cañitas, hilera, pintura, cintas y flor D. pantano (lirio). Quiere conservar las tradiciones del pueblo.Vender directamente sus productos y evitar intermediarios.

El grupo es muy unido porque se conocen desD. que nacieron y se han ayudado, esperan poder agradecer en persona a KIVA por considerarlos y hacer que su trabajo sea más  reconocido en todo el mundo.
texts.en:
The Santa Cecilia Group is named after St. Cecilia, the patron saint of music, since they are a cheerful group that enjoys music. The group consists of four women from the village of Tapotzingo in Nacajuca. Doña María DomitiL. is the group representative and sells shoes through a catalog. Doña Sara sells snacks. Doña María Concepción sells “petates” (handwoven bedrolls). Doña María del Rosario manages a grocery store.

“I enjoy making things by hand,” says María Concepción, who is known as “Doña Concha” within the community. She has four children, one of whom helps with making the bedrolls (as shown in the photograph). Her husband is a farmer. Doña Concha has been making bedrolls for approximately 20 years, as well as purses and fans. She learned this craft after taking a course at home that was being offered by the government. The loan she requested will be used to purchase more materials such as straw, string, paint, ribbons, and marsh lilies. By making these products, she hopes to preserve the traditions of her town. She sells her products directly to the public in order to avoid middlemen.

This group is very close and the members have known each other since birth. They help one another and wish they could thank Kiva in person for considering them and providing recognition of their work to the rest of the world.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making handwoven bedrolls

loans.name: Rukarara Development A, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Very hardworking H. Everlist has been operating a produce sales business in Kazinga, Kihihi, for a period of thirteen years. With nostalgia, this happily married father of five children recalls how his business basked in high profit returns at its onset. Times have changed, however, as his business is now showing diminishing returns, earning him 250,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is in sharp contrast to the 350,000 shillings he says he was making at the start of his business.

There is always a story connected with people in western Uganda who, despite laboring under such tough times, find a way of educating their children. Everlist is no exception. What he is looking forward to now is the prospect of enhancing his business by buying more maize, beans, cassava and other crops with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To buying more produce to sell

loans.name: And-Jef Hlm Rte De Gossas Group

texts.fr:
le groupe AND-JEF du Banc Villageois des HLM Route de GOSSAS est créé il y a de cela 6 mois. Il vient d'effectuer le remboursement de leur premier prêt avec CAURIE-MF et aucune irrégularité n' a été constatée pour le payement des prêts. Elle sont toutes issus du même quartier et effectuent en général le petit commerce de tissus, d'encens, de parfums, de produits cosmétiques etc. Avant d'adhérer à CAURIE-MF elles s'étaient constituées en groupement d'intérêt économique et faisaient des prêts rotatifs et des tontines, ce qui leur permettait d'exercer de petites activités de commerce. Mais depuis qu'elles ont commencer à bénéficier des financements de CAURIE-MF elles ont commencé à intensifier et à élargir leur champ d'activité. Elles sont très solidaires par rapport à des orientations pour la diversification de leurs activités.

Madame Bineta T., la présidente du groupe, à l'extrême droit de la photo, emmitouflée dans un pagne en fleurette, est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et aussi tutrice de sa cousine. Elle fait un commerce de tissus depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s'approvisionne en gros à Dakar et vend dans son quartier et dans les environs. Son nouveau lui servira à renforcer son niveau d'investissement et son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple l'enrichissement de la nourriture et assurer la bonne couverture sanitaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group AND-JEF from the Banc Villageois of HLM, on the GOSSAS Road was created 6 months ago. They have just finished repaying their first loan with CAURIE-MF and no irregularity was found in their repayment of their loan. They all come from the same neighborhood and mostly sell cloth, incense, perfume, cosmetics, etc. Before joining CAURIE-MF, they had come together as a group with the same economic interests and participated in "merry-go-round" funds (revolving small loans), which allowed them to stay in business. Since they began to receive CAURIE-MF loans, they have been able to intensify and expand their field of activity. They are very united as far as possibilities for diversifying their businesses go. Madame Bineta T., the president of the group, on the far right in the photo, wrapped in a length of flowered cloth, is 51, married, and the mother of four children as well as being responsible for her cousin. She has been selling cloth for more than 10 years. She buys wholesale in Dakar and sells in her neighborhood and the surrounding areas. Her new loan will serve to reinforce her working capital and her goal is to be able to put aside more savings and help to improve living conditions for her family, for example improving their nutrition and making sure her children have everything they need to stay healthy.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and promote the business activities of the group

loans.name: Aurelia Bibiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Aurelia tiene 50 años de edad,  la socia es soltera y tiene una pequeña tienda abarrotes, ella se dedica a la administración de esta su tienda, la socia apoya a sus sobrinos, es una muy buena mujer y muy trabajadora. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su tienda abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Yanapakuy Communal Bank. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province, Cusco department. Aurelia, the member, is 50 years old. She is single, and she has a small grocery store. She devotes herself to running her store. The member supports her nephews. She is a very good and hard-working woman. The member is requesting the loan to help her grocery store. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. She commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing for ladies, gentlemen, children, cosmetics, sheet sets and other things

loans.name: 04.01.04 Hai Son - Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Hồng Đỗ thị is a 23 year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Hồng is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 04.01.04 Hai Son - Hoang Truong.

Hồng is married and has 1 infant. She operates a family member's fishing business primarily harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Hồng has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hồng is requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Hồng from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions/

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Vũ Thị Nhung is a 32-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


2.  N. Thị Nhiều is a 21-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


3.  N. Thị Mỳ is an 18-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


4.  N. Thị Ninh is a 24-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


5.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 48 años, convive con su pareja Antonio de 57 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos y de los cuales sólo vive con uno de ellos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 18 años siembra arveja, papa, gladiolo y maíz, en terrenos que posee, en donde además cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. Paralelamente cría caballos y asnos que le ayudan a trasladar sus insumos y herramientas hacía los campos que trabajará durante el día. Yolanda, le gusta sembrar arveja y gladiolos porque son productos con mayor demanda en el mercado, principalmente en épocas festivas, sin embargo le es pesado tener que trasladar lo que cosechó y pagar el traslado, pero sabe que de ello depende para vender sus frutos. En esta última campaña de cosecha, llevó su producción al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Lima, logrando ganar mayores ingresos económicos. Para su futuro, desea sembrar en mayor cantidad arvejas e instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en su casa. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, pues conoce su metodología de trabajo que le gusta mucho. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de dos bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 48, lives with her partner Antonio, 57, with whom she has 3 children, of which only one lives with them in their own home. For 18 years she has grown peas, potatoes, gladioli and maize on the land she owns, counting on the help of her husband. Parallel to this she has also raised horses and donkeys, who help her to transport her products and tools to the land where she works during the day. Yolanda likes growing peas and gladioli because they are the products in greatest demand in the market, particularly during festival times. Without question it's difficult for Yolanda to have to transport what she harvests and to pay for the transport, but she knows that her profits depend on this. In the most recent harvest season Yolanda took her product to the wholesale market in Lima where she received better economic returns. In the future Yolanda wants to grow peas in a larger quantity and install a food sale business in her house. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is happy to continue working with the members of her communal bank as they know her working methodology which she likes very much. With the loan she is seeking Yolanda thinks to invest in the purchase of 2 bags of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Arturo tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Su actividad económica de un taller de reparación de bicicletas, en la que además vende los repuestos. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, con ella ha podido ofrecerles a sus hijos estudios, alimentos y vestimenta. Su esposa trabaja como comerciante de ropa y artículos varios, por lo cual también aporta para el sustento del hogar. E4ste financiamiento será destinado para la compra de materia prima como asientos, cadenas, pedales, aceites, llantas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Carlos Arturo, 42, is married and has 2 minor children. He has a workshop where he repairs bicycles and also sells spare parts. This is not the first time that he has taken a loan; he has already proven to be a very responsible person. He has been in this humble line of work for more than 13 years, and with it he has been able to educate, clothe and feed his children. His wife works as a merchant selling clothing and various items to help support the household. This loan will be used to buy parts and supplies such as bicycle seats, chains, pedals, oils, and tires, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy bicycle parts and supplies

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene de 24 años está casada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Desde muy joven le gustó trabajar lo hizo durante su adolescencia, con la enseñanza que le brindaron su padres Marlene decide iniciar el negocio de venta y elaboración de comida, se arriesgó en establecer su propio lugar por la necesidad de proporcionar los ingresos para el hogar, debido al precio y a la buena atención que ofrecía a sus clientes su negocio fue creciendo. Este es su primer crédito por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus cuotas de pagos, ya que es principalmente para la compra materia prima necesaria. Por lo que sueña con construir su propia casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene, 24, is married and has two children in her care. She’s enjoyed working from a very early age; she started during her adolescence. With the teachings she got from her parents Marlene decided to go into the preparation and sale of food. She ventured to establish her own place motivated by the need to generate household income. Due to the good prices and service she offers her customers the business began to grow. This is her first loan and she assures that she will repay her installments faithfully since it will be used primarily to purchase ingredients. She dreams with building her own house and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rwakirungura People's Assn, Rukungiri Group

texts.en: Hard-working M. Oliver of Rwakirungura People's Assn, Rukungiri, 50 years old, has been operating a livestock business that deals in goat rearing from Nyabicence, Rukungiri after being encouraged by other dealers in the same business. The married mother of five children engages in the purchase of goats that she grazes and sells later for a higher price and she does this along with her business selling bananas and ghee. This has seen her earn 300,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis that has helped her with the family responsibilities like paying for her children’s fees. She is into restocking more livestock on the farm and needs this loan to help her achieve her motive since it will increase her sales revenue in the near future and improve the family income.

loans.use: To purchase more goats

loans.name: Margaret Nana

texts.en: Margaret Nana T. sells doughnuts and ice cream at Elmina.  Margaret Nana has received junior high education.  She is a widow and has four children. She responsibly takes care of her family with the income she makes. Her loan will be used to buy more ice creams for sale. She hopes to use the new revenue from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy more ice creams for sale

loans.name: Shafqat Munir Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Shafqat is a resident of Sumandri which is a small city located in the Punjab. This city is a big trading center for rugs in Pakistan. All types of rugs (simple and designer) are available there for selling.  

A very caring lady, Shafqat carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and takes care of her family. She is married to M. A. who is a carrier by trade. He loads different items such as fruit, vegetables and construction supplies on his donkey cart and drops them to designated places. He has been offering his loading services to his clients for the past five years.  

Shafqat has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy a new donkey cart because the old cart has become rough and rotted in different parts which makes him unable to load items onto it and this is affecting his work. Shafqat is hopeful that her husband will successfully retain his customers by providing them good loading services.  

Note: In the photo, Shafqat is the lady who is holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) in her hands.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel C. lives in the village of Usocan. He is 26 years old, married and earns a living as a fisherman. He has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from his work.

In 2008, Joel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. Joel has successfully repaid three previous loans from PMPC and has applied for a new one, for 15,000 PHP,  to invest in expanding his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Eou

texts.en:
Eou S., 33, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Eou S. is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 1 per day. Her husband is a skillful blacksmith, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. She has to spend USD 83 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more blacksmith supplies to expand her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more blacksmith supplies to expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza E. is from the village of Tonggo,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Liza is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Liza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Узбекова Малика проживает в районе Яван. Ей 38 лет. Разведена. Имеет двоих детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование среднее. После того как рассталась с мужем занялась бизнесом. В доме и на рынке Тичорат у нее имеется магазин. Она в основном продает женскую и детскую одежду. Брат и сестра помогают ей в бизнесе. Торговлей Малика занимается уже три года. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Malika U. lives in Yavan.  She is 38 years old, divorced, and has two children.  She lives with her parents. She has a high school education.  She began her business after she left her husband.   She has a shop at home and one in the Tichorat market.  She primarily sells women’s and children's clothes.  Her brother and sister help her with the business.  Malika has been working in sales for three years now.  She is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods.

loans.use: Buying seasonal goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more 'lappa' (traditional dress for women)

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda P. is from Trigos, Ozamiz City. She is 53 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in buying and selling vegetables. She has been engaged in this business for twenty years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 from PMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Minda P. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae C. is from the village of Looc Proper. She is 33 years old. Mae is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mae owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling personal products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products to tourists and local community members. Mae has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mae joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mae is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mae from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 36 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa con su madre en la parte rural del caserío de Tejedores Bajo en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza como maquillaje y perfumes por catálogo. Vende sus productos en su domicilio y también visita algunos clientes en caseríos cercanos a su vivienda. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Carmen desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más mercadería para incrementar sus ventas diarias. Con mayores ingresos, Carmen podrá solventar los gastos económicos de su familia. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old, single, and has no children. She lives at her mother’s house in the rural section of Tejedores Bajo in the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is located in the province and region of Piura and more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For the past three years, Carmen has been selling clothes and beauty products such as make-up and perfumes through a catalog. She sells her products from her home and some of her customers come from nearby villages to see her. Carmen already has an established customer base in the area.

She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of more merchandise so that she can increase her daily sales. With more income, Carmen will be able to cover her family’s expenses. To accomplish her goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: Acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras De Chopuerta Group

texts.en:
Doña Silvia is 41 years old, married, and has seven children. Three of her children are currently in school. Silvia spends her time caring for her family and working as weaver. She has been weaving for over eight years. Her husband helps support the family with his work as a bricklayer. 

Silvia is requesting a loan as part of the Mujeres Triunfadoras Group (The Successful Women’s Group) to purchase materials for her work weaving girdles (sash or belt) which she sells in the market. Silvia started her business weaving and selling clothing with a small amount of personal savings and hopes to expand her business with the help of this loan. With more materials, she hopes to be able to weave more girdles and increase her sales. 

The other members of the Mujeres Triunfadores group are involved in the following businesses: animal raising, fruit sales, clothing production and sales, and everyday consumer goods sales.

loans.use: To buy materials for weaving girdles (sash/belt)

loans.name: Jumagazy

texts.en:
Jumagazy A. is 51 years old, married, and has three children.  He works as a chair of the local administration and is known as a very responsible and hardworking person.  In order to find an additional means of subsistence, during the last 10 years Jumagazy has been engaged in cattle breeding.  With the initial capital of 10,000 KGS, he managed to earn 6,000–8,000 KGS in a month.  In the summer, he pastures in the mountainous areas, which allows him to reduce his expenses on the forage. With the revenues from this activity, Jumagazy paid for the education of his elder children. Jumagazy is requesting a loan of 50,000 KGS, which he will use to purchase sheep and one milch cow. Revenues from this activity will allow him to build a huge barn for his cattle.  

About Bai-Tushum and Partners Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther L. is 44 years old and married to Edgar, her business partner. They presently live in Caloocan City, Metro Manila. Esther runs her own plastic ware store. Each day she looks into the sales, observes which are the best-selling items and what are the best-selling techniques. She has been in this business for four years and every month she earns an estimated net income of 10,000 PHP.

To help expand her business, Esther is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more quantities of plastic ware to be included in her inventory of products. Esther mentions that this loan will enable her to earn and pay her weekly obligations responsibly.

Just like her fellow community partners, the rainy seasons hamper Esther's business productivity. Instead of having a considerable number of customers, she finds her store abandoned when it rains. However, she finds ways to deal with this challenge, because she always keeps in mind her responsibilities as a micro entrepreneur.  She continually strives to become more profitable.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase accessories, plastic ware, kitchen ware, and other household cleaning items to sell

loans.name: Rosalina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosalina es una pequeña comerciante, de venta de ropa y cosmético con varios años en las ventas, logrando cada día mejores objetivos en su negocio gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado, con los cuales ha comprado variedad de productos, con mejores ventas.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara mercadería en ropa, cremas de manos, crema para el cutis, pintura de labio, vanidad, perfume de dama y caballero, cremas para el cabello entre otros productos que se venden por ser de buena calidad y de costo bajos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a small business owner who sells clothing and cosmetics. She has several years of experience in this business and is meeting higher goals all the time thanks to the loans she receives through Afodenic, with which she has purchased a variety of products and improved her sales. 

With this new loan she will purchase clothing merchandise, hand creams, skin creams, lipstick, perfumes, colognes, hair creams and other products which are popular due to their good quality and low cost.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics to improve her sales.

loans.name: Onon

texts.en:
Onon G. is 35-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in an apartment in the Yaarmag Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband died a year ago and she was left alone with her daughter who attends local secondary school. 

She manages a clothing-making business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business based on her designer qualifications and skills. She graduated from the Institute of Art with a bachelor's degree in design in 1998. Her business has been quite successful, which has allowed her to employ four more workers. She is planning to continue her business in the future. 

Besides managing her business operation, she works as a bursar at a private company. She is a hardworking woman who says, "I love my job and I want to continue it."

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a sewing machine and some materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and some materials

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 25-year-old man from Palestine. Haytham is engaged and will get married this summer, Haytham is an employee with a decent salary, Haytham needed  $1000 to pay the wedding hall rent.

Haytham took out the loan from FATEN as it will be easier for him to repay FATEN than borrowing from relatives or friends.

loans.use: to rent the Wedding hall

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 29-years old and married. He and his wife have two children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past five years.

Benson has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. He has been a good client who hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

He dreams of prospering in farming and being able to provide better lives for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Combine Sisters Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Combine Sisters” group.  These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000.00 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Sallay is the leader of this group.  Sallay is about 45 years old and she is a widow with 5 grown-up children.  Sallay sells dried/smoked fish and has been doing this business for 7 years now.  With the help of this loan, Sallay will invest in her business by buying baskets full of dried/smoked fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy baskets full of dried/smoked fish to add to her business

loans.name: Yolisa

texts.es: Yoliza de 29 años de edad, convive con Román de 39, con quien tiene 3 hijos que les llena de satisfacción;  ellos viven en su casa propia  ubicada en el  distrito de Pichari. Perseverante y trabajadora desde niña, junto a sus queridos padres, inicio la actividad del negocio como ambulante. Con el tiempo juntó un buen capital lo cual la ayudó su propia  tienda de prendas de vestir. Yoliza esta  feliz  con el negocio que ella ejerce, por que gracias a ello es que puede darle una buena educación a sus tres menores hijos, quienes también lo apoyan en la venta. En un futuro desea tener una cadena de tiendas, pero para realizar este anhelado sueño debe esforzarse para obtener un buen capital. Es por esta razón que ella recurre a MFP a solicitar su segundo crédito, por el que se compromete a pagar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para cumplir con sus objetivos. Con los 2.000  nuevos soles ella adquirirá más prendas para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Yoliza is 29 years old and lives with 39 year-old Román.  They have three children who fill them with satisfaction.  They live in their own home which is located in Pichari district.

Persistent and hard-working since she was a girl, Yoliza started out in this business, alongside her beloved parents, as an itinerant vendor.  Over time, she gathered together a good sum of money which helped her to open her own clothes store.  Yoliza is happy with the business that she runs because, thanks to the business, she is able to provide her three dependent children, who support her in making her sales, with a good education.

In the future, Yoliza would like to own a chain of stores but, in order to achieve this dream, she must work hard in order to gather together a good sum of money.  For this reason, she came to MFP to request her second loan and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in helping her achieve her goals.

Yoliza will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to acquire more clothes with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  KENA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, de l’arachide et du pois sucré avec RAMATOU 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
Group Benkadi 1's ten members are married women who are on average 38 years old with four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kena, one of the villages of Nantien Township in Sikasso prefecture (Mali's third administrative region).
They are partnering with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso to complete their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the organization; previous loans were repaid successfully.
The cultivated crops are rice, groundnuts and tiger nuts for Ramatou, who is standing first from the left in the picture. With her loan, she plans to pay for plowing costs and buy agricultural fertilizers and seeds to maintain 2.5 acres. After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientele comprising men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 145,000 CFA per agricultural cycle.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses. She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso to better operate her agricultural space and to increase her profits.

loans.use: to pay from plowing costs and agricultural inputs (fertilizers, seeds...)

loans.name: Elipia

texts.es: Elipia es natural de Chupaca, tiene 59 años, es casada y tiene 04 hijos, quienes ya son independientes, ahora solo  vive con esposo en su casa que es propia. Desde su infancia sus padres forjaron en ella el trabajo esforzado que le ha servido durante toda su vida, tras sus años de matrimonio reforzó este aprendizaje con su esposo labrando los terrenos que ambos heredaron de sus padres. Hoy en día sigue cultivando papa, maíz, habas, arveja, zanahoria entre otros cultivos que  tiene en sus terrenos. Una forma de generarse ingresos adicionales fue mediante su tienda de abarrotes que ya viene funcionando desde hace 20 años. Hace poco implanto en su tienda la venta de verduras y para los niños video juegos como estrategia para que haya más ventas, Elipia esta muy entusiasmada con su negocio y a las actividades agrícolas que realiza,  por lo que ha decidido aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es la primera vez que va solicitar un crédito y fue porque  le recomendaron trabajar con MFP,  considera que los plazos y el monto se ajusta a la necesidad de capital que necesita para crecer y esta muy agradecida por eso. Con el dinero que solicita, le servirá para comprar más mercadería en abarrotes como azúcar, arroz y menestras.
texts.en:
Elipia is from Chupaca.  She is 59 years old, married, and has four children who live independently.  She now lives alone with her husband in their own home.

Since she was a young girl, Elipia's parents instilled in her the need to work hard.  That lesson has served her throughout her life.  After she got married, she reinforced what she had learned alongside her husband, working the land that they both inherited from their parents.  Now Elipia grows potatoes, corn, beans, peas, carrots and other crops on her land.  An additional source of income is the grocery store which she has been running for 20 years now.  A short while ago, she started selling vegetables in her store and also set up video games for the children as a strategy for increasing her sales.  Elipia is very enthusiastic about her grocery store business and the farming that she does.  For this reason, she has decided to increase her working capital.  

This is the first time that Elipia has requested a loan.  She received a recommendation to work with MFP.  She considers that the instalments and the sum of money fit well with the amount of capital she needs to grow her business.  She is very grateful for this.  She will use the money she is requesting to buy more merchandise (groceries) such as sugar, rice and mixed vegetables.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and mixed vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther de 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María Esther se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, actividad que viene realizando junto con su esposo desde hace varios años, cuenta con un local donde vende el pan que prepara y también ofrece diversos dulces a sus clientes,  tiene su propia clientela, últimamente su negocio a ido creciendo y han aumentado sus clientes, lo que le permite tener mayores ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su casa.  También cría y vende aves de corral, una vez que se engorden las comercializa a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona.

Para seguir realizando sus actividades como hasta el momento a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para seguir elaborando pan, realizar algunas mejoras al local donde funciona su panadería y comprar alimento para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y tener un poco más de comodidades.  María Esther y su esposo han sabido salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, con la finalidad de alcanzar lo que se han propuesto.
texts.en:
María Esther, 40, lives with her husband in her own house which does not have basic utilities and is located in Mórrope District which belongs to Lambayeque Department.  This is a farming, livestock raising and crafts making zone.

María Esther makes bread to sell.  She’s been doing this for several years with her husband.  She has a locale where she sells the bread she makes and also sells various sweets to her customers.  She has her own clientele and lately the business has been growing and the number of customers has increased which leads to higher income to meet her daily household expenses.  She also raises barnyard fowl and once they fatten up she sells them to her customers or in the various local markets.

To continue carrying out her activities like she’s done to date, she feels it’s necessary to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy ingredients to continue making bread and to do some improvements to the locale where her bakery operates as well as to buy feed for her animals.  With income she earns she will be able to repay the loan and have a few more comforts.

María Esther and her husband have learned how to get ahead through much effort and work in order to attain what they have proposed for themselves.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread and to make some improvements to the bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her coffee fields.

loans.name: Djuraboy

texts.ru: Джурабой проживает в районе Хуросон. Он женат. Ему 56 лет. У него пятеро детей. Его сын занимается перевозками. Сам Джурабой занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Djuraboy lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 56 years old, married and has five children.  His son is involved in transportation.  Djuraboy is involved in sales at the market.  He has a store, where he sells food products.  He has been in this business for six years.  Besides this, he is also involved in animal husbandry.  Djuraboy is requesting this loan for the purchase of products in order to expand the assortment of his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Villa Ancara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA ANCORA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Agripina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicios.

La señora Agripina  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejido y cría de animales, el que viene trabajando hace un año atrás. Inicio este negocio aprovechando la cría de animales (alpaca y llama) que realiza desde niña 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fibra de alpaca) que comprará de la fábrica y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Villa Ancora” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Center.  It has ten members led by a governing board headed by Agripina.  The businesses the members of the communal bank operate are varied.  Among them we have: commerce, production and services.

Agripina indicates that this is the first cycle she’s worked with Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  At present she has a crafts business weaving and raising animals that she’s been operating for a year now.  She started the business taking advantage of raising alpacas and llamas that she’s done since she was a little girl.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital (to buy alpaca wool) which she’ll buy from the factory and then make items based on orders.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the health clinic and the savings.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a married man with two school-going children. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling households items like maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and washing detergents. He faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zuhran's Group

texts.en:
Zuhran is 51 years old and sews clothes for her neighboring clients to support her family financially. She is very supportive in nature and also helps her husband in his animal selling business. She gives his animals food and water and keeps their place clean in a timely way. 
Her husband is involved in two businesses. Professionally he has been a carpenter for the past 16 years but he also has an animal sales business. He has a good name in his community for keeping good animal breeds. 
He helps out people by sharing knowledge about animals and also provides them useful tips on taking care of them.  

With his good knowledge of this profession, he has decided to grow it by buying some animals (goats & sheep) to raise them for selling.
Zuhran is very hopeful that an investment will help her husband grow his business and increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy animals for animal sales business

loans.name: Litara

texts.en:
Litara is 31 years of age and married with two children. Litara owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Litara needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment such as knives, spade, axe, sharpener and a wheel-barrow.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Litara joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Litara's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment such as knives, spade, axe, sharpener and a wheel-barrow

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 25 years old and single. He resides in Narok, Kenya. He is a maize farmer. He has been farming for the past eight years. He knew KADET  LTD through a registered client with KADET. 

Benard has been a good client and this is his third loan. He plans to use the loan to prepare the land for farming and buy farm inputs, i.e maize seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in other businesses. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in Uganda. For the past four years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothes shop, which sells ladies' and children's wear. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cloth to make clothes, and it will help Sarah to generate greater profits and better her family's welfare. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger, better boutique. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old and married with eight children.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Lorna has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lorna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Tutulu

texts.en:
Tutulu is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Fagamalo. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Tutulu owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Tutulu has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately WST 600 a month from these activities.

In 2011, Tutulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tutulu is requesting a loan of WST 1,000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from SPBD. Tutulu plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 49-year-old mixed-crop farmer; he is married to Joyce, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child, aged 25. Julius has been rearing pigs for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 to support his family.

Julius is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, he hopes to start exporting pig products, which will increase his profits and help him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand started to raise crops when he got married 10 years ago. He owns a hectare rice field which he cultivates planting rice. He learned the skills of raising crops from his father who is also a farmer. As of now, Ferdinand would like to keep making more sales from his business but he has insufficient working capital so he is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming.

In the future, Ferdinand would like to earn enough funds for the college education of his four children so that they can be professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Nouwagnongbe Group

texts.fr: NOUWAGNONGBE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Léa Victorine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 51 ans. Léa Victorine est mariée à un certain Julien. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Léa Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Léa Victorine a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Léa Victorine vend depuis huit ans du maïs et de la farine de manioc dans son quartier. Léa Victorine s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'élargir son activité, Léa Victorine sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe NOUWAGNONGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: NOUWAGNONGBE is a group of four people living in the same area in Benin. The representative of the group, Léa Victorine (with her hand raised in the photo), is fifty-one years old. Léa Victorine is married to a man named Julien. The couple has one child in school and in their care. Léa Victorine lives together with her husband and child. Together, the couple provides for the various household expenses. Léa Victorine stopped attending school at the secondary level. To cope with her various expenses, Léa Victorine has sold corn and manioc flour in her area for the last eight years. Léa Victorine stocks up in an area of Benin. In seeking the satisfaction of her clients and with an eye to increasing her business activities, Léa Victorine is asking for a first loan from Alidé, together with the other members of the group NOUWAGNONGBE. This loan will help them to better respond to the demands of their clients and to make higher profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and manioc flour.

loans.name: Gisèle's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Gisèle, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 43 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Gisèle est mariée à un géomètre nommé Léopold. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certain scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Gisèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Gisèle vend des noix de coco depuis cinq ans. Gisèle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Gisèle sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle. Le crédit précédents a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des noix de coco.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en: Joselyn has been running her business for many years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops.

location.town: BAG-ONG BALAMABAN, MAHAYAG ZAMBOANGA DEL SUR

loans.name: Susana Carolina

texts.es:
Susana prepara comida para vender y generar ingresos con los que puede costear sus gastos personales, ella vive con sus hermanas pero todas son independientes, trabaja con un horario normal de ocho de la mañana a una de la tarde, tiene ya dos años de estar realizando dicha actividad.
El financiamiento le será de ayuda para comprar materia prima como: carnes, verduras, condimentos, aceite, etc., para cocinar los diferentes platillos que ofrece en el menú, considera que con la inversión podrá establecer un nuevo punto de atención y generar más ingresos para resarcir su deuda.
Su proyecto es lograr tener un local propio para que su negocio sea más rentable y sus clientes estén mejor atendidos.

loans.use: comprar materia prima como: carnes, verduras, condimentos, aceite, etc., para cocinar los diferentes platillos que ofrece en el menú

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy seedlings to plant on her farm

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.en:
I'm an owner of a taxi, helping transport people to different parts of the city. I work Monday-Saturday. At the moment, I need to repair my car so I can provide better service to my passengers. With the income, I can help with family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me dedico al sector del trasporte, soy dueño de un taxi en el que traslado a personas a distintos sitios de la ciudad, trabajo de lunes a sabado, en este momento necesito reparar mi vehiculo para dar un mejor servicio a mis pasajeros. Con los ingresos que percibo ayudo a mi familia con los gastos.

loans.use: Reparing my taxi.

loans.name: Folorina

texts.en: Folorina recently finished school.  She is twenty-one years old.  Folorina says that most women in her family support themselves via their own small businesses. Rather than search for a job in town, Folorina was anxious to follow their example and rely on her entrepreneurial spirit to support herself financially.  Folorina joined SPBD in order to get access to capital to launch a business.  She decided to start a flea market stall.  In her stall she sells traditional Samoan handicrafts, t-shirts and clothes that she makes herself.  Folorina is a talented tailor and also knows how to print fabric designs by hand.  With another loan, Folorina will expand her stall and product line to include a larger variety of clothing.  She says that she is very happy with the program and wants to continue using the microloans to expand into a full retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell at her flea market stall

loans.name: Diby

texts.en:
Diby G. is a 40-year-old single mother. She lives with her 4 children in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. G., who started selling casava paste in 1981, is a dynamic woman who has been able to care for her 4 children's education fees till now.

G. now wants to diversify her business by offering special local sauce products to her increasing customers' needs. This will significantly improve G.'s revenue and ensure better work conditions. She has recently relocated near her business place. G., who heard about AE&I from her cousin, joined the AE&I microcredit program in October, 2004 and has benefited from micro loans that she repaid in a good manner.

loans.use: Diby Germaine will use the loan diversify her business

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind, 55 years old, is married and a mother of 5 children. She lives in the city of Aley, in the mountains. Hind has been doing handicraft work since the age of 19. She produces beautiful and unique pieces of embroidery. Hind works upon request, but she also tries to participate in locA. fairs from time to time in order to keep her name known on the market. Through the revenue she receives from her work, Hind has been able to help her husband cover their family's basic needs and better their children's lives.

Hind has already received a loan from Majmoua in the past. This time, she needs a loan of $300 to buy the necessary materials to produce her embroideries.

Hind is part of a group loan with other women in her village. The group loan is a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending theory is based on the idea that small loans and group solidarity help to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages collaboration in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool toward economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: Purchase material for her embroidery work

loans.name: Temor Shah
