texts.en: Temor Shah lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young and talented boy. He lives with his own family. He has a retail shop where he works. He is in university, and he works part-time in his shop. Now he wants to increase his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, twin-packs, and triple-packs to complete his stock and enlarge his business. He wants to make a good income to help his family and make a better future for himself. He is happy.

loans.use: To buy extra inventory such as boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, twin-packs, and triple-packs to complete his stock.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem S. M., age 30, is a vendor selling fruits, earning around $1.60 each day of profit. Her husband is a pharmacist, earning about $9 each day in revenue. They have four children, three who are too young to attend school and one who is a student. Hem would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase more medical supplies and fruits for their inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more medical supplies and fruits for their inventory.

loans.name: Bahtiyer

texts.en: Bahtiyer I. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has 3 children.  I. Bahtiyer heard a lot about MicroInvest and decided to apply to MicroInvest for a business development loan. It improved his business and he opened business making wood windows frames and doors. He has the appropriate knowledge and has been working as the carpenter for the last 10 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: for purchasing wood

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 59-year-old man. He lives in the Beirut suburbs with his wife and their 3 children. This is the third time Ali is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs US$ 1000 to buy 'hubble bubbles' (hookahs, water pipe devices for smoking) to develop his little business. The generated revenues will help his son open up a furniture paint shop.

loans.use: To buy 'hubble bubbles' (hookahs) to expand his little business

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is a budding entrepreneur that lives with her father and mother in the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal. She owns and operates a small beauty salon from her parents’ home. Every afternoon, women in the close-by neighborhood invade the family’s living room, which is turned into the beauty salon. Even though she doesn’t have to pay the rental for a local shop, Mariana thinks that it’d be better if she could get her own place where she can attend to her customers comfortably. With her loan, she will buy a new hair dryer and a large quantity of materials that she needs to carry out her job and satisfy her customers’ needs. That will allow Mariana to increase her revenue and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials for a small beauty parlor.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi M.  is a seamstress and a trader. She sells lining and clothing materials. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing well and she is helping her husband meet the financial needs of the family. She wishes to improve upon her business but she has financial limitations.

She is requesting $1025 as additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
In the district of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Mr. José Santos C. is dedicated to the agriculture and livestock industry, which he serves in his district Flor de Azalea (Azalea Flower) where he lives together with his family, made up of his wife and seven children, some adults and other younger children.

His strength in work is cultivating livestock. He has always been dedicated to giving technical assistance to his crops through fumigation and care to obtain a good harvest. Now he needs to acquire the economic resources to invest in his livestock business such as the purchase of cows for their respective development and to obtain milk for sustenance and for commercialization. For this reason he seeks support from Ceprodel to be a beneficiary of a loan that will allow him to succeed in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor José Santos C. se dedica al negocio agropecuario el cual atiende en su comarca Flor de Azalea donde vive en conjunto con su familia compuesta por su esposa y siete hijos unos adultos y otros pequeños.

Su fuerte en el trabajo es el cultivo así como la ganadería o pecuario, siempre se ha dedicado a dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos por medio de la fumigación y cuido para obtener una buena cosecha. Actualmente la necesidad que el atraviesa es que necesita adquirir el recurso económico para invertirlo en su negocio agropecuario tanteen los cultivos como en la compra de vacas para su respectivo desarrollo y así obtener de ellas la leche para alimentarse y comercializarla. Por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cows for livestock

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana, an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she sells women’s clothing in the local market, is married with two children. She started her business venture over seven years ago and presently has about $1000 in inventory and earns a monthly profit of about $500.

Svetlana is a skilled and experienced entrepreneur, tracking market trends in order to keep her business relevant to the demand of customers. She is seeking a loan of $1,100 to acquire assorted merchandise, boost her sales and provide for her family needs. She is hoping to use business profits to invest in her children’s college education. Svetlana has been working with Nadiya Ukraine for over three years.

loans.use: To increase product variety.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a widow. She lives in Korolyovo and supports herself by operating a business selling clothing and footwear in the central market of her home town. Nataliya offers a nice selection of assorted merchandise. She has been in this business for 5 years. Her current monthly profit is $600. 

Nataliya has been using the services of Nadiya Ukraine for awhile. She is constantly seeking to be even more efficient and successful in her business. Nataliya is hoping to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase her stock of assorted merchandise and meet the growing demand of her customers. Her determination and focus on success makes her an aspiring and promising entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles tiene 33 años, cuida y vive con sus ancianos padres.  Hace 5 años decidió tener su propia granja de cuyes con todas las normas técnicas debidas, negocio que le permite tener ahora 300 de estos animalitos. Las ventajas de criar cuyes es la rentabilidad de la misma, por lo que no dudó en aprender esta actividad, sobre todo porque él ha estudiado la carrera de agronomía, lo que le permite tener conocimientos para el correcto cuidado. Adicionalmente, a su negocio, trabaja en el ministerio de agricultura como capacitador en temas agrícolas, de esa manera, desarrolla su carrera, de manera dependiente y también independiente con su granja de cuyes.
Aquiles se esfuerza mucho porque quiere tener algo bueno en la vida, que le permita tener una economía  sostenible.
Solicita este crédito porque también desea incursionar en la ganadería, para lo cual invertirá  en la compra de un torete y también en la mejora de la infraestructura de su granja.
texts.en:
Aquiles is a 33-year-old man who lives with and looks after his elderly parents. Five years ago, he decided to set up his own guinea pig farm that met all the technical standards. This farm allows him to raise 300 of these small animals. The advantage of raising guinea pigs is its profitability, which is why he did not hesitate in learning about this business, especially since he studied agriculture in college. He was able to learn a lot about the proper care of animals while studying this major. Aside from his business, he also works as a facilitator at the Department of Agriculture, dealing with agricultural issues, which further helps him develop his guinea pig farm. Aquiles works hard because he wants to have something good in his life that will allow him to earn a steady income. He is requesting this loan because he also wants to get into ranching, which is why he will invest in the purchase of a bull calf as well as in the improvement of his farm’s infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve infrastructure of guinea pig farm and purchase a bull calf to start ranching business

loans.name: Javlon

texts.en: Mr. J. Javlon is 29 years old and lives in the Spitamen region. He is very polite and kind by nature. He works hard to ensure a good future for his 3 children.  Mr. Javlon received his first loan from MicroInvest in 2008 and has been a reliable client. He had no problems repaying the previous loan.  Now he wants to take another loan to develop his business. Mr. Javlon trades in the local bazaar, selling house slippers and waterproof shoe covers. Mr. J. Javlon requests a business development loan of 2100 STJ (USD $625) for 3 months, to import new goods and increase his business.  He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To buy new goods for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a digital computer printer and a generator

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carmen tiene 46 años de edad,  habita en anexo a villa Libertad, en la capital de Managua, es soltera y no tiene hijos, logro poner una pulpería, aparte que vende tortillas, gas licuado, desde hace doce años, lo cual comenzó vendiendo solo tortillas, y frijoles, con dinero propio lo cual ahorro y puso la pulpería, con este crédito quiere para invertir en materia prima en la compra de granos básicos y aceite, lo cual se vende mas. A largo plazo desea terne una distribuidora para hacer crecer su capital, y poder subsistir.
texts.en:
Carmen is 46 years old and lives in the Villa Libertad neighborhood of Managua. She is single and does not have children. For twelve years she has had a small general store where she sells tortillas and cooking gas. She began her business by selling tortillas and beans. She used her own money and saved until she had enough to open the store. She plans to invest this loan in staple ingredients such as grains and oil, her store's most popular items. In the long term, she would like to become a distributor so that her profits will increase and she will be able to live well.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and oil

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is 32 years old. She is divorced and has no children. Usually she sells clothing at the market, but during Christmas holidays she sells decorations. This is something she likes to do, and it yields good profit -- about 4,000 UAH during the holiday season.

Larisa would like to get a loan of 5,500 UAH to increase her inventory. The decorations she offers her clients are not very expensive and are in high demand. Larisa believes that the loan would help her to make good sales this holiday season.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of decorations this holiday season

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: L. Kossi est âgé de 42 ans et gagne sa vie en conduisant un véhicule taxi à Lomé la capital du Togo; ces derniers temps il a problème de moteur et passe tout son temps au garage. Il désire emprunter pour acheter une nouvelle moto et s’engage à rembourser son crédit sur une période de 21 mois avec des versements journaliers. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
L. Kossi is 42 years old and earns his living driving a taxi in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Most recently, he has had engine problems and spends all his time at the garage. He would like to borrow money to buy a new moto taxi and promises to repay his loan within 21 months with daily deposits. He is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new moto

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Maria Elena es conviviente, tiene 39 años, cuatro hijos de 19,18,14 y 12 años estudian en la escuela estatal. 
Maria es enfermera técnica, con especialidad en geriatría, actualmente trabaja como enfermera particular; ella tiene el negocio de servicio de moto-taxi en Lurín.  Maria con toda su familia se fue a vivir a Lurín, hace cuatro años, a una zona rustica donde no  había como trasportarse, y con sus ahorros compró una moto-taxi y la puso a trabajar.   
Desde que es socia de Finca, recibe capacitaciones de cómo llevar su negocio, esta contenta  con el préstamo que recibe,  le gustan mucho las reuniones por que se encuentra con sus amigas.
Ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, para hacer una bajada de motor, a su moto-taxi.
El sueño de Maria Elena es poner en su casa una botica, por que no hay por la zona.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the communal bank Mi Buen Pastor. She is 39 years old and lives with her common law husband. She has four children ages 19, 18, 14 and 12 who study at the state school. Maria Elena is a technical nurse who specializes in geriatrics. She currently works as a private nurse. She also has a motorbike taxi business in Lurin. Maria Elena moved to Lurin with her family four years ago. She moved to a rural area where there were no means of transportation and with her savings she bought a motorbike which she put to work as a taxi. Since becoming a member of FINCA, she receives training on how to manage her business. She is very happy with the loan she receives and enjoys the meetings because she gets to see friends. Maria Elena needs a loan of 1000 soles to change the motor of her motorbike taxi. Her dream is to open a drug store in her home as there isn't one in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the motor in her motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Alma Godety

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León la dama Alma F. se dedica a atender su pulpería que ha logrado surtir gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos en su negocio.
Es de importancia destacar que ha logrado salir adelante beneficiando a su familia la cual ama mucho. La dama Alma con el propósito de continuar mejorando su pulpería hoy en día requiere de la inversión en productos para la venta y es por este motivo que ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote in Leon, Nicaragua, Ms. Alma F. works in her grocery store that has become successful thanks to her great efforts. It is important to highlight that she has achieved success while benefiting her family, whom she loves very much. Alma, with the goal of continuing to improve her store, now requires an investment in products to sell. For this reason she is asking for a loan with Ceprodel in order to buy those products and continue to support her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand merchandise
